mpTmDJp6jOsysIEDdSCNeQ.text: As my bubby would say, "You're sooo skinny.  You should eat.  Your wife, she doesn't feed you?!?"  Okay.  I don't have a bubby, but I do love a good Jewish deli-style breakfast.  So I like to imagine that I do have a bubby and she wants me to eat more corned beef hash and eggs.  In Vegas, Weiss is the best option for a tasty Jewish breakfast option:   Bagels -- check.  Best bagels in town and an absolutely top-notch everything bagel.    Cream cheese and lox -- check.  I'm not a lox fan, but I took a smoked salmon fan here and she audibly moaned in appreciation of the fresh smoked salmon on cream cheese and a bagel,  Like I said, I don't really get the lox love, but this place has earned it.  Eggs -- check.  Perfectly prepared over-easy eggs.  Not too greasy.  Soft and runny yolks.  Love 'em.  Corned-Beef Hash -- check.   Rich and quality beef.  If you've only had hash frozen or out of a can, it will shock you how rich freshly-prepared hash tastes.  Fresh fruit -- check.  Add it all up and my imaginary bubby loves that I found this place.

ZojnxVVtckLRBXBS8iN98w.text: I'm sorry I have to post this I've heard so many good things about this place about 6 months ago I went in for lunch and believe me folks I write this with a heavy heart anyway I got a sandwich and potato salad to go it was a Saturday morning roughly 1030 11 a.m. By 7 o'clock that night I was so deathly ill I could not return to work until Wednesday the following week I called the health department and report of them I don't know what became of it I did not hear back.... If I remember correctly it was a corned beef sandwich that I had a pickle and potato salad I believe there was something wrong with the potato salad or the mayonnaise even the thought of that sandwich to this day makes me sick to my stomach I missed 4 days of work because of that.  Eater beware

n-r6hpngmZRQ-0AtcCh3hA.text: I love Weiss' Deli!  Food is always good, I eat here at least once if not twice a week.  One thing I just tried was their cheesecake, it was outstanding.  I am a classically trained French Chef and have made my own. Their cheesecake is better than Cheesecake Factory too.  It only comes in original but it's great. You gotta try a piece.

hY6Tm1UBym8GWSVsq-cFKQ.text: Weiss is amazing! Incredible food, wonderful portions, and great service! It is totally a whole in the wall, but perfect atmosphere! Jaques (spelling?) is one the of nicest servers ever! He always take such good care of us when we come in. Often times there is a line, but it is ALWAYS worth the wait! This is our go to Deli!

uLRlHDiM_0hnmlntZzKijQ.text: Let me start by saying I think I just had a subpar experience. This is a little lengthy, but hear me out.  I went here with 4 other adults. Three of us arrived and sat and the other 2 joined within about 5 minutes. We waited hardly any time for someone to take our drink order, but there was a significant wait for our order. I order the pancake breakfast with eggs over hard, bacon, and I tried to order home fries with no onions. I was told that was not possible to do without onions. I asked if there were any potato options without onions and she said no. So I asked if I could get corned beef hash instead and she was going to charge me as a side (full price, not a sub price). I didn't want to tack on an extra $5.25 to my price and didn't think that was completely fair so I passed. The options I was given were a side of tomatoes or fruit, which I didn't want either. I asked if I could just get extra bacon and she agreed. I feel like these are pretty lame options just because someone doesn't like onions, but such is my life. Then after asking for bacon the waitress said "there are onions in the corned beef hash anyway." Uh, ok. Not sure why that wasn't mentioned when I asked to get them. That would have saved a lot of back and forth.  The food finally arrives and it looks great. The syrup on the other hand.... not good. It came with 2 very large pancakes and I was given 2 small packs of kraft syrup. The syrup was nasty. It was thicker than honey and had to be spread with a knife. My mom had the same meal and told the waitress, "um the syrup...." and she interrupted and said "oh, I know what you're going to say" and quickly walked off. She came back with a pack warmed up from hot water. It made no difference at all. Hot or lukewarm, the syrup was thick and nasty. It was a below average pancake experience, which I didn't know was even possible. To make this not a complete bitch-fest, the eggs and bacon were cooked right at least.  The waitress was busy and believe me, I have very reasonable expectations from servers since I used to work in a restaurant. She was very short with us. She was foreign so I know that is a factor, but sometimes you need to show some empathy when you have to tell someone bad news, or when they ask things from you.  I have heard such great things from Weiss deli that I was looking forward to eating here, but was let down. If I could make a recommendation to them would be to have better syrup, and able to pour from a container. The syrup was so thick and messy (and not tasty) my hands were sticky, and the bathroom was locked so I couldn't wash them.   I would come here again, but I wouldn't order the same thing. I tasted my husband's french toast and it was very good. He had strawberries and whip cream on them so he didn't use the syrup. I noticed most of their food had onions, so I think my choices would be limited if they won't let me hold the onions. I'm not in a hurry to come back though.

r7Ng_mQlebGfWgW3JjW7WQ.text: We absolutely LOVE this restaurant. I'm going to give lots of praise to the the wonderful food and busy accommodating service, however I do have a huge complaint I hope management would take into consideration and address someday. First the food... it is tasty, well prepared, always fresh, perfectly deli-ish, plentiful,  and priced fairly.  We've probably gone for breakfast there about 50 times, and it has never disappointed. Special shout out to one particular server Jacques who is super on top of things and polite. But now, a major complaint we have... it would never stop us from coming back, but we are begging Weiss to install baby changing stations in the bathrooms! The single bathrooms seem to have plenty of room for the wall mounted pull down kind, and there's even often a bunch of supplies in the way which is already a bit of an eye sore. I get that the place is busy and cramped, but they really do need to get a touch more family friendly in this regard. It's hard to sit anywhere with a carrier to begin with, and no changing table just makes it that much harder to want to come back.  Lastly, two minor nit picks... please consider flavored individual coffee creamers, and please consider some crayons and drawing sheets for kids. You're wonderful Weiss, I just hope you can make your guests a bit more comfortable.

aVrvccWps5oOSIRLMLInvg.text: BEST Philly cheesesteak I've EVER had!!! The food, the service, everything is worthy of five stars. My boyfriend and I spent my birthday downtown, and cured our hangovers with some Weiss lunch. The food was cheaper and incredibly more delicious than anything else we've found in the city. Worth the trip and worth the prices! I can't brag on this place enough.

EXJ2Z8avJy4wS2DvbqfWRg.text: I almost missed out and ordered a simple Everything and Lox.    The waitress suggested, instead, the Lox platter.  I am glad she did.  The in-house, hand-sliced Lox pretty much put to instant shame any Lox I ever had when living in New York.  It literally made me swoon when coupled with the fresh fruits and veggies on the platter (including good grade olives and a pickled green tomato).  My colleague ordered the Hash, and said it was comparable to what his grandmother used to make.  He encouraged me to try it, although I have never liked Corned Beef Hash, I figured I'd give it a chance.  I am now a fan, at least of Weiss' Hash; enough of a fan that I may order that the next time I am visiting.  And there will be a next time, if I have anything to say about it.  It's worth a  cab ride from the strip.  Just make sure you don't get long-hauled via the Interstate.

mxDXOFl_87b_nVR3lhSqiw.text: I get the same thing every time. The celie. Top left box on the menu. Large latke layer of brisket, layer of munster, another latke, layer of provolone all topped with dark brown gravy! Yummmmo!

PqmhjfZdUXyxtvjHbXaATA.text: Place has awesome food. It is the closest thing to a NY kosher deli I have seen since I moved to Vegas! I would recommend the pastrami sandwich and the soup to anyone. It could be a little more organized but still great!

VlF7EjYJt88NlCn7po9miQ.text: My first visit to Weiss had the ceilys stack....two potato latkes stuffed with braised brisket topped with cheese and brown sauce served with sour cream...wow...will come back for reuben and or egg salad...huge portions of comfort food.

c1OMtdMo8u5cF8yLS_d-Ug.text: Jewish penicillin a bowl of chiken noodle soup when the waitress says the large bowl is very large listen I couldn't finish it, very very good it hit the spot the I just got sick and that was just what I needed. I will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Jewish penicillin a bowl of chiken noodle soup:-)

8OaLrlgIrel1-pCfkQhPng.text: Great spot - excellent, authentic food, friendly and attentive service, nice low-key setting. Such a great option in the Vegas area, glad it's here. Highlights: any sandwich here is great; the potato salad and chopped liver; and the chocolate egg cream. Gonna try the baked goods next time, they looked delicious.

eIg6WKCGuqQuz7VkdrS3Aw.text: First time at this establishment. Food was satisfactory but service was very poor. I normally tip every server especially since we live in Vegas but when I encounter poor service I refuse to tip. For a server to follow you out of the establishment and yell,  " Wait until you come next time!" is unacceptable. It's unfortunate to see family operated business hire staff like "Margie" who don't belong in the hospitability food and beverage industry. It is why many people would rather go to Applebees's or Chilli's where service to customers are followed by strict corporate standards. I will never eat here again!!!

Lxnz_rtQSalNul9fT0wAOg.text: When I think of a deli I think of place where locals go to eat. Good food, good prices and nice big portions. I moved here last year and fell in love with this place. The food is so good, the staff are so friendly and the portions are very generous. I could eat here everyday until the end of time and still not be tired of the food.

mFXKkLf_C8tUUeiR7TmXfw.text: Bagels are amazing!!!!!! I've recommended this deli to all my friends who want authentic bagels.

z1nC5QMAWJNqTP8MjMFVDw.text: The white fish salad sandwich was just okay. Nothing special and a little overpriced. I don't appreciate when I'm told that they don't have any water and offered to buy bottled water for $2.50. So your Coke machine works just fine but there is no water? Shame on you!  I wish they didn't hire these young guys who look if they are skipping high school: I don't expect anything special from a server but I don't want to wait for ten minutes for my check, I expect to get my drink refilled after I was asked if I want it refilled and finally, when I'm trying to remind him about the refill I don't appreciate being told "Have a nice day".

UPewlFnwl9DyeuVSv2RMjg.text: The food is solid, the portions are big, and the prices are great. I keep coming back! Best breakfast in town for the price. I normally get the mother of all hash which comes with two egg and choice of potato pancake, and bagel. I end up splitting it with someone because its a lot of food for under 10$. I just get extra eggs.

kzRmEH6c0eAAzfg16Erc2w.text: We went to this deli yesterday and boy we were surprised. The food is outstanding the service was great. When we went in there was a sine that said seat your self. I thought ok let's see how this goes. As already stated it went great. The wife wants to go back in the morning for breakfast

PmCBamtnjVAZDXTwZfkf8A.text: By far this has to be the best breakfast spot in town.. All the food is GREAT... I don't think you can order a bad thing here.. The portions are huge make sure you come with a large appetite especially if your gonna order lunch.. One full order of the lunch sandwich will last you a few days ..  My wife is also in love with this place.. Just make sure come a bit early they usually have a lot of business. No more than a 10 min wait... Make sure you give this place a try..

mHveUEiHJo900sFYO9aRbA.text: Visiting old but favourite restaurants. This place is always jammed.  This Sunday Morning no exception.  Authentic Jewish Deli and offerings.  Latkes, corned beef piled high on homemade Jewish Rye (delicious!), Pastrami, assorted homemade bagels, and the best best best chicken soup anywhere!  Dozens of egg choices and as many sandwiches too.  Pickled tomatoes, kosher dills, potato salad, all so very delicious.   Staff are familiar faces who've worked here for years.  Friendly, efficient, quality, great prices.  Outside seating where pets are welcome.  There's a take out deli/bakery.  Always a must visit when visiting Henderson and Las Vegas.  Try it, you won't be disappointed.

f5iN6OmUzN8T4QtwluUANg.text: I'm still not sure if our experience was perhaps a joke for a TV show. The service here cannot be stated as poor. It can only be described as bizarre and not a serious effort. If this were a skit on TV, you would say, impossible. Could never happen in real life.   Dinner today at Weiss Deli. The server finally took our order once we asked. I asked for my beverage, and the appetizer first. Neither ever arrived before the food. I asked twice more for my beverage. The response each time was "he is getting it". I never quite understood who 'he' was. It finally came, but only halfway through my meal. Guess he finally got around to it.   The appetizer never came. We asked, she said she forgot. I guess with all the fun in the back room, it's easy to forget. You see, the staff could be heard throughout the restaurant loudly talking and laughing in the back area. This is while we wait and wait for service? I felt bad we were such a nuisance, it surely will never happen again.       During the meal, no sighting of the server at all. Nothing such as 'do you need anything else', or 'is your food ok?' We did need some things, but figured, what's the use unless we get up and go into the kitchen.   As we ate, one guy stacking chairs in half the restaurant, mopping floors, etc. Are you KIDDING ME? Who does this while customers trying to eat a nice meal? I felt like I was eating in a bathroom. Blatant disregard for customers.   I would like to share with the owner that although it might be difficult to find decent help, you have missed the mark completely. I cannot believe this could be your customary level of service, and hope you are as shocked reading this, as we were with the level of service. You need to take action immediately and find staff that understands how to deliver at least mediocre service. But surely, for the prices, your customers ultimately deserve good service.   There is no need for the food review. It doesn't matter how the food was, because no sensible person would go back and subject themselves to this nonsensical theater of the absurd.

8Y2Pb4eY05bvN-jGl7rbsw.text: The food is OK but i do not like at all the way they slice the bread? The long way! To much bread and to little corned beef. Also it is a very Pricey Deli. If your on a budget DO NOT EAT THERE!

MTwMtLOeUXkJ2wTBGX8OBQ.text: Had the LEO (Lox, Onions & Eggs) and it was great.  Like the bagel a lot too.  Service was good.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area!  Next time I'll come for lunch and try the Corned Beef.

O8BF8Qgt0t3S4UMi3XVmaQ.text: Yes, soup for you!     I finally made my way over to Weiss, a bookmark for forevah-evah.  Located in the same shopping plaza as Trader Joe's on the corner of Sunset and Green Valley Parkway, other Yelpers have raved about the food here and they're not wrong.  The matzoh ball chicken noodle soup is delectable and the small order is only $5.95, but it's more than enough to warm the stomach and soul. And, that matzoh is one big ball! I loved it so much that I came back a week later for another dose plus a half pastrami on rye sandwich--a delectable duo.  I've looked at the bakery items both times, but nothing seemed that appealing, so I'll just stick with the restaurant.  Get your tuches over for your fix of some of this comfort food, too: your taste buds will get verklempt.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzoh ball chicken noodle soup- that&#39;s a big ball.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Half pastrami sandwich.

yI4jloZc4figsflNLo6hUA.text: Maybe I didn't order the right things.. Maybe I came at a bad time...   I had high expectations of Weiss after seeing so many Yelp elites give 5 stars, however I was disappointed by what I got. The presentation of my sandwich was pretty horrendous and the cleanliness of the floors/tables was a little worrisome. The matzoh ball soup? Good, but not worth all of the exclamation marks!!!!!!! and CAPITALS LETTERS i saw on previous reviews.   3/5, maybe I need to give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. :(
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. meh....

y7Xp7MOFn0XMAxw8zQF-IQ.text: This is a hidden gem. I try to have a bite here before shopping at Trader Joe's nearby, to keep me from over-shopping! Service is very good, as is the food. Takeout deli worth a visit, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami on rye.

rsymylQqNoKKfRJY81I1zA.text: Today the service was at an all time low. I've had horrible service here before, but kept coming back because the food was so good. However this visit, the food is not making up for the service. I waited 40 minutes before I got my food. I asked to speak with the manager and no one came out. Guess my 6 years of dining here is finally over. I've had all I can take!

PItSgxoTgSlqohZXQt9htQ.text: I've been wanting to take the bf here for quite some time. I used to eat here all the time several years ago, but for whatever reason it had been a while since I'd been back.  Food is exactly as I remembered it. Actually better. At first I was planning to order the pastrami burger, then the open face turkey sandwich.... But thank goodness I kept looking, because I found the open face brisket with mashed & gravy and immediately remembered why I love this place. This is totally a cheat meal for me, but who cares when it is this delicious!   The bf also had difficulty deciding on one thing. He kept going back & forth between the sandwiches named after famous people. He ended up getting the pastrami sandwich with Russian dressing & liver pate/mouse (not exactly sure but that's what it looked/tasted like to me. *He's asleep so I can't ask him. Anyway whatever it was, the sandwich was ginormous. Crazy big. When I took my obligatory I have to try everything bite... I actually had to first bite the bottom pastrami part them go back for a second bite of the list pate. After I took the bite... The bf said it didn't even look like I had taken a bite. Seriously the sandwich was big.   He also ordered a black/white shake, and I love a place that has fresh brewed ice tea.  I know it's common... But  I consider iced tea to be a treat for myself so I'm always sad when the place has that fake soda iced tea nonsense.   Our service was quick & friendly. It took us longer than normal (which is usually typical for us) to order, but our server was very good. And came back right as we had just decided. Kept our drinks refilled & brought us to go boxes without us having to ask.  Also the French fries (served with his sandwich) were quite good. I liked dipping them in my gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. French toast ham sandwich (the bf ordered, I think it was a special)
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich with liver pate, served with a side of fries.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Open faced brisket on white bread with mashed &amp; gravy. Delicious!

dM33t5H6UYRPC_gI2FYRGQ.text: Woot woot!  New after church breakfast favorite!    My 8 year old gets a little fussy about going shopping after church.  We were heading into TJ when I decided to detour into Weiss's.  My plan was to buy her a black and white cookie.  This was derailed.  "I want to eat here.  I need pancakes.  It's daddy's birthday."  Boy, that kid did have a point.  So this little treasure is tucked away in the corner of the strip mall and I don't think I had realized what amazing food was in store for us.    Since they make their bagels there, I decided nova lox cream cheese on a sesame bagel.  Little chunks of lox (AKA brine salmon) is blended into the cream cheese.  I could tell that the bagel was fresh.  Delightful!  $5.75 for this yummy goodness.  My hubby had the special fresh toast with a ton of fruit.  There was so much berries that he was able to have a bite of berries with every bit of fresh toast.  $8.99  Little one got a single pancake, but they baked chocolate chips into the pancake as well as topped it with chocolate chips.  She was in heaven.  This was the first time that she ate so much pancake that we didn't need a to go container.  Services was a little slow to start with, but once our servicer was at our table, he promptly checked up on us, food came out fast, and he was super friendly.  We will be back!  Yum!!

kwoCyaSwd1V34H3a_y-38A.text: Excellent staff and classic Jewish deli menu. The selections include many standards and several original recipes.   I have more than two dozen visits for breakfast and lunch. The entrees I've enjoyed are many. Here is a sample. The Classic; The Remington; Corned Beef Sandwich; Pastrami Sandwich; Matzo Ball Soup. All are served with care, freshly prepared, and perfectly seasoned for phenomenal quality and flavor.     The Matzo Ball Soup is the best I have ever tasted. Period.   Treat yourself to to this delicious deli treasure. You will not be disappointed.   Enjoy, then thank me for sharing!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned Beef with Swiss on Rye. Yummmmmmm!

ahFJ-kSfTd_CfJ3VrxOeNA.text: Not sure what the hype is... not being the biggest fan of traditional Jewish food, yet my hubby was craving an east coast Jewish style Rueben or similar sandwich, so we went.... standing at the door, seemingly invisible, we waited for at least 10 minutes as bussers and servers walked past. Finally, a busser offered us a booth, food scattered underfoot from the previous guest, we sat down.   The busser asked our drink orders, hot tea for me, water for my hubby. He returns a few minutes later, and a server comes over behind him. Friendly, but obviously hurried by her quick fire questions, we placed our orders. Not a lot for me with the style of food offered, I just got a grilled chicken sandwich, quite boring, I guess. Hubby ordered the Clary Silver, ginormous and enough for two or three people. Rye bread with pastrami, corned beef and cole slaw. He also ordered a potato latke with a side of applesauce. He said the Clary Silver was amazing, and finished it all. I tried the potato latke, salty and starchy, it's a potato pancake....  Personally, I'm just not a fan, but my hubby thought it was good. The place needs a good cleaning though in my opinion. He did mention the men's restroom was a bit messy.  Bill, minus tip, was $34 I believe.

A3bLkSfEwDqYw7DQXWbtGw.text: WOW!!!  We decided to order Thanksgiving dinner from the deli because I didn't feel like cooking and we could order two dinners since they had no minimum required.  When we picked it up today, we could not believe what we got.  The portions are huge and they are packed beautifully so that heating everything will be super easy.  For a little over $18.00 each we got a total feast and we know everything will be wonderful.  Our thanks go to Michael and his staff at Weiss Deli.

RDxDP__RFCpkGNXXQ_pJ7g.text: Growing up in the Bronx, I was really excited to find what seemed to be a good Jewish restaurant out here, as that is something I haven't had the pleasure of enjoying in probably 20 years. Unfortunately, my excitement didn't last long, as my experience was more disappointing than impressive.   My wife and I went when they opened at 8 am, and seated ourselves as directed by the sign at the door. We were the first customers of the morning, so we picked a 2 seater towards the front. I don't usually really care too much about how a place looks, as long as it isn't dirty. This place looks like it was straight out of the lower east side of Manhattan, nothing fancy about it at all, or even pretending to be, with crooked pictures of their food and catering menus on the walls, walls which looked like they're still waiting for the paint job they needed back in 1977. Like I said though, I'm not too concerned with the place being fancy, as long as it's clean, and some of the best meals I've ever had were served in placed that looked like dumps, so that didn't really bother me, I'm just pointing it out to those who may be interested in the decor.  We were immediately approached by the bus boy who took our drink orders, 2 iced teas. He returned with our drinks a moment later and then came our server. My wife ordered "the usual", which is bacon, egg and cheese on a kaiser roll, and I got "the killer", which is pork roll, bacon, ham, egg and cheese, also on a kaiser roll. The food took probably 5 minutes to come out and was impressive at first glance, until I realized there was nothing on the plates of sandwiches but the sandwiches. My wife enjoyed her food, so I'll only speak on mine. Don't get me wrong, the sandwich itself was absolutely delicious, but for $11.95 I would have expected something more on the plate. Some potatoes? A slice of pickle? Hell, gimme a piece of lettuce or an orange slice as a garnish like the Black Bear diner does across the street. The bus boy refilled our drinks without being asked, which was nice, and then our server brought the bill: $25.63 (before the tip) for 2 sandwiches with no sides and 2 glasses of iced tea.  I'm not cheap by any stretch of the imagination, we eat breakfast out probably 4 mornings out of 5, but I do believe in at least getting what I pay for. This same bill at the Black Bear would have left us stuffed to the gills and more than satisfied, with friendly, attentive service. OK, whatever, time to pay and go. I pull out my card and put it into the little folder, and place it to the edge of the table - y'know, the international sign for "please take this so I can go home and write my review." I wait. I wait some more. I wait even more. Now I'm getting annoyed. 34 minutes later, the server comes back to me and asks if we're OK, only because another customer came in and sat in her section. I said "yeah, this was ready a half hour ago" to which she replied "oh, I didn't know." Well you would have known if you had bothered to come out from the back instead of hanging out bs'ing with the cooks. We ate right away and you brought the bill right away, how long did you think we wanted to sit there admiring the scenery?   Anyway, I gave the place 2 stars only because the food itself tasted delicious, but that's it. Credit where it's due, my sandwich was tasty and well put together, but absolutely not worth $12 by itself on a plate. Will I go back? No. I'll gladly spend the same amount of money across the street at the Black Bear, eat like I'm going to the electric chair, and not get put on the "pay no mind" list.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The Killer

s0A_CeHe_VkwMKubS2_zog.text: Came to this place with my son for lunch. Everything looks nice and ok, normal restaurant. Waiter took my order very nicely and polite. I wait and wait, 3 tables were served and the people (party of 2) who was behind me to get the table were actually leaving because they finished eating. I asked my waiter if he can check my food for me when he screamed at me saying "my food is cooking" wow!!!! I have never had this experience before. I wanted to leave at that moment but my son (3 years old kid) was waiting  for his pancakes. After that he never came back to the table to check on us. Horrible horrible service of that waiter. NEVER back again!

qAx7e96YqT1mASqMdHcMag.text: This is 100% my favorite place to got to! The food is off the charts good! Lol so good i ate jt all before i could take pics, sorry.   Love love the ice coffee. Its mind blowing. I must get a stash of the stuff.  I promise u can't find something that isn't AMAZING!  The only little problem is the servers arent very pleasant at time. I love the young guy and usually the person who sets the table and gets ur drink. However the older lady taking the order is rude and not someone i look forward to interacting with.

oX7fvFeADjbY6_Vum-P15g.text: Our second time here, while visiting our daughter. The food is delicious, generous portions and authentic deli!  I mostly want to express how much I appreciated our young server, Jaques. He was relaxed and professional, polite beyond expectation.  Far too frequently, we are greeted with aloofness, bordering on indifference.  I observed Jaques with other patrons and his demeanor was the same. Thank you for making our breakfast an enjoyable experience Jaques, wishing you much success!

6BGGV3KnWlFBL2_e4eZl2Q.text: For the past few years we come to this establishment about every two weeks.   I have over 46 years in food service management.  Food is great, when it arrives.   Your service is definitely slipping.   On the past few visits, never got refills, french fries never brought with sandwich, this was after asking twice, or just wrong order brought to table.   You need a core of experienced staff to work with the new ones.  We rarely have the same server come back to our table on the same visit.  Very hit and miss.  Have a supervisor table touch, to make sure everyone is up to date.  We are planning on coming by around 12:30 again today, and this will be the make or break visit.   You have been open for quite awhile, where is the manager?  Perhaps should be on the floor and not in the office?   Thanks Todd

sEuSLVjAPVXHdcu9FHM9aw.text: I've been yearning for some kosher deli for sometime. My friend recommended this place. The only thing. It's kosher style. The sandwiches were very good. The rye bread was excellent. The knish was OK. I felt they could have offered more than a slice of pickle and a half of sour tomato. I'm used to the wait staff giving us a bowl. It's not NY. The wait staff service was very good. I'll return to this venue!!

Ib4ahp746UmJUUwdQaJpSg.text: This is my absolute favorite deli in town. I love to eat on the patio and people watch while eating some of the best food on the planet. Huge portions. Try the open faced Ruben!  Love it. The look in the restaurant is unassuming...  the food and clientele is top notch.  Famous people eat here. ;)

7EbiwsG9Um7Id4lV5Lxd1w.text: I love Weiss Deli! They have the best chicken noodle soup and Matzo ball soup I have ever had. The potato salad is so good and the tuna salad is tasty, too! Just know that portions are huge and a sandwich can easily be shared by two. I'd give them 5 stars if the atmosphere were better. They used to have ---subjectively---ugly art displayed on the walls, but have recently removed those pieces and adorned the walls with photographs of their food instead. The food is great though and I've never experienced poor service there.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

wXn7CTmx9lpdrLYu14p2PQ.text: Okay, I need to preface this review with a confession.  I am a total rookie when it comes to deli's.  I didn't know what to order and when the waitress was finally looking at me for my order, I panicked and got a burger.  Needless to say, I was given a hard time.  I knew that I was going against the grain when everyone else was ordering matza ball  soup and pastrami sandwiches.  But, to my defense, they had a burger on the menu, so I can only take half the responsibility.  The burger was okay, and knew I made a mistake as I was getting jealous of the soup.  Next time, and there will be a next time, I will get the soup.    Service was alright and there wasn't an empty table in the place.  So, that speaks volumes.

joclSOBZG4EGF-jR4Ov8FQ.text: I've been coming here for years and this is one of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas. Their pancakes are outstanding and the chicken noodle and matzoh ball soup is a must try. Literally everything on the menu is great. You must check this place out!

iFcbpAWS168PG4prT0JXjw.text: Food is great, but seating is a nightmare. Not enough tables and you're squeezed in the sardines. I had pastrami sandwich with potato salad, hubby had corned beef. We both liked the food. Next time we will do the late lunch or early bird hours to beat the crowds!

U-5m6hZ0-VnwbKp8V1wMMQ.text: I love this place, Family owned  and operated,  and yes while the service can be slow at times he food is consistently the best!  PS You can order 1/2 sizes on sandwiches and soups which I'd do unless you plan to take the rest home or share it!  :-)    Enjoy!

vEJmq5afB83N6BimfKJBxA.text: I feel sorta bad for Hendersonians.  They have Weiss, Summerlin has Bagel Cafe as the resident Jewish deli.  For the record, Bagel Cafe destroys Weiss.  I've tried the baked goods and the deli food.  The hamantaschen, rugelach, and black & white cookies at Weiss are not very good. The filling in both the hamantaschen and rugelach seemed to rely more on a gel-like substance than fruit.  The cookies, a little stale.  Passable, but not something I would buy again.   The matzoh balls here also taste a little off...I really can't explain it. Rubbery?   Their corned beef, however, is decent as are the bagels.   But, Jewish deli is serious business.  Weiss just doesn't pull it off successfully.

zwA3koilCIx9J2q4MCk1Zg.text: Food is great.   Service is slow.   They had one server for a full restaurant.   Been coming here for years.   We love the lox

SppxzjW8W_OuWLygNNMS3A.text: This is a pretty nice place. They have amazing chicken noodle soup and are not over priced. I came here when I was feeling under the weather since I'd hear from a friend they had decent soup so I came and I got some. I don't regret it! The atmosphere is nothing special but it's a really nice family place. I recommend trying it!

VkM2AUQ9_WorR_KYvO9uUQ.text: This place deserves every one of those stars and some!! The food is absolutely phenomenal. The Ceilly was one of, if not the tastiest thing I've ever eaten. The chicken noodle soup is off the charts amazing and by far the best I've found in town. The staff from the 2 visits I've made so far all seem to be really great people. The experience in general is pretty cool. It's a bland looking simple restaurant when it comes to the decor but what they lack in decoration they definitely make up for in the food department. On a plus side it doesn't look like or feel like the cookie cutter restaurants that you walk into all over Las Vegas. It has a grandma and grandpa feel and that good ol home cooking grub. While I was waiting for my food I watched every plate come out of the kitchen and I honestly would've eaten any one of the items that I saw come out. Every dish looked scrumdiddlyumpcious! I highly recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Sooooo good black and white milkshake

SStda9_H2H64FxfgaGYmgA.text: What a gem! I could eat a gallon of their homemade cream cheese and I have never met a bagel here I didn't like. The chicken  noodle soup is better than anything anyone's grandma has ever made. There, I said it. Come hungry because every portion is quite large. They can be really busy and there may be a bit of wait, but just sit and wait and admire their never ending lunch and breakfast menus. You will not be disappointed.

8G2XWVJGLS9kfuyXz_DdMA.text: Short and sweet:  Friendly, fast service. Small, slightly cramped space. However, it is clean, bright, and inviting. Also conducive to my niece making friends with the table next to us rather quickly.  Food Ups:  HUGE portions... and even that doesn't do it justice. You *will* have leftovers, and you will want them.  The brisket was amazing and tender and juicy and seasoned perfectly. The stuffed portabello was tender and meaty (texture) and fantastic and the spinach filling was fresh and just the right amount of bright and crisp. The corned beef reuben with homemade kraut was excellent. The chopped liver was so amazing I got some to go.  The chicken noodle soup was fabulous. Lots of chicken, veg, and flavor. Not overly salted and very, very well done. Home made and heartwarming, absolute bliss.  Food Downs:  The potato pancakes were too thick and just too large. Plate size, two of them came with the brisket and all but overpowered everything else. The FLAVOR was great... but I think we all wanted something a little smaller, maybe a little crisp?  The amount of cheese on the stuffed portabello could give even the healthiest patron a coronary. It detracted from the rest (see above) of the amazing dish. Cheese as a garnish, yay! As a gravy? Not so much.  A great meal, truly. Maybe a 3.5... but most of it was such an upside (with some of the amazing stuff to go!) that I had to round up. I will definitely be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Potato pancakes and brisket
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Reuben

qNNbEO7sEkJQqlRDQyC6XQ.text: Not very welcoming! everyone seemed to be uncomfortable with the fact that my 14 year old walked in and had corn rows in his head and acted as if he was not welcome. The atmosphere was tense and the staff took for ever to even ask us for our drink order. The boy who took our drink order was rude and uncomfortable with us as well. Asked for the check for my sons sprite and left. This is not the first time this has happened with this restaurant before. If you are of any color this might not be the place for you! I think this place is only for people of Jewish decent because it is Certainly how not only the staff but the actual clientele act.

J0N14EmfpFhtxPUE6pau1Q.text: This is my second time here and both times I've really enjoyed my meal! They make the bread and bagels themselves and the service has always been good!  If you come on a Sunday morning, be prepared to wait a little bit because it's pretty packed!    I keep hearing their sandwiches are amazing and I look forward to trying them soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Homemade hash, eggs and potatoes
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

2prnP1sW99EuAQVVkqexXQ.text: Salty and expensive.  The portions are large but the average price of a sandwich is north of $15.

1MMWjzCqfS0FJUW_DGq_iw.text: Have been coming here for years but will not be returning. I guess they went cheap on the renovations because you are now crammed in eating on top of each other no room in the walkway chairs in the walkway blocking any proper passage through still crappy pictures still dirty all the renovations and still can't clean the ceiling fans go across the street to Black Bear.

Qvv-AcffND3KWTzvc5dJqQ.text: Weiss's has undergone quite a few changes since I first started going there. But they have finally hit their stride. The chopped liver is reminiscent of my Bubbe's, as was the whitefish salad. Weiss's is also the only place in the Valley that I know of who carries Dr. Brown's. If you like or need some Jewish soul food then Weiss's is your place. They may not be kosher, but they're "kosher" in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. A little nosh.

wu7XuTaEIQrvOJMBWPfb4Q.text: Ate lunch there today. Wonderful portion sizes- literally a sandwich and a half for one order. Enjoyed their patio seating area- just wish beverage refills came faster outside, a common problem at any establishment with an outdoor area. Great food, great price, good meal- and extremely friendly to the dogs.  Thanks guys will be back!

ezns6hDZEdqwiQW6dhLTRw.text: Best deli in town. Great for us ethnic types. I think even a goy would enjoy a little nosh here.  The booths could be a bit more comfortable but I think if they were the nap that I want after the gigantic pastrami would come to easily.   I will quit my kvetching and eat.   Mangiare.

l1shuWMVQFwMh6tyKXLu2g.text: This place is awesome. Great matzoh ball soup and sandwiches. If you are in the Vegas area this is probably the best place you can go to if you're looking for deli like you would find in New York City. It looks like a lot of older entertainers eat here as well. Reminds me of the Catskill Mountains.

1NGi2fGQ1vRQY6pPjtWSnQ.text: Ya gotta go.   Great family-owned place. Get your butt out of bed on the weekends for breakfast because they have amazing hash options and latkes. Lunch menu is good, too. Servers are friendly and speedy.  In some places they have two 4-seater tables pushed together so if you are a couple and there's a group with 3 (for example), you might be sitting in the same place. It's not weird and adds to the "family atmosphere."  Sometimes, especially on the weekends, it takes forever for someone to acknowledge you to be seated. I appreciate a, "Be right with you!" every now and then but once I waited 20 min before that happened.  Also good to try: Matzoh Ball soup!!

0P_LuX45LXu10QaKqHHS9A.text: Best deli in town! When I'm feeling sick... matza ball soup.... hungry...corn beef sandwich.... they have something for everyone and such great quality food! The spot is kind've hidden in the Trader Joe's shopping center, but not terribly hard to find. If you want authentic deli food definitely stop by here.. you won't be disappointed:)

q82GGy8vgIlEtxbDTHYIEw.text: It's like a real deli in New York City or something (: The Matzoh ball chicken noodle soup was awesome. The sandwiches are HUGE. & so are the desserts. I will be bringing my friends here (: The atmosphere is really nice. The sandwiches aren't particularly amazing but I'd still come here again.
