SEJeJR3kEC2WOl0xn00YhQ.text: Love it here, reminds me of Baltimore.  Pastrami sandwich on rye, potato salad, and matzo ball soup.

-3kni_4J4-T9zR1NTk3gBA.text: Best. Food. In. Vegas. The portion sizes are huge. Whenever I'm sick my husband picks me up fresh chicken noodle soup and potato pancakes. Highly recommend

nQQtjl1969veD4B2ax0zfQ.text: We go here all the time for breakfast and lunch.  We love the food and the service is good until we encountered two incidents!   My husband likes his egg over easy hard.   His eggs came and were runny.  He sent them back and they came back the same way so he sent them back.  Sharon who was our server rolled her eyes at him.  I should have said something but did not.  We just avoided siting in her area.  We had the occasion to sit where she was serving and she was cold to us.  We ignored it.  Today we went for breakfast where Jacques was our server.  He has always been courteous and friendly to us but acted as if we did something to him.  He brought our breakfast but it was 10 minutes and no toast or muffin.  My husband asked and he commented it was coming.  He walked away shaking his head.  I didn't say anything to my husband as I didn't want to ruin his breakfast but I told the manager.  No customer especially in a city in Las Vegas and Henderson where there are so many establishments have to see such behavior from their servers.  I no longer feel comfortable going there for breakfast and if we go there for lunch and either are our servers, I will not be inclined to put up with rolling eyes and shaking heads.

n_S1NWFxn_P1iKvBi9YC7g.text: Go! Do it! Get the half done pickles and thank me later! It's all good but I go for the basics w pickle everything bagel w cream cheese and lox. Not far from the airport so great place to hit up before or after your next flight for some kosher comfort food!

op8Y9Nw93nQTTK3RE4JBVg.text: I don't know what to say,I love matzoh ball soup. This place has the best matzoh ball soup ever. The matzoh balls are bigger than a softball love love love. Highly recommend will be back for more

Q3eH-fpDSY_A46s9ejXZsA.text: They have the BEST PATTY MELT EVER !!!! I usually get it on white , I also love LOVE LOVE their oatmeal !!!

UrMLFJFyZ3hu4roi2u_5iw.text: Adding a star.  I've been to Weiss' twice since their much needed renovations were completed and had great food and service on both occasions.    It's hard to compete with their matzoh ball soup.  I think they may actually have a slight advantage over The Bagel Cafe (plus they are 20+ miles closer to my house).  Their matzoh balls are lighter and fluffier.  Some people may like the denser version at TBC, but I prefer Weiss'.  Plus their soup portions are more than generous.  Their 'cup' is larger than most restaurants bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. &#39;Cup&#39; of matzoh ball soup with garlic bagel chips.  Delicious and very filling.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Ruben with potato salad.  Both excellent.  Potato salad is not vinegar-y.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. 1/2 Turkey on Rye.  Really good turkey- not salty

Ib61JmCX9kfehe7KQr60Dg.text: Good Evening,  I came into your establishment with my child. I called my orders in because of the weather and we are both sick.  I ordered TWO half sandwich combos with chicken noodle soup. When I got home I had one Matzoh Ball soup. I called in to say I was not given my soup. I was argued down by Denise about she knows what she gave me and she gave me two chicken noodle soups. I first took a picture of the food and posted to Yelp. I also put my clothes back on, my sick child, and took my 27.60 receipt with the food back to your establishment. When she looked in the bag , of course , it was wrong. She tried to give me the soup.  No apologies and the fact that I had to come out again to argue with your staff over a small cup of soup. I will not patronize a business that would treat a regular customer this way. Please refer to Yelp, my name is sweetnursecandy. Please look how many times I patronize your establishment. No I don't look like the regular people who frequent but please don't insult me. Denise was the worst encounter I have ever had out of the 30 plus times I have been to Weiss Deli. I asked for my money back. The moral of the story, don't stereotype me and you guys just lost a great customer. I will go where I'm appreciated.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

BQVYPIEgxgHkkOFGs--qCg.text: Walked in and seated ourselves no one was in the place. Pretty much found out why the young man that came to our table to take our order was very rude. We asked for a manager we were told there wasn't one there. We got up walked out. Sent an email no response. With service like that it's no wonder they didn't have a sole eating there

rUh6Iw3osxMTfa9ArEMcQw.text: We found this place for lunch on accident after using the Post Office. Pretty good food and the service was top notch. There was some outdoor seating and we were able to bring our dog to enjoy it with us. We would return.

Rq5c4loXTZQtMYzEkb4vHw.text: We love this place! As a New Yorker, we're constantly struggling to find good traditional eats in Henderson and this place in one word is satisfying. Bagels, sandwiches, cookies all delicious. Wish we had tried it sooner. We are always so disappointed in what Henderson has to offer by way of take out or deli/diner experiences, so sometimes we put recommendations on the back burner. We have lived in Henderson for a little over two years and are just happy we are starting to try more things to weed out the bad. This place is great and even though it's not around the corner it's definitely worth it. There's really nothing great around the corner from Lake Las Vegas anyway and the "village" restaurants out by us are just not worth it even though they are less than 5 minutes from the house. If you like good food, you have to travel for it    It's just not something we are used to.

kClH1NU6zKPVNEuJcOomKA.text: The only reason for only 4 stars is they Close so darn early...other than that, really good matzoh ball soup very tasty and they have green pickles that are The best ... good service and strange location but kewl place to get my Jew on

EqsFym9zZoi3G-SBgV1IaQ.text: Many people have referred me to Weiss, since I moved to Las Vegas almost one year ago. I ordered a "cup" of chicken noodle matzoh ball soup. The "cup" turned out to be a bowl AND that was the SMALL! I would imagine the BOWL is massive! The matzoh ball tasted 97% of what my mother used to make, and that's great!!  If that wasn't enough, I ordered a half of pastrami and chopped liver on rye, again, half a sandwich would be a whole sandwich anywhere else. Good pastrami as well as the chopped liver. The rye bread was excellent. Why did I wait almost a year to come here? Because Bagel Cafe is much closer. I decided to go beyond for a change....and it was a good decision!   And they have RICE PUDDING!!

BLBrrV5plvfSHeJC1FmPQA.text: Everything is amazing here. Very large portions and high quality. Ceily stack is my all time favorite followed by the open face reuben sandwich. Never have had a meal that wasn't excellent here.

eAmULl4T_oqLfDEyL-0k5A.text: Food is "ok" the staff needs to learn manners and customer service skills. Every time we go in to order a sandwich the cashiers act like we are bothering them. We have experienced this at least 5 times and we will not be returning. Plus, they are extremely overpriced.

YS9qLaN_NtoGD-SrjX5HJQ.text: I wish I'd gotten around to trying them sooner.  Weiss Restaurant Deli & Bakery is nestled in the Trader Joe's plaza on Green Valley and Sunset, and they're practically just around the corner from school and home. I sure took my sweet time getting around to trying them though. I don't recall whether anyone ever invited me here, but I finally invited myself today after deciding that I wanted lunch before grabbing some coffee.  The decor is a bit more reminiscent of cubicles than a diner or family restaurant, but the crowd was there for Saturday afternoon and the menu definitely does the trick. It's a Jewish deli type of place with some breakfast specials, burgers, and a huge variety of sandwiches. I took a long hard look at the menu, mainly because my server disappeared for a while after giving me "a minute," but eventually I went straight for some of the classics.  First item to arrive (and very quickly) was the standalone small bowl of chicken soup w/ matzoh ball ($5.95). It's a classic take on soup with a few veggies. There's definitely more chicken than you'd expect, but it's a carb lover's treat otherwise. Thin noodles draped the bowl and the matzoh ball, which is a big fluffy dumpling that I'm sure reminds some people of home cooking. Oh, and the thin bread croutons on the plate did provide a hard crunch that was welcome. It was a good start to the meat.  The pastrami sandwich ($13.95 full size) came out soon afterward. This is the kind of sandwich that I'm sure other places try to emulate (and most often fail). Two healthy slices of rye (my slice) held together a huge mound of thinly sliced, juicy, tender meat. It was bite after bite of savory, spiced goodness that didn't require anything else - not even cheese or mustard. I didn't even find myself sucking up water afterward, which is a sign that nothing I had was a salt bomb.  The included-with-sandwich potato salad was a slightly sweet, well-executed side that's otherwise standard deli fare. Although it didn't help me that much, I'm not sure that the other options (cole slaw, fries, fruit) would've been direct complements either.  I've gotta add Weiss to my rotation and try their other stuff. Overstuffed sandwiches, burgers, and breakfast all seem like enticing comfort foods that could make me really happy under the right circumstances. It might seem just a tad pricey, but this is a great neighborhood deli that all Henderson folks should try if they haven't.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Just look at that pastrami perfection.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Full pastrami sandwich ($13.95), my choice of side was potato salad
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Small bowl of chicken noodle soup with matzoh ball ($5.95)

FCtf9UmDmwbsu3vHUleDOw.text: This place is really good! Made from scratch food, including the chicken noodle soup. Perfect for trying to get thru the cold and flu season! They have delivery thru Doordash!

1Cwx3vhdt0B-xqKwhQBNUQ.text: I would give more stars but we did order a take out while we were in Vegas for work. We ordered I guess brunch. My husband got eggs sausage toast. Which you know taste ok when it's not super fresh off the stove. I had matzo ball soup,bagel As someone who makes matzo ball soup monthly I was super impressed!!! Their soup is amazing!!!!!!! Go get the soup make sure they give you bagel chips. The bagel was mehhh I've had better in my life I just can't get over the soup

qOMdywTSM9RZkmicQM9vsg.text: This was mediocre.  Its definitely NOT the bagel cafe which they seem to be trying to mimic.  The corned beef hash isnt "the mother of all hash".  It tastes homemade but not as good as other homemade around town.  If you're hungry dont order "the classic benny".  My boyfriend order that and got what looked like two open faced sliders with hollandaise sauce. We shared a bagel amd even that dissapointed us.   Besides that it was tiny inside the restaurant and stuffy.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

mmx-7d5JLJDru7Q6qedKmg.text: I love Weiss and I love my neighborhood even more for having a place like this.  It's a legitimate deli with all kinds of great meats by the pound or for sandwiches. The Reuben is amazing, and I love the chicken matzo soup. It has plenty of chicken and the veggies are super fresh and crisp.  Prices are high, but every item is plenty large for two. Plus quality is high, so overall I think it's a good deal.  The sit down ambiance isn't anything special, so we usually call ahead for takeout or just eat at a table outside.  Don't waste your money or calories on the desserts. Meh.

ZdxTBLeMxo9oS3PqtKjE_g.text: This is more of an old school no frills diner with great coffee, great service and really good food at a lower price then some of these fancy breakfast places that have been popping up. No bloody Mary's but there is beer. Plus their bagels and bread are home made. I can't believe I didn't know about this place! Of course any old time vegas person you ask seems to ;)

IyN-qZ93WLs41WReEDC66A.text: The food is very good. Chicken noodle soup is definitely homemade. My husband and I shared a corned beef sandwich and it was plenty for lunch. Rye bread was fresh and tasty.

Wai0jhJE94ADNMYZwYgVsw.text: Clary silver and Beef brisket are our favorites, bit everything is delicious! We are here fro breakfast today,  so I will update this profile after we eat...

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

BtfraAX-E7jQHEUVyOaFVg.text: Unbelievable sandwiches, breakfast is always excellent. Today friends and I split one sandwich ordered an extra side and finished it off with a slice of the most delicious cheesecake. I convinced my friends to share a black-and-white soda forgot to suggest celery soda. Always fun sharing favorite local foods and experiences with good friends. Waitress took the lunch to an even more delightful level when we requested extra pickles and she brought us an entire bowl full. I adore Weiss's  restaurant and deli and I hope their remodel continues and eventually include some very creative art work on those horribly blank walls. I know I'm not quite a fan of the new walls and it's obvious watching  the wait staff that they too are still struggling with the new , restrictive configuration.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. If you don&#39;t like burnt garlic flavor on your bagel order it griddle.

fJFWp95FjQAI5dN2nae_hg.text: We came at 12:30 and there was about a 20 minute wait, so there you have it. I would recommend arriving early or late for lunch. Mom and I shared a pastrami on rye and I had to try the matzo ball chicken soup, both were fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Light and fluffy matzo ball soup, yummy

ycq3-Rbao5s9fqjAU4yGaA.text: This place has AMAZING food. Everything bagel is an absolute must, along with the Ruben. Side note: if you have never tried it, try it open-faced. Their coffee is incredible as well. It is mild but flavorful.  Portions are huge, so very convenient for sharing. If you get a chance - snag a seat in Jaque's section.  Now to the down sides (ergo 3 stars). The service in this place (Jaque notwithstanding) is absolutely atrocious. First - the hosting is incredibly disorganized, so at busy times, 20-30 people get cramped into a space designed for maybe 10 people and then try to flag down the "hostess" to get on a waiting list. Second - the wait staff is very inattentive and oftentimes looks downright annoyed when you flag them to take your order or refill coffee. Food is slow to arrive and sometimes arrives cold. Also - although there are typically 7-8 people on the floor, none of them seem to be doing anything related to serving customers.  I would still recommend this place because the food is that amazing. Just zero out your expectation of service and enjoy your meal.

eLb3qxyVEWqbX8S_OH8e2A.text: This is a really good, standard New York-style deli (I say this as a native New Yorker). Sandwiches piled higher than the average adult person's head, everything comes with a pickle, and VERY IMPORTANTLY!, they have Cel-Ray soda. The hot dog is the best I've had in Vegas. It's not a soggy Nathan's one, it's an actual beef hot dog that's been properly browned/cooked, and the bun is a substantial french bread one. I've also gotten the tuna melt here and it's excellent, but I would recommend getting it closed rather than open-faced- it's messy (but worth it). Excellent, crispy fries, and delicious matzoh ball soup. Just don't try to come here if you're in a rush. The service is just fine, but it's not in-and-out-in-half-an-hour kind of service. You'll want to take your time here and enjoy the deli-ness of it all.

NICNY-B04QDlpHcfS3-biQ.text: O. M. G. So delicious. This was my first time here and certainly will not be my last. I ordered the "hash hash" special which had corned beef hash, poached eggs, veggies, and hollandaise sauce. It came with a side of home fries and choice of bread/bagel. I got the challah bread. Everything on my plate was so delicious. The portions are huge so make sure you're hungry. The service is awesome and we never had a lack of beverages. The prices average at about $10-$15 per plate, so not terribly priced considering the potions!!   Highly recommended!

Q-hq58Ghp6GkAMYvTHwANQ.text: This place is great they have awesome sandwiches pilled high with amazing quality meat, their breakfast's and soups are always cooked to perfection if you are crunched for time you might want to get here early cause I'm not the only one that knows about this Henderson gem so plan on a 10-15 min wait but once you are seated service is fast and super friendly and not to Mention my waiter is a brother from the RAIDER NATION I told you the quality is off the chain!! You will love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. My waiter is a Raider Fan Hell Yeah RAIDER NATION 4 LIFE!!

8BbQfrJmFPX01lrYg35ldw.text: Food is delicious, my favorite is the egg salad sandwich with the holindase bread(I think that's what it's called, when I go, I just request for the bread that starts with a "H")!! It's not too over priced since the portions are so big!

bccaaYhYG2v20A9uJc4TuA.text: This place has the best pastrami sandwich in town!! Comparable to pastrami sandwiches in Manhattan. Also have amazing homemade bagels and cream cheese.

VcgwQANZziTGLWdsd126zg.text: Our son took us here before our flight back home. Although we'd lived in the area several years we had not tried this restaurant. The food was excellent and enough for us to have 1/2 later on our flight home. Staff went out of their way to assist getting our leftovers ready for a plane trip. Would recommend and stop again next time in town.

P5hQ6x3JvDy_M8KDvpwYjg.text: I used yelp to find a breakfast place by the Galaxy Green Valley Theater. This is where the hubs and I ended up and we've been here 3 times since.  I LOVE Jewish delis. It reminds me of my NY NJ days. Good homecooking, and just quality food in jiffy.  The restaurant in nestled in a old shopping strip mall. The deli\bakery has it's own entrance and the restaurant has booths and tables both inside and outside. As far as decor goes - it's definitely minimalist central but I did appreciate the local artwork they had up. We got their just after they opened and they already have 6 or seven other tables with people. The place obviously has lots of regulars because I heard a few waiters say - "Your usual Mr. So and So". Always a good sign.  I had their "the usual" breakfast sandwich and despite the warm day we were having, I had a bowl of Matzo ball soup. Everything was just the way I wanted it.  My husband got "the killer" breakfast sandwich and pancakes. He gobbled it all up. The bagels that the sandwiches came on were so fresh. My soup was flavorful and there was plenty of it. Despite my best efforts, I could not finish it :(  The second third and fourth time I've been here, I had the same breakfast sandwich and a side of corn beef hash. I enjoyed every bite. We brought another couple along, one of whom is a vegetarian. She had ordered the vegetable hash and could not stop saying how great it was. My husband ventured out and had their french toast which he told me was to die for. I knew it was because it was made on challah bread. I had a bite of it and it really was amazing.  The waiter we had the first 3x was Jacques, he was the perfect waiter. He remembered us when he waited on us the second time and just really added to the great experience we had. I didn't catch the waitress's name that was there for us on visit #4 but she was as sweet as could be.  All in all, from start to finish, we thoroughly enjoyed this place and have already began the tradition of coming here for Sunday breakfast and driving down a block to catch a movie.  If you are looking for a great breakfast\brunch spot, make sure to add this to your list of places you must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The killer ...
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmmm matzo ball soup for breakfast !

T-LSbYzr4M2mD8NlWuKVlg.text: Being a big fan of bagel cafe, I wanted to find a similar place to eat that was a bit closer and easier to get to. Luckily, I found Weiss.    Man oh man, this place has some dang good chicken noodle and matzo ball soup ! Broth is super flavorful, chicken is nice and tender. Basically, it's just piping hot amazingness in your mouth. Their food portions here are big enough, that I probably don't need to get the soup everything I go, but you can be damn sure I will. Especially now that it's getting colder, no way am I going to pass up the soup when I eat here.   Along with my soup, I usually get Ceilys stack. It's two potato latkes stuffed with brisket, and then covered with melted provolone and Munster cheese, as well as their brown sauce (gravy). I actually prefer to get mine with the gravy on the side. It's so rich and a little bit too salty for me to want it slathered all over. Instead, I prefer it on the side so I can just put small amounts on here and there. Also, just as a side note, Yates great even as left overs. I can never finish the soup and the stack, so I usually take half of the stack home, and it's still just as good. Meat, cheese, and potatoes... how can you go wrong ?   As fire the service, I've gotten mixed feelings about it. I had Jacques add my server in the morning, and he was great. He was super busy with the tables, but still checked in on us and was very friendly. At night, I had Margie. While she wasn't unpleasant, she wasn't very pleasant either. We were also only one of three tables at the time, and the service wasn't that great. Other than that, all has been good.   Now, if I haven't reiterated it enough... go get some matzo ball soup !

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzo ball soup.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Ceilys stack
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken noodle soup with matzoh ball.

z2_fVf8sCC4PXOUFyvmmcg.text: Who knew?  If blindfolded, I would swear this authentic deli was in New York. The small matzo ball soup is huge and overfilled with white chicken meat. The matzo ball is huge and light and fluffy. It is served with bagel chips. The bagels are homemade. The pastrami and Swiss on seeded rye is enough for four. French fries are served up in the classic cut here. The salt brined pickles are bright green and crispy. Everything is homemade. If I could, I would return to try everything on the menu. The service is good but the waitress did not understand the food.

3TA1uSOU2j3fju0ZqRyr8A.text: This is a great breakfast place. I love their eggs Benedict! Most dishes are also accompanied by their wonderful fresh bagels.

I2KeQLCi6LqEEsCFr9pdpA.text: One visit so far, but will be back.  I had the Ceily's stack (brisket, potato pancakes, cheese, topped with brown gravy) and matzo ball soup.  The Mrs. had a Reuben.  We shared, of course.  Huge portions.  Chicken matzo ball soup is perfection.  Reuben was as good as it gets . . . and HUGE with plenty of meat.   Lots of made-from-scratch stuff.  It's the real deal.  From what we observed at other tables and ate ourselves, it's quality food with generous portions.  Large menu with a lot of choices.  Great take-out and to-go counter, including chopped liver, kippered salmon, rice pudding, bagels, and pastries.  Killer garlic bagels that simply reek of garlic!  This joint took me back to my East Coast Jewish roots.    Only complaint was the coffee tasted like instant, and no non-dairy creamer was available.  I would have deducted 1/2 a star for this if possible, but will let it slide for now. Given how many of us Jew-folk are lactose intolerant, you'd think they'd have non-dairy creamer available.  I'd happily pay a little more for the coffee in order to get good coffee and Coffee-Mate with my breakfast.  Service was just fine and reasonably attentive.  Waitstaff was friendly, helpful, and attentive.  No complaints there at all.  Hopefully future visits will be as good.  Looking forward to "testing" the benedicts.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Reuben.  On Challah bread and closed-face per request.

jQUImvgBfEpRxFfwFucuWw.text: I stopped in here finally after going to Trader Joe's like a thousand times right next to it. It was just me and I wanted something new for breakfast. I heard rave things from people so I figured why not? When I go places, often times I try to get what is their specialty. So I asked my super nice server and without hesitation was told the benedicts. After about 2 seconds of deliberation I was sold on the Black Mountain Benny. I figured this would make or break this place. 1- this entree has brisket, which I am CRAZY picky about. 2- hollandaise sauce....I make my own, and have rarely found restaurants that even make tolerable hollandaise. Double whammy of possible major letdown.   Letdown, I was not. The reason I am picky about my brisket it fat globs. Umm yuck. This was glob free and must have hit the pan for a bit with the onions because it has a caramelized taste to it. Yum. Hollandaise, was good. NOT as good as my own (I like a tad bit of lemony tang) but MUCH MUCH MUCH better than anywhere I have found thus far. It was real. Not mix that tastes like chicken broth with a flavorless mayo base.   Is this a fancy place? NOPE. Is it delicious? YEP. Will I be back for more? HELLS YES.   Fantastic service. good food. and next to Trader Joes...what more could you want?

E5_lVvhHZ8MNWNXQf5OUnA.text: As soon as you open the door the wonderful food smells are so enticing. The service was fast very warm and friendly.  I had the homemade Chicken Noodle soup with Matzo Ball. It was delicious. The matzo ball was light and fluffy, there was lots of chicken, carrots, celery and onions and I love that the noodles were the skinny type. The broth was superb.  As if that wasn't enough I couldn't stop there I had to try the Reuben. Wow, it was excellent, would have to be up there with Carnegie's in NYC. Corn beef was lean and juicy, just the right amount of thousand island dressing. If you looking for fabulous deli food then look no further, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Closed face Reuben with coleslaw.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Amazing Chicken noodle soup with matzo ball. Delicious.

U4iCt-Y_jtb0M66JtAbGnQ.text: Very taste.   Many corn beef.   Such amaze.   Reuben sandwich is much wow.   Very customer service.   Much nice.   So experience.   Such New York.  So early close in 7:30.   Wow.  The End.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Very Taste. Much Turkey. Very Corn Beef. Much Swiss Cheese. Very Coleslaw. Wow.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. I love these new york sky high sandwiches
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Giant ball of fluff

6DhdyerHM0z9LijlBpl5Lw.text: I will start right off by saying I didn't actually eat there.  I went at 11:45 for lunch.  I waited for 10 minutes before being acknowledged for a table, and then sat another 10 minutes before I got up and left.  After I was sat at a table, nobody ever came back, no menu, no water, nothing.  So there I wasted 20 minutes of my 1-hour lunch break.  I was really hoping for a better experience than that!!!  I don't think I will go back to try it again though.

_7sGkGw5tGnREV5lxlsV7g.text: 3.5 stars.  I've been going to Weiss, since before it was called Weiss. It used to be called Samuels, or something to that effect.  Today, I went in with my daughter, my mom and my brother. It was an afternoon weekday, so we had no problem getting a table.   My menu was dirty.  I ordered the soup (with ball) and a 1/2 of a corned beef. My brother got the rueben open faced, and my mom got the corned beef with coleslaw.  My soup came out first, and it was as delicious as ever. My sandwhich came out with ever one else's meal.   Looking around, the wall that separates the tables from the servers station is FILTHY. I mean, dust bunnies ! Coffee grounds... A quarter. I mean, yowza would it kill someone to wipe that down ?

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Filthy !
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Dirty !

eErf9TjC_h0_1TAsRf7xkQ.text: I cannot remember how long my wife and I have been going to the Weiss Deli; perhaps 20 years. We drive 85 miles, one-way, to eat there.  We took friends to lunch yesterday, who had never been. They LOVED it (as they should). I have never had anything but a great meal.  While I personally lean toward breakfast (they make their corned beef hash in-house). I am not knocking their lunch menu. It is fabulous and the sandwiches are crazy-big, filled with wonderful ingredients.  Finally, even when the restaurant is busy, the staff have your back. Great service at every level.

Z486NCUhYCe36eTL2ccExw.text: Very good.  Portions huge!  Service great. Such an unexpected afternoon delight. Will certainly come back

KAgTIw-U6ZBepolPeyP8WA.text: Weiss surpassed my expectations!  The hubby & I shared an Open-Face Reuben, Corned  Beef was tender & juicy.   Desert spread also phenomenal.  Cheesecake was PROPER...creamy & perfect crust. Had my first "Black & White" wow I loved it. We also tried their Macaroon. And another cookie, with raspberry filling then dusted with powdered sugar. (Told you it was a spread)  Looking forward to trying more on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. This thing was Huge! Was my first Black and White. So unique. Delicious!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. In my honest opinion, this Cheesecake is just about as perfect as they get!

vkSWU-1c4Qg8Vp1-aL2cIw.text: Love this place! Amazing food. Good service. The matzo ball soup is like hommenade, only my matzo balls are never that fluffy. The only complaint I have is that it is only open until 7pm. Makes it hard to go to dinner there when I get the out of work at 6.

ehfAZq9qrnznAe7SHcLy4w.text: Great food! Love the pastrami rueben, matzah ball soup, and cookies! Worth the drive from downtown.

ST5Wou80BwToWmtyvbrrYw.text: My Fiance recommended we eat here for lunch today, I've never been to a kosher deli, crazy I know. The seating was prompt and a nice quaint dining area, with lots of fun pictures from around the world. The Menu is extensive serving also breakfast. I was here for a sandwich. Come hungry I ordered a turkey melt! Fantastic oven roasted turkey, and a ton of cheese on homemade rye! Couldn't finish so great to share. Definitely will be back , for know I'll enjoy the fresh bagel from there bakery! Keep up the great work!

rCP7WPxPvP93kqRr8_QzXQ.text: Yummy Reuben! I am a huge fan of Reubens and Weiss Reuben sandwich was just what the doctor ordered! Perfectly fresh bread, moist and tangy sauerkraut and loads and LOADS of pastrami! The sandwich was so big, I had it for lunch and dinner! I also had their fries and it was OK. I like my fries salty and thin and theirs was seriously lacking in salt and super thick. It was nice and crunchy though and being that my sandwich was amazing, I quickly got over it.  I was surprised by the amount of seating space inside, It's diner style and has lots of small business charm.  I was hoping to pick up some pastries while there too but none of them appealed to me. That was a bit disappointing. All in all, I'll definently come back for a Reuben and may be some chicken noodle soup!

md9RWFNvc2mvGswsyy4vVg.text: My husband and I have lived in Henderson for 14 years and recently discovered our new, most favorite breakfast and lunch place!! It is sooo neighborhood feel, staff is terrific, especially Sharon and another young man! ( remember the quarter), the food is absolutely tremendous!! The salmon Florentine Benedict ( the best) the Hollandaise Sauce, to die for , and not had a bad meal!!! Really good suggestions from the servers and great service! Kudos to all !!

OW_T1g3zHsC19W1rcnZedw.text: I have been looking for good deli in Vegas for a while. Now I have no need to look any farther. Now this place can't hold up to LA or NY, but it is close. This is the Jewish deli I have needed for some time. And now I will be a return customer as long as I live in this desert.

P7cEZzm2V3fn5cDM6Lcuuw.text: Honestly, I know nothing about Jewish Delis.  Just considering this a diner or deli - this place is real good.  I love going there for their breakfast.  Everything seems homemade and they have huge servings.  I have had the corned beef hash and it is the best in Vegas.  I get the everything bagel with breakfast.  It is toasty on the outside and has a nice chewiness with tons of flavor.  I have also had the Matzo ball soup.  It is so good - full of that umami essence.  The Half-sour pickles are my favorite, I have been looking for a place that has those pickles for years!  The place also base a deli counter to buy salads, bagels, pastries - stuff like that.  Do yourself a favor and go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Open face Rubin.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Why can&#39;t we all just get along like this cookie?!?!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The hash stack!!!!

01e0jMCvzhgLtATMVa3E8A.text: Good food, huge portions, but extremely overpriced. I rather have half of the portions along with decent prices.

hXry14C_VMO0RdTQUKiI6w.text: The 2 starts I'm giving it are strictly because the food was delicious. My Mom has raved about this place for years, and I was finally able to join her for lunch, hungry and excited to try the food. The matzoh ball soup was delicious, and the cup is actually a bowl. The half rueben sandwich was also delicious, even though I took it home after filling up on the soup. But the service... oh my...I've never been treated so rudely, EVER!! Our server seemed put out at every question we asked him, I was getting more and more uncomfortable at each snarky response he blurted out. I then asked him for a new fork because I accidentally dropped mine on the floor. I didn't think he heard me and repeated that I dropped it. He said he heard me the first time, and plopped the fork on the table. I then told him he needed to chill out, and he said "I don't know what you're talking about...shut up and eat your food!" I was dumbfounded, truly. He obviously knew he was out of hand, because he never came back to our table and sent other servers to help us and bring the check. We asked to speak to the manager, but were told that she just left for the day. I will try one more time, only because a good deli is hard to come by, but I sure hope the service improves.

hDx3jO-YZaRIHQWbTEvVMA.text: Daughter and i stopped in here for a bite. The portions are HUGE! Way bigger than any normal person can consume in one sitting. The service was good and pleasant people. The prices are very very high. The food was good but not THAT good. My daughter had a turkey sandwich as big as her head. I had an open face sandwich that looked like a giant motza ball. The decor was like a sad cafeteria and my water tasted like it was from the bathroom sink, so yeah 40$ later I'm feeling kinda like...whateves

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

oxhXJyMylnZHFAjwcITjOg.text: It was a great experience. Our waiter was wonderful. The food was delicious. Be prepared to take home a doggy bag. Huge amounts of food for price. Will definitely be back.

I9BcPBh0w6PTXLEQ4TJAGA.text: Local and first time visit this afternoon.    The two deli counter girls; one was very nice, the other that took my order, not so much.  I ordered a short stack of pancakes.  Upon picking it up, the woman did not provide me a bag to carry the two boxes, said nothing, and just walked off without acknowledgement. So I carried my boxes out and home.  She also did not pack me syrup or butter for my pancakes.  I returned to the store with my now cold pancakes.    The woman had the pancakes reheated up, against my wishes of new pancakes, provided me with butter and syrup.   The syrup is from Kraft and fake, the butter is not real butter, and the pancakes tasted fake (likely Kraft as well).   I had expected local and fresh ingredients to be placed in my food, such as local or regionally sourced real syrup, fresh butter, and homemade pancakes.  Did not finish my pancakes, and will likely not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Was expecting real, local or regionally sourced syrup and butter with my pancakes this morning. Expecting too much apparently.

4Ut1w6OnDccoVrYcLnP0vw.text: We've had breakfast and lunch at Weiss and loved both meals.  For breakfast, the bagel sandwiches are enormous.  I recommend adding the home fries to the sandwich for 95 cents.  They are made with onions and really add flavor.  The sandwich can be difficult to eat, but get after it with a knife and fork and you will be in good shape.  For lunch, my usual is the Reuben.  This sandwich is LARGE, easily 2 meals.  Loaded with cheese and sauerkraut, it's the perfect amount of each ingredient.  I recommend heating it up in a toaster oven or regular oven, rather than a microwave.  It kept the bread crunchy.  My wife likes the chicken noodle soup, which uses angel hair type noodles and lots of herb, particularly dill.  Highly recommended.  We usually get some bagels to go to make sandwiches at home.  Fantastic everything bagels!  They also sell all of their meats by the pound, as well as many other items.  They make their own corned beef and pastrami, and it shows.

Pa9-rkAcnEbHL9q9t5ajNg.text: I've lived in Vegas for 12 years and although I have heard of Weiss for a long time, I never made it until today. OMG why did I wait! This place is fantastic. If you're from NY or NJ and are in Vegas this is the place for you! The pork Roll sandwich and home fries took me back to my teenage years! This place is a simplistic breakfast joint and deli that has amazing food. It's an experience with no bells and whistles needed! Great service, amazing food, and just a cool vibe. I left very satisfied.

u5sVFtAWfSyfE4HIPTwMGg.text: It was just chicken noodle soup with a matzo ball in it!  I've always wanted to try this soup.  I always thought the Matzo ball looked interesting.  So I saw that they had the soup here.  So I got it to go.  I did taste the soup on the way home, and it was really good.   So got home and put it together.  Ummmm, this is just chicken noodle soup with a matzo ball in it!  Ok.....I guess!   It was a big let down for me.  I was expecting more from this dish.  Service was ok!  I know it took a long time for the order I had, and there were other people standing around as well.    As I looked at the menu, I don't think I will be back.  The order I picked up was $18.00 for a sandwich!  I don't think so!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzaball soup

4B-9zvevkRG6mu7BHznv2A.text: Sooo Good!  The food and helpings were great!  It's not cheap, but it is certainly worth it.  I ordered the 1/2 Turkey Sandwich and Matzah Ball Soup. The soup was fantastic and big, and the turkey was piled high with beautiful tomato, lettuce, and onion.    My Mom ordered the Reuben and said how can anyone get that in their mouth?!  She also said it was the best Reuben she ever had and I have to agree because we ended up sharing her sandwich and taking mine home that is how big it was.   The food was so good that it reminded me of the Famous Jewish Deli in Beverly Hills, Nate and Al's.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

sIb0wLxpknngumCUFTZQNQ.text: I really enjoyed the food & service was good as well. We were constantly asked if we needed anything, which I really liked. The only downside was hearing one waiter cursing & absurd comments being made in the kitchen/prep area. The only thing separating them from the dining area was a thin wall... so we heard everything. From disrespecting fellow waitresses to complaining about being at work. As a mother, I definitely did not enjoy listening to the comments being made around my kids. Other than that, I'd come back!

1g17UPrnh5WU9IQhyPAHDA.text: We came back the very next day for Lunch and I was just as happy. I had the Ruben and my Wife had Matzo ball soup with a side of Smoked White Fish. It was as good as I had imagined it would be. Again service was wonderful but unfortunately the woman sitting next to us was a snob and did nothing but complain about stupid things like the fact that they used a wine glass for the Water that she had to ask for and then she complained that they didn't carry Sugar in the Raw. Some people just can't be happy. Keep up the great work.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

q5BLZdfb3Lc7ob0LrgSpBA.text: Great Deli style restaurant off the beaten path in Las Vegas. Its in a shopping Plaza so the parking is shared with everyone. There's a decent amount of it but it was busy for lunch when I was there.  You walk in and the deli is to the left and the restaurant is to the right. Decent amount of seating with mostly 4 tops and a few 2 tops. We were seated right away and our server was right with us for drink orders.  The place has a little bit of an East Coast feel and definitely a mom and pops feel which is great.  I ended up getting a open face Rueben and wow was it good. Portions were huge. I couldn't finish it and had to take a to go bag. Food came out piping hot too which is great. Even the plate is hot. You can also get Dr Brown sodas here.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Open Faced Reuben

fW-jQ8lKggqvMfxZFXhsjw.text: Schlep over to Weiss for some great Jewish food; I promise you won't kvetch (complain).  Equally good for breakfast or lunch.  Portions are exceedingly ample and food is better than any other deli I've found in Las Vegas.   The daily specials are always worth consideration.   The bowl of chicken soup will cure what ails you, and there will be enough to take home for a second helping.   Service is perfunctory and quick.

OTUTGqX7wt4S4U8ZkC3Y8Q.text: I felt Weiss Deli completely change I used to have a good service but not happen anytime then, I went last week with my daughter order pancake the server we have said they don't have fresh batter for make pancake then we asked for milkshake on the menu, she said they don't have ice cream to make milkshake. So we order Hollywood on the menu she said it will too big for my daughter to eat. Since we hungry we order whatever she suggested. And today I went with my husband, she mentioned everything are available the pancake and the milkshake, I guess the server very picky over customer that deserve her customer service.

PTNOymOjfzfMkknr6cP9SA.text: I order from this place all the time, the potato salad is the best I have ever had. The sandwiches are giant, they could be easily 2-3 meals. Very good quality food. If I could get the potato salad recipe I would never eat anything other then that again!!!

_4R3I5JJ_aCZGM9x1nbO7A.text: I personally hold a belief that they serve the best burgers here.   I really like having lunch here, their portions are gigantic though, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're trying to diet.   Tastes like home.

gEL1BGn8kfII-hrSqiQSWA.text: Food is okay. Not even a good danish, got a better one, same price range (but smaller) at Mothership Coffee Roasters. Will look for another Deli for future deli cravings. I've had better beef roast.   I paid and left to get coffee. When I came back, they are already preparing two more people's orders who came after me.  I can see my order sitting on the counter and only missing is the soup that cashier said she only needs to grab...then proceeded getting phone calls, typing their orders as well as finishing another person's orders. She even eyerolled to her co-worker who shouted at her. (Watching this alone is cringey).  I get it, they're busy and I'm sorry for her that her co-worker pressures her. Can they process order according to who ordered first (and already paid) and not based on who has the loudest voice?  Tried to be as calm as possible and not to add pressure to the cashier but I had to go since I have limited lunch break. Ended up not getting the soup coz she might process new orders again if new people come in before grabbing my soup at the back. Got potato salad instead. Albertson's is tastier, it's a shame when grocery store salad taste better.   Not coming back.

dqk2hKYJj8n0NvDrxBy88A.text: Wow! I mean Oye vey! I lamented to a transplanted New Yorker the last time in Vegas, that there weren't any NY or Jewish Deli's after the Stage Deli closed up years ago here.  He said, there was a place that earned high praise for what I was looking for. I remembered today that this was a must.  Weiss is located in a corner shopping center. Margie, our waitress was acerbic yet helpful and fun to listen to.  Pastrami and corn beef were what you hope for in a Jewish/NY style deli. The potato salad was like buttah..Fantastically delicious, and the chocolate egg cream was excellent.  A must do for any fan of this food fare.

xCHlitNBF8DNlXzoWj0DrA.text: If I could give a zero, I would. We normally love Weiss' , but being ignored by our waitress who repeatedly said "I'll be right with you" is never good, specially you she never "got right with us". The table next to us got seated at the exact same time and they were finishing their soup and our order hadnt even been taken. The waitress either needs better training or you need more staff.

VjjOHKODlivhFZOTbQrjzQ.text: Excellent proportion Whitefish is outstanding and the service delightful. Enjoy! We are from Washington DC

Ka7dS7rt7V5ElBL3lrcd8g.text: I came in here for lunch today based solely on the pictures, but I was so disappointed. Maybe I should have ordered something else, but the BLT was just sad. Piled so high with lettuce but barely any bacon. Potato salad was excellent though.   I was really looking forward to the bakery but it was extremely lacking. I got a variety and every single one tasted like a grocery store bought cookie. I still have a slice of cheesecake I haven't tasted, but I'm not feeling optimistic.

wUDgAW58W7dSveVkiK0ZmQ.text: I had heard good recommendations about this restaurant and was excited to try their food. I got their chicken noodle soup with matzoh ball, grilled cheese sandwich, and potato salad. This was the most bland meal I've ever had in my entire life. There was no flavor whatsoever to any of the food except for the potato salad and it was mediocre. Super disappointed and will never eat here again.

hJPmB5u06acKy9lFfmp8OA.text: Tucked in the corner of this strip mall on Sunset is this hole in the wall that serves up some good deli sandwiches and matzo ball soup with noodles.  I met a friend for lunch today and we each ordered a 1/2 corned beef sandwich, the matzo ball soup, and an order of two potato latkes so we each could have one.  The soup was very good and I made the comment that it was the only soup that I didn't have to salt.  It wasn't salty to me, but I tasted it and knew I didn't need more--an unusual circumstance.  As we were finishing our soup, the sandwiches were brought and they had a good amount of meat.  I got rye.  Then the potato latkes came and the waitress split the order and placed a latke on each of our sandwich plates because the tables are so small and very close together.  Service was good although I never was asked if I wanted an iced tea refill.    The best part of the meal was the soup.  I don't have to go so far to get good soup.  Weiss is OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned beef on rye with potato latke.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzo ball soup.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

15afQfBHgF8HRerDV07StA.text: Great food avg service but they do get busy. Just Know when you're going the food will be worth the wait. Rye bread is fresh, chopped liver sandwich or chicken salad sandwiches are must orders if you like those. Haven't tried breakfast but if it's as good as their sandwiches, it should be great.

54OdQ0X6VeRXLjBBWKP0qw.text: Every time I come to Vegas I visit this place with my family. It is always exactly what you want in a traditional Jewish deli. The matzo ball soup is probably the best I've ever had. I always get the Hot Pastrami on rye and it never disappoints. Piles of delicious meat enough for two sandwiches with a side of coleslaw is my go to meal. My sister had the Turkey Sandwich which looked like a tower it was stacked so high and looked so fresh. Service is always good. They are always happy to serve extra pickles for the table as well as extra bread if needed.

CYHgav6VpoI5Z5aSkLqjmQ.text: Came in for breakfast/brunch and was pleasantly surprised. Being from the east coast and having a penchant for delis and bakeries, I had high expectations and was not disappointed. I had to try the chicken noodle soup with the matzoh ball and it was really satisfying. The soup had good flavor and the ball was not too dense. To accompany that, I had a scoop of whitefish salad which was delicately smoked and not overly full of mayo which was nice. My dining companion had the classic (roast turkey) club, to which he gave a thumbs up. The club came with a generous serving of fries- not too soggy, not overly done so it was good. I'll come back if I'm in the area and I want to try the bakery selection.

2oOe_J4AgUQPzlAg4e3ijQ.text: My daughter and I ate Weiss Deli last month. We both got the chicken noodle soup which was pretty good. I really hope they will renovate soon. the inside was kind of dirty and very old. The worst part of our dining experience at Weiss was when not once but twice two huge dust bunnies from the ceiling fan above us came trickling down into my daughters soup. Ugh  As we looked up we could see a huge amount of dust above on the fan blades. I usually don't write bad reviews and I really don't want to hurt a small business seeing as that I have one as well but this was just not right. Hope they can clean up the problem soon. Food was good and we enjoyed it pre-dust bunny.

COzuqXXMLS0sOs4tfXZFbg.text: Items Selected: Cinnamon Raisin Bagel with Butter Short Stack Pancakes Challah French Toast with Strawberries and Whipped Cream Bread Pudding Black and White Cookie Chocolate Brownie  Located in Henderson and an old-timer on my breakfast 'to-do' list it was finally this Saturday that I drove down to Green Valley Parkway and although many may claim Weiss Restaurant, Deli & Bakery to be the 'best' Jewish Delicatessen in the city my experience was a mixed one - the prices right, but the food and service both hit and miss.  Admitting up front that I'm neither Jewish nor particularly fond of smoked fish and thus leaving judgments of authenticity or the quality of their Lox at the door, it was just short of 8:15am when I entered the deceptively large space and with a young Hispanic gentleman shouting 'sit anywhere you want' I did just that, a quick perusal of the deli and bakery confirming some selections for later before sitting down to a menu already in place.  Declining potted coffee in favor of water as I was already quite awake from my early morning run I was soon informed that the daily-special French Toast with apples and walnuts would not be ready until an indefinable 'later' and equally denied a single buttermilk biscuit side-order because "they come in threes" I instead stuck to the menu, my three part order beginning with a nicely toasted bagel featuring great chew and plenty of plump raisins.  Moving next to a two-part pile of pancakes alongside housemade challah griddled golden brown and eschewing Kraft 'pancake syrup' in place of maple brought from home it was surprisingly the fluffy flapjacks teaming with buttermilk that outshined French toast not particularly well penetrated by custard and settling the bill quickly for a Jackson inclusive of tax and tip I quickly stepped next door, another $10 paid to a smiley young woman for three items consumed over the next couple hours while enjoying college football and coffee in a nearby lounge - the brownie a touch artificial with mouthfeel compromised by paraffin while the Frisbee sized Black & White was pillowy soft and the re-warmed block of bread pudding presented everything the French Toast did not, each bite soft with custard and equally eggy as it was sweet.  Equal to Carnegie Deli at half the price but only outshining Bagel Cafe / Del Mar Deli in the Bread Pudding and Black & White I'd gladly stop by Weiss in the future to check out some more of their baked goods or perhaps a sandwich and soup, but given the nearly 30 minute drive from my home in Summerlin I'll probably revisit Bagel Cafe first and recommend others do so as well - the selection, quality, and value all combining to put it a few steps above the rest...enough so that even if I lived in Henderson I'd make the drive northwest.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. ...white out special?

bzru8Wbb9fzmnCKW1LY9Pw.text: Had takeouts from here before and the food was always decent, so finally when we were looking for a breakfast place, this place came to mind.   Came here on a Sunday morning after the morning rush, shortly after 10, and we sat outside as the weather was nice. Food was still decent, I ordered an omelette with a bagel on the side and the bf had French toast. The French toast was huge! The food was good, typical breakfast food.   The service, however, was horrendous. The couple sitting at the next table, who came before us, remained seated for awhile without menus and it took another 5 minutes before someone realized so and brought them menu and served them.   No one checked on us during the meal, and when someone finally did when we were almost finished with the meal, we asked for another glass of orange juice. It took literally another 5 minutes before he came back, this time, with a wine glass of orange juice as he said they ran out of glasses.   After we were done with our meal and we were ready to pay, we put the card out ready to be paid. We finally asked the waitress to take it when she came to the table, and she asked, "take what?" Really? It just gets irritating when you have to ask for literally everything, every time, including a box.   The wait staff was mostly high school kids or at least they looked like it, so I guess we shouldn't be surprised. BUT since it's supposed to be a family own mom and pop place, actually I was pretty surprised. Would never return again unless it's for takeout!!!

wqU7TwkeaICdjsId7HYaow.text: So I have been in search of the best Ruben sandwich in the Las Vegas valley and my quest has finally ended here, The corned beef was on point along with good Russian dressing and croute to top it off and the Rye bread was toasted to perfection I had the closed sandwich version and the wife tried open face both equally good and prepared with love. The service was great and the server had a more personal relation with the customers comming in calling them by name. We will definetly be back to try something else

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Open faced ruben
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Closed ruben sammich

mufHms9tHFcN3lFdQ_X26Q.text: Overall, it's the best deli in Vegas. Huge portions, fresh ingredients, courteous and efficient staff, and reasonable prices. Open faced Reuben is a fantastic meal sure to promise a full second meal's worth of leftovers, although it's not a perfect "Reuben" sandwich per say. I've never been a huge fan of eating chicken salad sandwich's from restaurants, but their's is outright amazing and is in my usual rotation. Matzah ball chicken noodle soup is always the highlight of the meal for me, and I always get an order to go whenever I start to feel sick; it's the closest thing to "mom's" you'll ever get. For breakfast, it's always hard for me to try anything other than the "Ceily's Stack", it's savory breakfast heaven with massive latkes and meat covered in cheese and gravy.  Has a nice family diner atmosphere, and service is definitely focused on efficiently turning customers over quickly; which feels nice when your from the Midwest or East Coast like I am. Get in, be smiled at, eat, get a refill, finish eating, and then leave. The way it should be; no lollygagging around with laptops out or any of that nonsense.

3HVBhz75eSpB3LMTl5r7xQ.text: I am upgrading my score thanks to some awesome Matzoh Ball soup!  Saved my passover!  Their Challah is great too and the staff is awesome!  I only wish the place had a little bit less than the cafeteria style seating and better sides.  Do not get the potato pancake unless you want a giant soft mess.  Other than that, so glad they are here in LV! Makes me a little less homesick.

HSxj-YXIcCPs-tRgcpAgfQ.text: Excellent hot pastrami on Rye and Matzah ball soup; I felt like I was in A world Famous NYC DELI... Dont get the French Fries or Knish as they are not good!! Over all hood service and a great local Deli

vkQRvlHRh19x6EszlU8LhA.text: Matzo ball chicken soup, cup size, is a belly buster. Yummy plus. Also had a side of white fish with toasted everything bagel. Food is first class as is the service.

UetaG0-Mu5Bsn6NaAorZdg.text: Phenomenal! This city needs more spots like Weiss! My family has been frequenting this restaurant for years. Their Mazo Ball soup is the best, and their breakfast menu is decadent! This is the go-to place is you are a local.

Os5giQs9VAnxhhSzo-Mo_w.text: I've been here three times now, and have zero complaints about the food. People are right when they say the chicken noodle soup here is amazing! When I've come for lunch I've ordered half a sandwich and soup - the portions are huge! It's a great value. The waiter always seems to recommend Challah bread, so that is what I've gotten and it has been really good. Also, I had some sort of brisket eggs benedict - again, the portions are huge, I think I took almost half of it home. And the brisket was very tasty and tender - exactly what you'd expect from a delicatessen.   The downside is that there can be a wait and they don't seem to keep a list. You just have to stand around at the door until they get to you. And people aren't really standing in a straight line because there is limited space. It would make things much easier if they just took down names and let people wait outside. (I guess you could always order your food at the take out counter.)  Speaking of outside, when the weather is nice they serve at the outdoor tables too. So this place is dog friendly! Just beware, you still have to wait your turn in that line to get an outdoor table.

MwKxfe2sE8lXkRLQziyd0A.text: This is the best deli in town by far if you haven't tried it you have no idea what your missing !!!!

iYMsS7UDcxsmRR74Y3vgkQ.text: I really like it but the line is too long sometimes.  It's a very conservative type of atmosphere so if anyone stands out too much they may have to tone it down just a touch.  At least in the meantime.  The food is absolutely phenomenal

-SZ26xiTrLClN9WVhTAD9g.text: OUT OF THE DESERT RISES A TRUE NEW YORK JEWISH DELI  I've come with friends several times and am always looking forward to my next visit. If you're a real New Yorker, or lover of the traditional New York Jewish Deli, or want a taste of what it's all about - you don't have to be Jewish to enjoy yourself here as you simply can't be disappointed.   HUGE portions - real corned beef, pastrami, tongue - yeah, I said tongue. (Center cut like you can hardly find as good in NYC.) Bagels, nova, chopped chicken liver, latkes, matzo ball and chicken soups like mom's and it cures whatever ails you just the same. Gefilte fish, white fish salad, cheesecake the most die-hard New Yorkers kill for, even service that reminds you of what being in a New York deli feels like. Pickles on the table, knishes, kreplach, rugalah, black and white cookies everything a New Yorker could want or wish for in a deli - except real New York rye bread. The bread has caraway seeds, but is much thicker and lacks the "New York" rye bread taste. OK, so you can't have everything, but this is irksome just the same.   Take home a "doggie bag" and/or stop by their take out counter and bring more of the deliciousness home with you.

xsiZ5x7VivOznv_r6uSyWA.text: Go to this place! Weiss is a hidden gem some family friends brought us to. On the way there they kept raving about it in the car and they were correct! Large portions and traditional jewish dishes. Defintely get the matzah ball soup and split a sandwich with a friend.

fMYiZcV3dfBqeg85TVx2Gg.text: It's tucked back in the corner of a shopping plaza, kinda just hanging out, waiting for someone to find it. It's worth finding.  Finally got some time to meet up with Elite Emily, so we chose this place because who doesn't love some good pastrami? Terrorists, that's who. We, however, are not terrorists, so we went to check out this place in Henderson.  The main downside is that it's small. Like, "get there early or prepare to wait" small. Our wait time wasn't too bad, but with the cramped seating, I can see it filling up very quickly and not relenting. Also, even in our early [CENSORED] we definitely skewed the age range downward.  Suck it up, Soldier Sassypants, because this is some serious deli pwnge, Elite Emily went with the Soup & Sandwich combo, but the Matzo Ball Soup dominated so that way when she got to the sandwich, it was almost time to throw in the towel. My Pastrami Burger was so big I'm fairly sure you could have put little french fry legs and made it into a scene-stealing Disney sidekick. But it was delicious though, so it wouldn't have lasted long. Because I would have eaten it. And possibly burped. TMI.  The meat was done just right, with just the right seasonings to go with it, and the pastrami was shaved so thin while still being piled high and tender. Add a little deli mustard, oy, it's like buttah. You'll develop shpilkis in your genechtagazoink.  Service was friendly, if a little rushed (I mean, granted, we were thirsty, but ya didn't have to bring the whole pitcher of Pepsi over). Definitely a hidden gem worth finding.  You can meet me there. We'll nosh, we'll talk, no big whoop.

OYwW7bolEbbhX08-Zz0dYg.text: This is one of the best deli restaurants in Vegas. The owners are beyond terrific and are always on site. I love the new look too. Their potato latkes are fantastic. The variety of eggs Benedict is fabulous width homemade hollandaise sauce that is to die for. Their challah bread pudding is the best I have ever tasted. And their sandwiches are HUGE!! Best coffee ever You cannot go wrong eating here.

ACyIrIJULepoOEVi-vEpww.text: OMG I haven't had deli like this in years!   So grateful we were told about this place.  The pastrami is flavorful with the right amount of fat on the cut. The brisket stuffed latke was sublime, it truly was as our waitress said, Hanukah on steroids!  We will be back again to try other items on the menu.  Now if only we could find Montreal Smoked Meat in this part of the country and we'd have perfection!

NL8NDuNufOkUxiiITJ5veg.text: I'm going to keep this very simple. They have the Best bagels, and cream cheese. Amazing motzo ball soup, and corned beef hash hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The best Matzoh ball soup in all of Las Vegas and Henderson

dQX-QCGgN3E03MVmQ73mLg.text: I was going to pick up a ho-hum sandwich at Trader Joe's but then I thought "Lox and Bagels!!"  So I ordered it at the takeout and ate it outside on the patio at a sunny table. The bagel was fresh, lox were fabulous, came with capers, onions, olives, cucumbers, fresh chive cream cheese, and half pickled pickles (truly awesome - this is how I make it!!). I'll be back for the challah bread and matzo ball soup for sure. I hear that the Ruben is pretty good too and I can't wait to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Sorry about the shadow - breakfast perfection!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

uNPxtXtq3irAaSXbWmtQMw.text: So, I've been here twice. Food was ok, but just not deserving of 5 stars. Here's the consensus of the 4 of us: -Generous portions -Matzo ball was bland, chicken overcooked, broth really good -Blueberry cheese danish was fresh, but filling was from a can -Black Mountain Benny was really good, causing indigestion -Reuben sandwich was the best -Service is not the best, so expect the servers to practically tap their foot while taking your order.

Xo_20zJF1X_cQn--vOg9HA.text: Best onion bagels I have ever had and their cream cheese is to die for. I've also had the pleasure of eating at the restaurant and the cesar dressing for their salad is thick, creamy and doesnt over power the taste of the salad.

y_ODu-PwlA5F1OHCIIC1ww.text: The matzoh ball soup is beyond fantastic! Flavorful and hot with a perfectly sized matzoh ball in it. Had the Ceiley's Stack which was also delicious. I probably would have left them 5 stars. It I can't when our server had absolutely no personality, she came to take our order without saying a word. No hello, how are you, what can I get for you. She just stood at our table until we gave our orders.  Also another server at a table 2 down from ours left that table and walked past ours muttering "I'll be right back, like I just said 4 f'ing times."  Pretty inappropriate in front of the rest of the customers    But the food WAS delicious. We will be back, for a to-go order

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Best matzoh ball soup I&#39;ve had in Vegas! Perfect on a nice cool day like today.

_D6M3AvVg4nJ8wgVUekHbQ.text: Feels like a mom and pop restaurant. The food is ok, had their pork roll sandwich. Definitely wouldn't order it again, basically looked like spam with egg and cheese on bread. Their chicken noodle soup with a matzo ball was pretty good though and would come back for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

NqkF_uSagidxVH1U3SRiSQ.text: Weiss Restaurant and Deli has quickly become one of my favorite places to eat in Henderson. Part of it is that I grew up in NY and miss this style of food done this way. It's a little on the pricey side for the area, but absolutely worth it. I was shocked to find a superior Jewish deli compared to anything I experience in LA or SF -- one that would hold its own in NY.  The only mildly disappointing item I've had was the lattke. It wasn't bad at all, but not the way I like potato pancakes. I prefer to have a little bit of crispiness.  Now that that's out of the way, everything else I've had at the restaurant was spectacular -- reuben, matzo ball soup, knish, bagel with lox and cream cheese, and the black and white cookie were all phenomenal. There are so many excellent choices on the menu that it's tough to choose.  Weiss is a great Jewish deli and I'll definitely be going back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Open-faced Reuben and a knish.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The latke was okay, a little soggy.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The reuben and knish are highly recommended.

AIV3MMAuowAr9cViuEx8VA.text: My favorite deli in all of the Vegas/Henderson area. Food comes out quick, fresh, delicious every time. Gets very busy, so expect a wait most of the time. I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints. Amazingly it's still one of the best kept secrets in town. Strongly suggest the cabbage soup, matzo ball soup, turkey Reuben, and macaroni salad. Grab a chocolate covered Halvah on the way out.

Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Turkey melt

bQXLdeDqW7ysig9B-m0uKQ.text: Delicious tongue sandwich on rye, Very tasty potato salad! Lots of good breakfast choices, so I want to come back. Beware, they close early for dinner time.

emgWFOavgkcKnBI2LoGZjA.text: Family place that has great food and service. The portions are large and the food is great. Awesome locks and bagels.

NDTr9P0NpwZRKxXtTnD3RQ.text: The breakfast is great, the sandwiches are large with good quality meats, and the chicken matzoh ball soup in the best in town.

wQubreu6yidAS26AZ0akiQ.text: Horrible service. I am a regular here. The food is good, but total confusion service wise. We were seated. Then another couple at a reserved table came 5 minutes after us. Then 5 minutes later a third seating. Still no one came to take our order. The server then went to the people seated third and took their orders. The people next to me started complaing. Then a fourth table was seated and the server went to these people that were seated last and took their order. Mind you now, we are waiting 15 minutes with no one taking our order and we were first. I get up to tell the server and she annoyed says I will be right over. She continues to take the last seatings order and disappears into the kitchen. A few moments later, the owners wife and manager comes over to take our order. I tell her what just happened and  as usual dealing with here, no apology a, and says, well I am here now.   I have a friend I turned onto this place. He says he will never go again. Says every time he goes in, its server chaos. Get this. People that came in BEFORE me, I hear them complaining about getting their orders taken, and the waiter says 'Can't you see how busy we are'!!!   One time I went in the take out section. The Open light was on outside, there were a few people ahead of me. The owners wife refused to serve me, said sorry we are closed. At the time they closed at 4pm, I entered about 3:58. I am on the line maybe 3 minutes and the owners wife says sorry we are closed. I say I walked in before 4pm, the door was open and the open sign on. She refused to serve me. She has seen me in there many times before. If you people giving these great reviews can overlook the horrible service and a nasty owner/manager with zero people skills. Have at it.      They are lucky they are the only game in town. If a Deli of comparable food opens up in a 1/4 mile radius, Weiss will be Finished. I drive from the north west to frequent this business and to say they have no appreciation for their customers would ne an understatement. I am 66 yrs old and this is the first time in my life I refused to leave atip. I am a tip earner, and always tip. Even when the service is bad. I always think, oh well, maybe they are just having a bad day.  This lousy service and nasty unapologetic attitude filters down from the owner herself. Will not be back.

Xj-uPqHEY-lIb1raX_1QKA.text: This place is tucked in the corner next to the bench statue, same parking lot as trader Joe's and the animal hospital. They just finished their renovations which I personally don't really like cuz I liked how open it was but it does give people a little more privacy. Everytime I go I order the same thing...cleary silver. Stacks of meat with Swiss cheese and coleslaw. It is huge so I always share with my husband. It comes with a side and it's always potato salad. We love their potato salad so much we order an extra order lol. The meat is sooooo soft and wonderful!!!! On the other side there's a separate door for take out orders. I go on this side as well to buy some garlic bagels (this thing is garlic with a side of bagel and smells sooo good...if u like garlic) and a black n white cookie.it is $3 for one cookie but this mf is huge....it's a little bigger than my hand lol. There's also the potato salads and other deli needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Cleary silver

PeWfV_ugrW2QFv8ADzs2_w.text: Picked up salami/cheese on rye,  bologna/cheese on challa & pastrami/cheese on rye with a small potato salad & small matzo ball soup. $60 plus tip. Other than a TON of meat, nothing special to me. Ordered at 4:55 & still waiting for the order at 5 :50.... come on now, sandwiches not rack of lamb.... lol Very pricey, which I don't mind if worthy & very slow service. I don't think I will return. Too many options near by.

Njkrn_QuAc2ckoMUD_kPNg.text: Order two mother of corn beef hash they both were extremely salty. No cheese on tuna sandwich. Eggs in both breakfast sandwiches  are not to to order bagels without cream cheese.  It's will be a long time before I will order food to go from this place

HLp0D1D-CLEc5B5WcnKh-Q.text: This place is a real find  for anybody seeking authentic Jewish themed delicatessen. They have a full breakfast menu and a lunch menu and everything in between. From standard three-course breakfast to pastrami potato pancakes lox bagels the whole works. The portions are large  and full sandwiches are tough to finish. The Chicken noodle soup with matzoh balls is fantastic. Prices are reasonable, the services director. Interior is nothing fancy exactly what you'd expect for a restaurant concentrating on their food. The bonus is it's also a bakery sure to go to the other side and pick up a nice assortment of  freshly made breads. It's hard to resist the smell of baking  bread and bagels.

8yICCTbyXOZ8IOVSF2wzmg.text: We visited from Albuquerque. The pastrami as well as chopped liver are delicious, great bagels.

6BEUpK_sjiQHzKVXKjHfxw.text: Bagel: best in LV. Lox: perfect. The woman who cuts the fish is a genius with the knife.  I go to Weiss to fill my weekend fridge. Soup, fish, bagles. A bissel thiss, a bissel that. I looove to bring Jewish deli home and this place hits the nail on the head for me.   The girls that run the counter are thorough and consistant.

cf7p6awH-OIRBmZdhByTUA.text: I wanted to like this place. Heard good things about it and honestly I  wouldn't  give a 1 or 2 stars to a small business. But i am seriously disappointed.  Just spent $30 and seriously went down the drain.  I got the chicken fingers for my daughter and for that price i believe they should be house made. Im sure those are the ones you can get over at costco or maybe restaurant depot? The soup had no flavor at all.  the mushroom thing was ok.

2wi1N_3LXsN1kPFBZkKqtg.text: Anytime I come to Vegas, this is a MUST go to spot! The food is always amazing and the service is friendly.  As mentioned, this is a Jewish deli that serves authentic dishes made with love. The bread and meat are top quality and go together to create the best sandwiches ever! This trip, we ordered the the grilled cheese....TO DIE FOR! The oatmeal is fresh, hot and filling. The serving is HUGE, I can't image anyone actually finishing it. They serve it with all the fixings....brown sugar, milk and raisins. It comes with a side of fresh fruit.  You must, and this is important, get a black and white cookie on your way out!
