Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. BLT....with yummy Cole Slaw!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese!

ZhpyLSForu0DI60YqLfxow.text: The best black and white cookies in town and the bagels and cream cheese are great!  I wish they had a dairy free cream cheese option as well.

1LKgMAJoyvI4e6voBz4PgA.text: The service was slow  the pastrami was microwaved and didn't taste fresh  returned it He chicken soup was ok had lots of chicken an vegetables mildly flavored  Potatoe pancakes were large  in size  I ordered 2 could of just ordered one Matla brai  needed salt Food needed seasoning. It was bland I would not recommend this place

ReoqHNdxo5EgEffvtyN8Hw.text: I was raised down the street from this gem and have yet to find a reuben has good as their's! The most amazing restaurant in The West Coast!

pC_Cd92PZzH_zagQ6TrPSA.text: EDIT: After three years, I'm happy to report Weiss is still a go-to. So many things make Weiss a great spot among my regular rotation.  You'll just have to check it out & see for yourself.   (Make sure to take home a Black & White cookie)

SMxM3Vw-lRm6Rxp3c4QLdQ.text: I've only been here once, but I will definitely go back. It was a while back but I had been searching the area for something  more in the lines of comfort foods. After googling and searching yelp, I read a few reviews and looked over their menu. It sounded like it was close to what I was looking for so I  headed over after work.   Food - I got an open face roast beef sandwich with mashed potatoes and gravy, as well as, some chicken noodle soup. The soup was pretty good, but the best part was the HUGE plate of roast beef and mashed potatoes. They were the warm, yummy comforting food I was in a search for that day. I totally left happy.   Service - It was just a touch slow but the kid was pretty friendly and brought things out in a fairly quick manner. The only reason it was slow was that he was the ONLY person there and there were quite a few tables. I tried to be patient as I've been there and it kinda is hard.  I know this is a jewish deli so I totally need to go in for bagels one day, but I haven't had the time or thought. It's hard to find a place in the city with any semblance of comfort food so this place is a good alternative when I'm wanting mashed potatoes and warm yummy goodness. It's not the plate lunch places of the South, but it's a good substitution.

oTzilhcvopdk9HiLzdhudA.text: I came with a friend who suggested we have breakfast here and I'm glad I did. I had their potato pancakes with a basic egg breakfast and then ordered a variety of their pastries... and they were out of this world AWEsome!!!  When we came in it was full and as we ordered our food it got super busy to where there was a line outside the restaurant, which makes sense since it was a saturday morning.  The service was friendly and prompt and we all got exactly what we ordered and it was all at a fair price. The total check for 4 people came out to $46 with tax, but not including tip, which isn't that high for the huge portions we were getting.  It's 2 thumbs up for this breakfast joint and I look forward to coming again!

_PF_Z_Lj5rwj-EYUh8jNYg.text: We eat here on a fairly regular basis and have never ever had a service issue. The staff has always been friendly and courteous even when they have been short staffed and busy. The food has always been excellent. The portions are huge so my husband and I usually split an entree or sandwich.

E6z8DMKy8tUM3YeFyT4dgA.text: First visit today on the recommendation of a friend.  God bless her!  EVERYTHING was good.  I am a picky eater and enjoyed every bite.  Had to buy some half done pickles to take home plus some pastries.  I don't like macaroons but I love theirs!!!  Tender and soft...mmm.  My first matzoh ball...where have you been all my life?!!  We'll be back!

BUBLkOAPB7aVQQHjginqiA.text: The best deli ever! Huge portions of great food! Matza ball soup is a must! Can't say enough good things!

wNeXYaco7VXx0KlSKzkvgw.text: Outstanding food! Gets a little busy here so you might wait for a table but it's worth it. Matzo ball soup is outstanding!

lEIvhlTEmnzZt_2zQmyruw.text: This was a favorite restaurant of mine.  However, last several times I went to eat there, customer service policies issues were very very poor.  Last time I went there just for some soup during the later end of their published hours, we were told they stopped serving even though they were open.  It is because of these poor customer service policies that I am disappointed with this establishment and now have repeated my story when teaching business growth.  As a former retail business owner, if customers came in we served them.

rkQiQeMHYtaF50zqdv6NmQ.text: Some of the BEST overstuffed sandwiches I've had. Get the combo Corned Beef and Pastrami on their fresh baked Rye bread with Potato salad. Delicious. A little pricey but one of the BEST Jewish delis I've been to. The Pastrami here is waaayy better then Bagel Cafe in Summerlin which is way too fatty for 15 bucks a pound. Try to stop here when I'm on this side of town.

k-ytM5F7nRbqY_JGd97_5w.text: Great sandwiches, omelets, and soup. Chicken noodle out of this world.

GKo799TFXt4O6pZBRqyflA.text: Over this summer, I hit Weiss Deli 4 times.  Prior to Weiss, Harrie's was my go-to Jewish Deli ( at least in vegas ) mainly because it was so close to my office.  Now, I'll take the extra 1/2 hour to hit Weiss instead - this place rocks !  I've tried the breakfasts, the deli sammies, the soups , the cookies, it's all good with me !   pic added

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. couldn&#39;t finish !

qL0rT79L8-UIYnrA1FqSEQ.text: Best spot in Henderson for breakfast and lunch. The bagel sandwiches are to die for( try The One). Go here quite often and can tell you I never have bad service, or bad food! Try this place ASAP if you like Jewish deli food, I assure you, you will not be disappointed.

HF2oif78mYRyzWiFlpDMiQ.text: Went to Weiss Restaurant for breakfast.  It's about 20 min drive away from the Strip in the town of Henderson NV.  Afterwards go to Ethel M if you're interested since it's only another 5-10min drive away.  It's an old style restaurant that's pretty popular now since Chowhounds mentions they have the best bagel outside NY in Vegas.  B. didn't like the booth sinks too deep he said, so we got a 4-top table.  I got: Poppy seed bagel w/ cream cheese $2.75.  I wanted sesame but they ran out.  I asked for it toasted & it was.  Cream cheese was on the side.  B. got regular bagel w/ lox & cream cheese $5.25.  That's cream cheese w/ pieces of lox mixed in.  I liked it better.  2 scrambled eggs $1.75 - we shared, fine.   Corned beef hash $4.95 - housemade.  I liked it, but found it salty.  OJ $2.25 - not freshly squeezed, B. got it.  Coffee $1.95 - they refill it free.  Our total $18.90 + $1.53 tax = $20.43 before tip.  Separate bathrooms available.  Credit cards allowed.  They have a little deli section & bakery too.  Didn't buy anything there.

J3JsGfcFvpeluiMQRW8U6w.text: What Weiss' lacks in decor, they more than make up for in hospitality, menu selection and food quality. The staff is warm and welcoming. The place was buzzing when we arrived for lunch but we were seated quickly.  The staff worked like a well oiled machine making sure we never waited for more than a couple of minutes for anything. The menu was enticing and our selections lived up to the hype.  My husband ordered a Reuben and I ordered a Turkey half melt. They both arrived quickly and were so delicious. I definitely recommend and will be coming back when my travels have me back in the area.

Np8MMbdSwBbCBeVnBQaVdw.text: Great place for sandwiches..no subway or double meat needed here. They give huge portions like a new york style deli. Everybody is friendly and helpful..if its your first time here..share a sandwich. You'll thank me later

1FinfnqxrbJ9mpVqUgl7Mg.text: My family and I love this deli. You definitely need to share with someone because one meal will feed two.I definitely recommend this deli, for good food and great atmosphere.

9-17kyaewPZpNz-fLIAjtA.text: BEST BREAKFAST IN VEGAS! Friendly staff- amazing food and definitely has a cool vintage flare to it. I'll go again and again.

23KWlfHiEQuxv9y8yZ_StA.text: This place is simply AWESOME! It's definitely worth the stop if you're ever in Vegas. This mom and pop shop serves quality food and affordable. Those who dine here at Weiss will definitely spark conversations across tables in sure excitement and awe of the portions here. They are literally to die for.

9Cnu3ueveFYhbBVmDND_nw.text: Food is fresh and just delicious!! The roast turkey sandwich, pastrami sandwich, chicken soup, potato salad, homemade pickles and green tomatoes, fresh rye bread...omg I could just go on and on. Everything was amazing and the service was great!!! Love it!

lW3MFKJHT5evEaUWheP7JQ.text: FINALLY a good Jewish Deli!  Don't leave without trying the Matzo Ball Soup!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The dip
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Philly cheese steak
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich

XQ45_Dtq1xBAgevkfJkUWw.text: Best bagels W of NYC. Great breakfast. We choose pancakes or French toast. Yummy. We come to Weiss whenever we make it to Vegas. We like breakfast best. Lunch is equally as good so, if we can, we try to get here twice!!

Pg0SCG9NXgab2w02NCJuyQ.text: The food here is great. Everything I have had so far has been fantastic. The service here is also top notch. They are family owned and care about their products and it really shows. Honest food, reasonable prices, and friendly service. I recommend you try them out and see for yourself.

CtOZ-ox1JzdCGVqmcLXxtg.text: The reviews are True, this place is great.  My sandwich was the size of a small child and I absolutely loved it!

0rVbjJMg0oc5g7EAq807NA.text: I did not expect this place to be a full service sit down restaurant. We showed up at noon on Sunday expecting to order a sandwich at a counter and look around at all the wonderful dessert items. Instead, we were instantly in the middle of a busy restaurant that offers a big selection of breakfast and lunch options. I don't think I have ever taken so long to decide on what to order. I chose the half order roast beef sandwich on a soft roll with a side of fries. Easily the best roast beef sandwich I have ever eaten! It was piled high with plenty of mayo, mustard, lettuce ,and tomatoes. The french fries were run of the mill and could have used more seasoning. Better yet- throw some gravy on those fries. I am so glad I ordered the half sandwich-- it was plenty! My wife ordered the half order brisket sandwich with a bowl of chicken soup that we heard so much about. The soup itself was good, but had a dill flavor that was overpowering in my opinion. On the other hand, the brisket was tender and delicious.   Our bill was a little over $20.00, and the service was great! Considering this place is a bakery, I was disappointed in the baked goods available for sale at the counter. I saw a few cookies, but was hoping to find an eclair, pastry, or cake to try out.    I am giving this place a solid 4 star rating for the sandwiches, portions, and service. I will definitely be back to sample their breakfast menu.

8HcS7OVKMi-lZS6JgGiywg.text: Under categories for food I had to put "Bagels" and while Weiss' does have bagels, they are so much more than a coffee shop. Weiss is a full scale Jewish deli, in a city where so many are overpriced and underwhelming.   You can get everything from BAGELS, lox and cream cheese, to live and onions. Their sandwiches are piled high, and asking for things like Russian Dressing do not add $1.50 to the bill.   My favorite thing on the menu is not anything any other deli has, and I promise if you try it, just make sure you share, is something you will not soon forget! It's called the Cecily's Stack and it is brisket piled on potato latkas, top with melted cheese and smothered in gravy all served with a dollop of sour cream! It is simply amazing, the perfect comfort food, and one can never have too much of that!  My only complaint with Weiss' is that it is so far from my side of town, I desperately wish they would put one over here, hint hint!

6xGysTE_o9qibR-hM0GaSQ.text: If you can get past the shabby appearance you'll find this is an excellent Jewish deli. As a former New Yorker I was thrilled to find a deli in Las Vegas that cures their own meats. Weiss has  marvelous corned beef and pastrami, fresh bagels are truly authentic, and the Chicken soup gets an A plus.  They might want to invest some money into some renovation, but despite the run down exterior, the food makes this restaurant worth a visit.

U5KyIa39uudx8c0tICsIKw.text: The food at Weiss is consistently delicious! My husband and I grab breakfast here nearly every weekend. We try to spread our business around, but nothing lives up to Weiss! The Hash Stack is one of the best things I've ever eaten! The bagels are the best I've had outside of NY, and the sandwiches are massive. I almost always take half home for dinner.

ze9xr9civXJWPvy4nxrRqw.text: I have eaten here for years, sometimes with just a few people, other times with a large group and they have always been accommodating. The food is excellent! Breakfast, lunch or dinner you can't go wrong, although breakfast/lunch are my favorites. Good food, large portion size. Very reasonable price. The outside dining area is a great place to enjoy breakfast!   My only complaint: The weekends can get busy, especially in the morning at which point the service isn't as good.

MrqsEjP8Sww7d1lQQdfQbQ.text: I went there on a Saturday with a friend from out of town because several people told me the food was very good.  I like the Carnegie Deli on the strip but I wanted to try this place which was closer to home. The waitstaff was very hurried, at least the young man who waited on us was.   It took a while to get service once we were seated.  He was brusque and was not helpful.  When I asked about a different type of bread for my pastrami  corned beef sandwich he just said "it has to be on rye, nothing else will hold it." He did not come back to the table to ask if everything was ok.  I just felt rushed. The pastrami corned beef sandwich was good and big.  I had plenty to take home with me.  My friend said the matso ball soup was good. I would probably go back and hope for a better, less rushed experience.

IZnpqZNLmUu_VmJuoQ6W-Q.text: If you care about great food and portions in a deli, this is the one to eat at! It is low key deli with really great items. Everything is made in house and you can taste the great quailty. You are also on my top favorite places in this city!

OLE4AHk6eCqJ-Pgh2IrWvQ.text: Best breakfast experience in Vegas:) We got the whitefish salad with bagels three days in a row:D I cant wait to go back!!

FBm2SvJ8GTITR61Rw2xaAA.text: Great! You'll eat until you hurt. We go out of our way to eat here each time we are in Vegas. Get Ruben and chicken noodle soup.

tF7-sAgXNmsLfa8tPxo52A.text: Every Sunday we visit the BF's father and have a barbecue at his house which is close to Weiss Restaurant.  On the way, we stop by at Weiss to get a pint of potato salad, which is so delicious and deserves 5 stars!   I can't wait to try other items like Pastrami on Rye!

VX51veNWu0He1d8Ms5IXvQ.text: Good solid diner/ New York deli food in a relaxed family oriented atmosphere. The chocolate egg creams and excellent bagel plates are some of my favorites. We love this spot for casual dining.

mZD7tvE1vvzvwcwvF0a82Q.text: Best breakfast in Green Valley! The Black Mountain Benny is my recommendation.

ruiB6EWECvnZbc_kGNe6LQ.text: Almost drove right by... It's located in the back of a run down strip mall. Got nervous when we walked in and the place was empty (think it was around 3pm on a thurs) anyway decided to trust the good reviews and sat down to order. We both decided on a half sandwich and matzo ball soup combo. 8.95 for combo and 1.50 extra for matzo ball soup as opposed to the soup du jour. Holy shit! The portions were ginormous! The soup which I thought would be a cup was a big bowl served  with bagel chips. The waiter reassured me this was the smaller size. Heh. The half sandwich was enough for 2 people! I had pastrami and he had corned beef. Both were piled a foot high between the biggest half slice of rye I have ever seen. Pastrami was sliced paper thin( just the way I like it) and soooo juicy and delish!  I didn't try the hubby's corned beef but he enjoyed it very much. Would definitely go on a reg basis if it was a little closer. Next time could easily share unless you want to take home leftovers.

XjqV-XjdWCX4Gh_aLd7UpQ.text: This place is definitely one of my favorite places to go eat and and I have had FAR too many good experiences in this restaurant to outweigh any bad experience I might have. It's a pleasure to eat in a place that understands a big appetite and quality food in a town where we have a huge variety, but a lacking in overall quality. I wrote a review a while back when I was on a strict diet that had me very edgy and came in upset already on my cheat day and let ONE problem I had (out of 100+ positives I've had) lead me to write a review that IN NO WAY is a representation of how I feel about this place, and for that I feel bad. so I wanted to correct that snap judgement I made sitting there that day by re-writing my review. The only other thing I can do to fix this error in judgement on my part is something I already do, which is continue coming back to eat here whenever in the neighborhood and continuing to recommend this restaurant to anyone I know who wants to eat a great meal from a small business that in my opinion a lot of restaurant owners should take notes from and apply to their own restaurant businesses locally.

4T6TmQzxMKzA5_5piP7iQg.text: Great down-home atmosphere with classic comfort food. Portions are enormous, and, as it's comfort food, can be heavy.

JW27-g1Kk4JkZGW0Oc4CBw.text: Breakfast, brunch, whatever; be ready to enjoy an absolutely delicious meal. The customer service is outstanding and the food even better. This place has a family feel to it. The Hall-ah french toast could not be more heavenly. The tongue sandwich: tender. Their latkas: luscious. Even their coffee will satisfy your cravings. Go there and be ready to be happy.

rvG1FGnqDtkRXfW6buaXow.text: I ate here again for omelets. My personal favorite is the Brentwood which is open faced with broccoli, swiss, bacon, and more. Very good. A nice heaping of toppings paired with the perfect amount of eggs. The omelets come with your choice of bagel, fruit or toast.  But this is the place to do FRENCH TOAST. If I wasn't cutting carbs, I would order french toast every time.

AAPqhEmZQSdydiXqFo9lEQ.text: Earlier tonight Las Vegas was in the high 30s to low 40s and we wanted some kind of soup. Since we were going to play at Sunset Station we decided on Weiss restaurant. We ordered the corned beef and pastrami have sandwich on rye with matzo ball soup. I like that the sandwich had thin slices without too much fat. I used a little Dijon mustard on the corned beef but the pastrami didn't need anything. Both sandwiches had plenty of meat and tasted great. I never had matzo ball soup and I don't know what it was supposed to taste like. It tasted like regular chicken soup with a large dumpling in it. Nothing too special about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

G-mK-yVQ2jttVkPQlenJjg.text: The best deli restaurant in Las Vegas. The portions are huge. I really enjoyed the pastrami on rye with cheese plus got the chicken noodle soup as my side. The person I was with ordered the eggs Benedict. It looked delicious and the portions were big. The menu is very extensive. Seemed like the crowd was transplants from New York. Can't wait to go back.

OVOjuOC_w1Fnd0HJ9aj64w.text: HORRIBLE.   Worst customer service of any establishment ever.   Asked at the counter to make a to go order she said I'd have to order with a server. Wait 20 minutes for a server who rudely tells me that I can't order to go from her I have to go back to the girls that told me to come to her.    After going back to the counter to the girls that are laughing now I ask to speak with a manager and they inform me that there is no supervisor on property which is confirmed by the cook as well.  No one is in charge watching the staff ???

ulGUYFkTrUUwex-ks0FkWQ.text: Amaaaaaaazing corned beef sandwich. Trust me and get the half because it's a LOT of sandwich for one. It was extremely juicy and tasty also came with a side so I opted for macaroni salad. Really good but slightly under seasoned. Highly recommend!

uynAp4cQ3QW2OPJ1sj-hoA.text: Still love the chicken noodle soup here.  Lately Im here more so for the liver and onions meal on Fridays. But for $17.95? Average cost for sandwiches are now fifteen bucks. Mixed feelings about that. The ambiance doesn't match up. While they did refresh the restaurant with new paint and furnishings, it still cramped and cold. Even though FOH is understaffed, the service is good even though this place gets  crazy busy.   Mr B says he doesn't mind paying more $ for his hot roast beef sandwich. He agrees the comfort food here is still waaay better than the new diner(s) that popped up lately in Henderson.  As long as the $ comes outta his wallet Im here..lol..plus much rather patronize and support small & locally run businesses, than franchises dictated by owners who don't even live in your community.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Liver and Onions w/Roasted Veggies and choice of chicken Noodle Soup FTW

nKPU6d5gblJBv6cUlsrVVw.text: This place is a joke, zero stars is what they deserve.  Rude and incompetent wait staff.  Incredibly bland food.  They over toast the bread for the sandwiches.  My toast was hard as a rock, the roasted turkey literally tasted like nothing, and when I left so much food behind the waitress said nothing. That is not normal. I am left to assume they are use to people not liking the food and don't bother to ask.  Don't waste your time or money.

5Rdm3jApe8Z2lI--k06mXA.text: Great corn beef and pastrami sandwiches.  Best server in the world Sharon I think,,with this German accent. Made me feel like I was in Munich and waited for her to start singing Marlena Dietrich songs and bring out big mugs of Hefeweizen... if you like chopped liver and all the other salads and goodies in the deli case, they have everything on the menu to go.  Sharon had a cranky old lady that wanted the dressing mixed in her salad not on top so she hollered to the kitchen, "Can someone toss my salad??" I swear my drink shot out my nose and kitchen staff laughed till they hit the floor.  So much for Germans knowing American slang. So it's a joke now to ask "how's your tossed salad?" She will blush.  This deli is a great break from the strip delis and better quality and prices may seem high at first glance but if you see the size of sandwiches, you'll think they are training meals for 600 lb life. I actually got a couple meals and a snack. Don't miss the deserts they are great and Sharon knows the menu and can recommend good choices to fit your taste. Yea it's not on the strip but not all great food and service is on the strip. Sunday brunch could easily become a tradition. Anything on menu can be packed to go. Give it a shot if you like old school excellent deli nosh.

b0AJOqHFOJrsnGV-Gep79Q.text: This used to be one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants but it's been going downhill for years now.  Service is terrible, food not much better, but most important is how dirty this place is. The last time we visited our booth was filthy (including the floor). Asked young female waitress to call busboy to clean. Her comment was, "it looks ok to me". So I insisted and she got an attitude! We ended up leaving as I was afraid this waitress would spit in my food after arguing with her and to my amazement the waitress and busboy stood out front and clapped as we left!!! NEVER AGAIN!!

aVPyvu16KSZP3Go0onusOw.text: Yes Virginia, there is real East Coast Deli in Las Vegas (Well Henderson to be precise) This place has all of your deli favorites. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The smoked fish was so good, I thought I was back on the East Coast. So without any further ado, I say if you need to satiate that deli craving, this is your place! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The Tongue On Rye!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The Tongue Sandwich On Rye, What Else?
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

HjchiZznJXXxitKq5waiFQ.text: Good deli. reuben was a little heavy on sauerkraut, philly was very good, bakery items delicious. Girls at the counter were very pleasant and on the ball. Would go back.

S4kCefnNZRweoGtMpAwzyg.text: Weiss Deli has been on my radar for some time so I decided to do lunch yesterday. I have to say, I am a little disappointed. Mostly because what I really had a craving for I did not see on their menu. But that did not stop me from enjoying what I was able to order.  I ordered a half pastrami sandwich on rye with a cup of chicken noodle soup. I would have like kreplach soup but I didnt see that so I added a matzoh ball instead. I also ordered a potato knish because I had never tried that before.  The soup came out quickly. It was very good. A fair amount of shredded chicken. Both light and dark meat. Some carrots and celery. Lots of long skinny noodles. And a big ass matzoh ball. To echo Norm K, it did not need salt. It had plenty of it already. I cant say for sure if the broth was fresh or from a concentrate. I lean towards the latter. Either way it was a good soup. Very satisfying even on a warm day.  My sandwich came out next. Two thin pieces of rye bread with tender pastrami piled high. A squirt of mustard and it was on. A good sandwich but hard to eat. The bread was not sturdy enough to hold up to the meat. Taste trumps cosmetics so I can look beyond that. The pickle on the side was lack luster. Not very briney. More like a fresh cucumber. It was refreshing but I like a good sour pickle.  I dont know why I ordered so much food. I wasnt even that hungry. But I still had my knish to go. It came to the table hot. Very hot. It was fried golden brown. I wish I could say it was crispy with the fry job but it was kind of a tough skin on the outside. It was hard to cut through without the potato filling squeezing out everywhere. When it came to taste, though, amazing. The only thing that would have made it better to me would be a side of sour cream and chives.   Service was fine. My drink was refilled a few times. My food came out fast and hot. All good things vibes there. But they dont seem to have the kreplach nor cabbage rolls I was craving. And I dont like being told to seat myself. That just confuses me and makes me worried that I'll be overlooked. That is not so much a complaint as it is a reflection of my own insecurity. This was an otherwise solid experience.

fM1dxBgZvmT1IwxjkHAurw.text: I walked into this place after a solid recommendation from an employee. The staff was so rude it was hard to stay and order. I stayed anyway much to my regret. The food was mediocre for the price. The waitress was short tempered and ruder than any server I have met. I paid almost $18 for a sandwich that a McDonalds cheeseburger beat hands down. I will never be back ever. I will even go as far to say the new owners don't give a rats patoot about the staff, customers, or even the quality of food they serve. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!

XVpmdQdyJ4xsdkR4ouaReg.text: This is the second time I've ever been here.  Today, the waiter was prompt to my table, and before I could even utter, "L'Shana Tovah!", the Matzoh Ball soup I ordered was there at the table, literally within 90 seconds!  Very good soup, excellent quality.  I then ordered "The Dip" which was this piled high beef sandwich with excellent beef and au jus sauce.  It was devine.  The French fries were hot and crispy and the pickled items on the plate were very tasty.  The only thing that was a bit off-putting - but not so much to me, as I drop F-bombs daily, the way some health nuts pop dietary daily supplements, was the staff were dropping some F-bombs and a variety of sh*ts peppered their conversations with each other, combined with how loud their conversations were (and I was on the other side of the wall) seemed a bit unprofessional, but hey, the food was that good that I didn't mind.    My waiter was Joquez (sorry about the spelling), and he was really nice, "yes, m'amming" it up, and even shook my hand before I left.    The bill from a small chicken/matzoh ball soup, a Coke and "The Dip" sandwich came to $24.  Not bad, especially since I have leftovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;The Dip&#34; sandwich with au jus sauce.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Weiss&#39;s chicken/Matzoh Ball Soup - delish!

1GL2doFtzIcjJghiqVzvDw.text: This place was delicious! Everything on the menu sounded perfect. I love that I can smell my food cooking and the soup oh man it was sooooo tasty. Everyone had a hearty plate I will definitely be returning #eunicexgerry @eunice.gerry

IFiEoTiEelSZgfS28GnXYA.text: We love the food & the servings are gigantic. Way to much food, but they make it easy to take home the extra.  Oh by the way best chicken soup ever. Will cure a cold overnight.   They have a waiter named Jacques that just makes your day!

GCf1pRuypsX8v4BVBLf-Iw.text: I have been going to Weiss's for years and it is my favorite Jewish deli in town.  The cabbage soup is phenomenal and I order it every time I go. The Ceily Stack is also delicious and their portion sizes for everything are huge. Many of the staff have been there for years and always greet us warmly when we arrive. I have never had a problem with their service. Definitely a great place to eat!

nYkJzwyQPwKcSJrzXVQIrw.text: When You want a Real Authentic Jewish Deli Weiss Deli Can Not Be beat! DELICIOUS & The tall skinny guy serving is So Helpful, Nice, & Very Professional! There servings are Huge & Everything is So Good

gBukK7W0mzpv8hj89LUwzg.text: Love this place. One of the few in town you can get pork roll at, the staff is always friendly and great with the kids, and the bakery is great to pick stuff up for home. It's a great hidden gem in Green Valley!

HEeBK1o4fHN6MT1qNEb4iw.text: Woohoo! As good as it gets!....this is what Yelp has for 5 star reviews and I can say without a doubt that Weiss Deli is still as good as it gets all these years later. Actually, I probably like it more now than I did when I reviewed it back in 2014. My pallet has become quite a bit more sophisticated. The fact that in my last review I ordered a cinnamon raisin bagel just makes me shake my head.   So my go-to breakfast item is the MOTHER OF ALL HASH. Traditional corned beef hash that is so good that even my son, who has all of 19 months of lifes experience, loves it. In fact, he loves EVERYTHING here. He even eats the Eggs Nova Scotia that my wife regularly orders which includes salmon and capers. He eats like it's the last supper at Weiss, it's incredible. Much like his pappy he also loves the matzoh ball soup. It's dynamite. Sometimes we'll get a to-go order of matzoh ball soup, two everything or onion bagels, then a load of their chive cream cheese, which is life changing.   Back to the hash. It's crispy and savory. The poached eggs are always, always, always cooked to perfection. Once in a while the bagels will be a tad overcooked, even then they are amazing. Still my favorite bagel I've ever had. That chive cream cheese, if you are a fan of onion, is an absolute must. The flavor infused in there is just incredible, and they always give you a generous amount. There is a $.95 upgrade for it, but it's money very well spent.   Their service is also incredible too. Very nice servers, the bussers are incredibly attentive and I've never have issues getting refills of coffee or iced tea. They even bring out fruit early for my little man knowing that kids often get fussy when they don't have food 37 seconds after they sit down. The thoughtfulness is always very much appreciated.   If there is one place you visit for breakfast in this city I'd make this the place, it's that good. Waits are never that bad either for as busy as it is. After typing this review I feel like a need to go back to Weiss for lunch.

N2iaLoTUaxZGSWXoimTVtQ.text: The chicken noodle soup is so good! I went in specifically to order that. One of the best I've ever had! The pastrami is so good too! Not greasy or heavy but so so flavorful and juicy. I had the pastrami on rye bread (toasted) and added some mustard, smooshed it together and it was amazing. I saw someone order the cabbage soup and that looked so good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

f-_4xd-8p7NU42sAN-E7Ig.text: First time here , self seating .  But greeted by a server almost instantly . We started with the chicken soup with the matzoh ball. It was very delicious . I ordered the southwest chicken sandwich it was good not great. My boyfriend ordered the ceilys stack which was also very good . Great service and food selection. Will be back !!

7zb-GLSqcoYAeDHD78Bocg.text: 2 words, Manny Weiss!!! Combining Lox and whitefish salad should be illegal, but it results in the greatest sandwich I've ever eaten. The chopped liver is also very good at the Weiss deli

fDygpRxcMCrIhMs8mtTheg.text: Oy! Now THIS is a deli. And the food.... Great portions, great prices. Great service.   Had the Mother of All Hash which also cones with eggs a potatoes. For $9.95 it's well worth it.   My wife's French Toast was tasty and the oatmeal potion was massive.   You want great breakfasts with great portions and prices, then you must go to Weiss'

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

lIMsTXjRjM1GwP3LmeSA8Q.text: This is the best deli I have found in Las Vegas. The Pastrami on Rye is amazing. The waitstaff were attentive but not overbearing. The restaurant was clean. Its not a Michelin Restaurant but its pretty good. The menu is fairly simple enough that they do a few things very well. I would have given it five stars, but $17.50 for a sandwich is pricey.

WL4Gy5rVzcraE0l593enxg.text: FOOD:  solid Jewish deli fare, including cabbage soup, sandwiches, and breakfast items.  I've not had anything bad here, and the portions are large.  SERVICE:  usually friendly, and it gets better once you are recognized as a regular.  They are usually fast and keep up on drink refills.  AMBIANCE:  it's nice and clean, but a little narrow inside.  There's plenty of parking in the strip mall.  VALUE:  good for a deli.

ZJ98HojTNHvgwBTjNHWxrw.text: I just love this place.... After all these years of my goal of trying EVERYTHING in the menu.... I'm getting close - I have yet to have anything that isn't worth eating time and time again.  My office is right across the street, home is just down the street..... I could easily eat here EVERY DAY!  Yum!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheese steak!!!!

odlKcvkZSEnECD-V3fjPZQ.text: If I was able to give ZERO stars I would.  Our bad experience started from the beginning.  The employee informed us that it would be a 10 minute wait for a table, which was fine.   As we sat waiting, more patrons came in and another employee came by to take their names.  We informed him that we were there first, but the other girl did not put us down.  When he was ready to seat us, he pointed to a table for us to sit at and proceeded to sit the couple after us in the available booth.  That was their first offense.  Then he asks the couple in the booth for their drink order and never came back to us.  We had to wait for another busboy to see that we were sat and to take our drink order.  Second offense.  Then the server proceeds to go to the booth first and take their order at least 5 minutes before heading over to greet us.  Third offense.  The booth got their food first...& continues to get the best service while we were neglected.  The server went up to their booth numerous times to check on them them and get them refills.  We had to flag someone down to get refills...& instead of iced tea I had coke poured into my glass.  Fourth offense!  Watching all of the busboys/servers attend to all the other tables around us and never come up to us made us feel like we had done something wrong.  All we did was politely inform the guy that we had arrived first!  The most attention we received from the waiter was he quickly dropped off the bill and only then did he ask how we were doing.  Really poor excuse for service!  Food was just okay, too!  First and last time there!

8m0Vb0r4pDeLSnfCJLRD2g.text: My husband took me here for the first time yesterday and at first glance it doesn't look like anything special and it was very busy so my first thoughts were that we were going to be there for a long time. I was dead wrong we were in and out and I can honestly say that the waiter we had Jaques Was hands down the best waiter I've ever had in my life no joke! Now to the food I got the Rubin and I was so freaking bomb the best damn Rubin I've ever had possibly even the best sandwich I've ever had! I will 100% be going back and this is a place I'm excited to take company from out of town to its a secret treasure lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

0NiXV5xVjRZ9vAVp3q-Haw.text: Amazing deli with huge portions! Don't come here unless you are hungry and ready to eat! I heard the servers could be rough around the edges but that couldn't be further from the truth. I had a blast with my server and enjoyed my whole experience greatly.

pjD718UbIA7U17QiONpzGw.text: Visiting Las Vegas and wanted to try some local flair. Enough of the celebrity burgers, steaks, etc. So we found Weiss. Pulled up and we were a bit afraid we picked poorly. It's in the corner of a strip mall. Very few cars. Some empty tables with dishes outside and some homeless guy sifting through the scraps of food.  Decided to go for it. Opened the door and WOW. The place was PACKED! With Jewish people! SCORE!!  Warning, their sandwiches are huge. Go for the 1/2 size unless you're really hungry or have a fridge at home.   Some of the best corned beef and pastrami we've had anywhere.  Nuff said. Go there and enjoy.

CZdWRwIBBcTAamsP3ZIJaA.text: Came here Sunday for an early lunch. There was a very long wait for the dining room so ordered a couple corned beef sandwiches from the "to go" counter. it took quite a while to go my order but it was very busy inside.  The sandwiches were really good. I thought there would be a little more meat than there was. I am used to great Jewish delis that pile the meat high. The corned beef was excellent and the rye bread was very soft and fresh.  The side of potato salad was also very good although small. I will return and try out the dining room on a less crowded week day.

aAe0gZePi5-0i_7MraMy-Q.text: Holy Moly Roly Poly!  This place is great.  The food was delicious, the rye bread is awesome.  My wife and I each got a club sandwich and they were HUGE.  I recommend sharing a plate when you order.  We also got some cheesecake that was amazing and some bagels and cream cheese to go that were very good as well.  You may have to wait to be seated but it is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Two club sandwiches.

3pJj7cKZD8yNFyYI3Ze3tw.text: Food was so much better this time around. Service was spotty but i can look pass that because I enjoyed everything.   Pastrami was delicious and you get a hefty serving of it. Chicken noodle soup w matzo ball is literally one of the best chicken noodles I've had. Pancakes are light, fluffy and tasty. I usually can't finish my pancakes but I can eat theirs all day..it's so light.   If you haven't eaten here..it's best you do something about it lol.

Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

Yy_vLkyfsqcMBRZRZmWMHQ.text: I finally ventured to Weiss for lunch with my friend. I have heard talk of this place for ages, so was excited to try what they had to offer. Since everyone seems to always rave about their chicken noodle soup, so I knew I had to give that a chance. I decided on the half sandwich and soup, to maximize the amount of things I could try. I'm not typically a big fan of deli meat, but still went with the corned beef.   The soup came out quickly and was enormous. Lots of meaty pieces of chicken and a huge matzo ball in the center. The matzo ball was perfection, I'm usually easy to please with these. The soup was a little under-seasoned for my taste, so I had to add some salt and pepper. I rarely ever have to add salt to anything, so this was very, very rare for me. The soup was very filling and by the time my sandwich came out I was stuffed. I ate about half my half sandwich, which was enormous as well and packaged the rest to go with me. My friend ordered the pastrami burger with fries. It was huge and looked really good and meaty. The patrons at the next table were impressed as well and kept asking him about his order and if it tasted as good as it looked, to which he answered "yes." My sandwich was good and I enjoyed it for the mots part. The bread was a little dry, but adding mustard really enhanced the flavor. I would be curious about their clubs or reubens next time as those looked tasty, as well as their breakfast items.   Service was friendly, but they were short with us and we felt a bit rushed. After our second drink refill, the server left the pitcher on our table without a word, making us feel like we were bothering him a bit. Our other server was efficient, but not very chatty and didn't make much effort beyond what was expected.   For the most part, we had a decent meal and I'd be curious to check them out again and try some more items from their very extensive menu.

qno7j9jlkYaFvTKqZhmMCw.text: Had the "Mickey Ansel" (tongue, chopped liver, roast beef, lettuce, onion, horseradish sauce on rye) was FANTASTIC! The rye bread was so fresh, the whole thing was really delicious! Had cole slaw as well- very yummy. Will return next time I'm in Vegas!

dcVUqx8fcDen4YWJUyZLVA.text: Classic Jewish deli. As good as it gets in Vegas. Bring your appetite, you're gonna need it.

Y0ejSReFhuryKJwmpBJcZQ.text: Jewish deli! Yes, please! I love this place! This is a hard one for me to write because I love everything from here! You can't go wrong with anything you order. I often stop in and order from their take out counter. My standard order is 1lb of potato salad and 3 of their half done pickles! Mmmmmm so so good! I've also gotten their rye bagel and a loaf of their rye bread. The taste is so good you will never want to buy store brand bread again. The White Fish Salad and the Baked Salmon Salad are super creamy and just has that fishy taste I want.   As far as sitting down and ordering a sandwich, which you can also order to go , there are many choices. The standard Pastrami on Rye is loaded with meat, more then enough for two meals. The Ruben is another excellent sandwich. Off their specialty menu I really enjoy the Clary Silver. It is loaded with pastrami, corned beef, melted swiss and it's served on their yummy rye bread.  My Husband really enjoys the Arlene Bianchi, which I also love! It It has pastrami, turkey and cheese all melted together on a triple deck of sourdough (usually comes on rye, but my husband is weird). You also get a side of your choice, but choose the potato salad. Always potato salad!  Basically anything you get from here is delicious! I've never had a bad experience here. The staff is super friendly and nice. The only downside is that it's small and can get busy during peak hours, but what good place doesn't? When the food is this good, waiting just does not matter to me! If you go for breakfast or lunch you will leave full and happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami with a side of Potato Salad and a pickle
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Arlene Bianchi
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Clary Silver

VdlKeO_yVkmNyNOf_0Ye6g.text: Hadn't been here in a few years but since we were on this side of town we decided to try it. My husband wanted a pastrami sandwich for his birthday. They were extremely crowded but we were seated right away. However our server was inattentive. We had to ask her several times for several things. At one point we gave up asking her and started asking other servers for help. One of the things we had repeatedly asked for was half-sour pickles. She finally brought them out and they were Rancid. She told us they had come from the freezer and clearly they were no good but she gave them to us anyway. Also our food was only decent. Definitely will not be coming back here again.

E7FBRMwXBQKXQ-DlgD1w2A.text: The Knudle was very plain and uneventful and overpriced. The Day Old bagels were more like 4 days old and smelled stale when I put one in the toaster. Not authentic enough for me . Sorry.  The restaurant side however is very good...especially the pastrami sandwich.

xdvSzrIN0GZpVSkj6mO86g.text: If you close at 7:30, saying the kitchen is closed at 7:00 is not good business. Total fail. Get it together.

YniCW6QuDIP6_n4VOFMIgQ.text: This will be a bit of a strange review, I actually sent a dish back, but I like the place...I am jumping ahead of myself.  Last week I was feeling a yucky, the start of a flu bug, or maybe the end, it's hard to tell as these things don't hit me that hard, maybe just some man flu lol.  Anyways, the wife suggested we stop in here for a sandwich and bowl of soup.   This place is straight out of the 70's !  The decor, the menu, the service...All in a good way. We got there around 7pm, the place was slammed, a quick look around showed one waiter and one bus boy..Oh oh I think, this could spell trouble.  But let me say this straight away, if the owner of Weiss's is reading this, give those kids more money, whatever you are paying them is not enough, rarely have I seen two people work an entire restaurant so well, the service was great, friendly and well perfect.  The order was simple.  One bowl of Matzah ball soup, two orders of pastrami on rye with Swiss cheese and fries.  Well the soup order was for a small bowl, we both had some and there was plenty left over, the broth was great, perfect for a sicky like me, my wife said the Matzah ball was good, as ever, we will take her word for it as they are not my thing.  Now the problem, the sandwiches came out, and honestly, I thought they had made a mistake, if you had blindfolded me and said what meat is this I would have said corned beef, the closest thing I can equate the meat to is, well if you have ever tried the pastrami sandwich at Subway, it was close to that, just not as good...So yeah it was bad. As the wife like corned beef (which the server said it wasn't and on closer inspection it did look like pastrami so I will give him the benefit of the doubt there) she kept hers, mine went back, instead I went for an open faced hot roast beef sandwich with gravy.  Now that was a home run, great beef, tender and juicy, the gravy was perfect, just a great sandwich.  All in all a good meal, it could have been a disaster (though I will say, how does a Jewish deli serve bad pastrami) but they fixed the issue I had and again, the waiter was fantastic.  So yes I recommend this place, maybe you should ask for a slice of the pastrami before ordering though to make sure it matches your taste.

xfn2-byJfUCb9i-1EIj_XQ.text: Judging by our breakfast and the sandwiches that were headed for other tables, nobody goes away hungry.  The latkes (3 big cakes) were nicely seasoned and mixed well with the applesauce and sour cream.  The hash can hardly be called hash when the meat content is at least 90%.  The Everything bagel may be popular but my Egg bagel was both light and chewy, perfectly toasted.  It was surprisingly easy to get a table at 9am Saturday morning.  The service was a bit slow -- a little bit of pleasant assertiveness solves the service issue -- but the food is worth the wait.  I'd love to have lunch sometime but the breakfast had me skipping lunch and dinner.  This place is on the permanent list for Vegas.

C3BT6MNX_u3wmScylKVGvA.text: A great deli east coast style. Corned beef sandwich, chicken matzo ball soup and the beef brisket sandwich all amazing. By the way the picture of the soup on this page is their small. This is the best deli in the Vegas area period. Yes the service is a little slow at times but this is the west coast and everything is slow.  If you moved here from the east get used to it.

nLkObMUo463-hc8uRKMoyA.text: The food is soo good and soo fresh and you get a lot for your money!  Super cozy environment :)

O_drxbA0PcMWWH9EcP_XiQ.text: Far away from New York and tucked in a strip mall in suburban nevada is a pretty fantastic jewish deli. My meal "half" a reuben and some matzo ball soup were pretty great. I'm only really knocking off a star because I thought the soup was undersalted and a little oily (though other than that it's how my grandma makes it).  Don't worry that a half reuben won't satiate your rumbling belly. Their half reuben is still bigger than a whole one anywhere else. It's a pretty solid showing, though If you, like me are a fan of katz's deli sometimes you don't need a ton of cheese to make a point

NV7NrmY6Q2nHCSN_U8vQ5A.text: Overall I was very happy to discover this place.  Great portions, great price.  I will go back.  Took my 78 year old mom with me and we both enjoyed.

oRwi2-UuyM7EjN7GkvrCxA.text: An authentic Jewish deli with great food. I enjoyed the lox plate which came with tomato, cucumber, onions, cream cheese and a  bagel. Sis had the chopped liver which tasted like childhood memories. Hubby and brother in law had pastrami and corned beef sammies. We thought the corned beef was better but both were enjoyable. Big portions. Good value. Old school deli vibe.

sqylrC_ulU5iRg19ad0MWg.text: This reminds me of some of the places I used to go to in New York.  Service is just fine.  People around here are spoiled because they are used to having their butt's kissed.  The wait staff just seems like a bunch of casual high school kids which is just fine for me.  I would hate the service if this was any other restaurant, but I loved this place.  Really great matzo ball soup, my husband had a french dip that was incredible and huge for the price.  The bagels are the best I've had since I moved here 4 months ago, and they make insane bagel chips.

eDr7q_WNJ5qvySq0zO57gg.text: Weiss has excellent breakfast & lunch food, but most importantly the best bagels & corned beef hash in the city.  Stop by the deli side for some good quality lox & fresh shmear, or grab a seat at the restaurant and order the "beautiful monster" for breakfast (meat lovers only need apply).

9vyTHspkzeqwT-d7vSjjbA.text: Well, I am no stranger to Jewish Delis or Any deli for that matter! I would like to say I'm a connoisseur of sorts. So I was starving today and needed a place to eat. I have heard rave things about Weiss so I though "I'll give this place a shot!" I did just that!  I called a fee times to place my order over the phone considering I had to return to work. They never answered even though they were open. So I hopped my little but in the car and went for a drive. I arrived at this little Deli in between a art supply store and a  hair salon. Wasn't anything to be desires by the curb appeal. I entered and it appeared as if I time wrapped to the early 1990s but I digress! I placed my order, paid and waited....and waited...and waited...then waited some more. My food finally after nearly 25 minutes came to me wrapped in a typical plastic bag and screamed to be eaten! (Insert horror flic screams here!) I ordered the Latkes with Brisket and cheese. A first time meal for me,and was looking forward to it! I rushed to work, opened the package and scarfed my first gooey delish bite of pure bliss! I couldn't stop eating it! I kept shoveling the food in my mouth like a starving child! (Or a fat kid in front of cake!)  I was impressed with the Food. No complaints except for appearance and waiting time! If this place can clean up the decor a bit and work on customer service it will get 5 stars soon!

nIwwCWTOQ6Rgmfg7JKJelw.text: Awesome service and the bagels were great. I got the Leo eggs and some fruit. Very good and light enough to still get going with the day.

f_91iEGV91ffxntGQVAsAw.text: I have to start with spectacular, chicken noddle soap, pastrami, mushroom soap, potato salad, & cold slaw just to name a few of the thinks that showed up at our table. This will be a regular  spot for us.

9rvIZPYs-Vk6iC8Wf7jKlQ.text: Best bagels and cream cheese ever! I always get the garlic bagel, not toasted with cream cheese. The potato salad, chicken salad, rugelach, and deli sandwiches are also all delicious!

MZJtV0BmEz31qMabxZFU6g.text: The only authentic deli in Las Vegas.  Great food and service.  Also fairly inexpensive by Deli standards.

TcQDhoiKIxZaMD5NbXFMvA.text: Breakfast worth overeating for!  We ate here a lot when I was pregnant. Reminds me of a True New York Jewish Deli...huge portions, simple foods made GREAT. The place is always bustling but no one is rushing you out the door, stay and enjoy.

EnhN_dk1t8TbLatQXbGQbw.text: The best homemade chicken soup, this will be my go to place when I need chicken soup. Their half sandwiches are huge so if you get the soup and 1/2 sandwich it will be more than enough. The bread was fresh and I got the chicken salad sandwich and it was delicious. I also got a black and white cookie which tasted more like a large flat piece of cake and it was good.

vWS2kWicVIUDQ0hFHmAG1g.text: Just like the delis in the New York/New Jersey metro area, this place is great. In addition to the delicious sandwiches for lunch, this is also my my favorite place for breakfast....and for you NY/NJ people, they even have Taylor ham (aka pork roll)! The only downside is, it can get very crowded on the weekends....but it is worth the wait.

_9nojXzLjtd_mDIuWEcg7Q.text: Great pastrami and chicken noodle soup, but its pretty obvious they are very dhort staffed.

Y5v4nfTSlI7mS8o6Cdtslg.text: Great food Great price point Place for locals Friendly people . authentic   Jewish  Deli and bakery

p_BJH9PqwrOHoGZiiMlcFg.text: SO delicious! Giant portion sizes. My brother recommended I try them, and I'm glad we did. It's a tiny restaurant, so when they're busy it goes a little slow, but it doesn't take away from how great the food is. Definitely worth the wait. I wish I'd taken a picture, but we destroyed it the minute we got it.

HZeD9NAlsoOJHTM0UbdiQA.text: Used to go when it was Samuels. LOVED it! They knew me, my family, my names - this was quite common and the place was always busy! Then the Weiss family came in. The menu changed a bit but the food quality is still SO good! Matzah Ball soup fans, this is the place! Great chopped liver, whitefish salad, omlets, challah bread - everything is so good! The downside? The service is VERY inconsistent. The staff will tell you (by talking loudly to eachother) when they feel overwhelmed or too busy or if a customer is annoying them. But we've also have GREAT service on occassion. The food/bakery is good enough to keep us coming back, but we are always apprehensive about the service level, each and every time.

05FLcYXZ0i96jlzicpMVDg.text: Ok now this is real food. No patties !!!! Just great old fashion home cooking east coast cooking with that Overseas peaceful feeling with awesome services. This place rock and outside seating. 5 stars and huge thumb up. Weiss is awesome.Can't wait to take my wifey. email Weiss for more info aktur@aol.com

J0T4UmV_84AhhTMW9JhoNg.text: You may want to get the 1/2 sandwich and soup because these sandwiches are huge!!!  Great quality food.

EjlLeYUVJnId6oIJx1Gsjw.text: First, it was called Samueli's, the Samuel's. Now Weiss. The name has changed, and the food has gone from excellent to horrible, back to excellent again...you never know what it will be called next. But as of right now, the food at Weiss is awesome. I used to love going to breakfast with my grandfather here, now I thoroughly enjoy a solo breakfast on the patio (when the weather permits) to cure a hangover. I can sit outside and read the paper and sip my tea without too many distractions or noise. It is across the street from the GV library, and in a pretty quiet shopping center. The only time it is really too busy for this is Sundays for brunch. I love the lunch menu too, it reminds me of a Boston deli with corned beef and matzoh ball soup (excellent, by the way) Green Valley lacked breakfast joints for so long, that even though they are popping up a bit now, my loyalties remain with Samueli's, Samuel's, Weiss...whatever it may be called.

m4SSMF9ZYDjwm5n6yMXM9A.text: I have been here one before so this review is after my second visit.  First....food was good.  Simple presentation and the Leo (Lox eggs and onion scramble) was good but smaller portion for the price.   The waiter was very nice.  The owner on the other hand, was not.  I came with my dad, elderly.  From the same very small town the owner and his parents who co own it I am told, are also from ( in new jersey).  My dad was thrilled someone from his old hometown owned a business here and he looked it up and knows the mom.  When we got seated he asked the waiter if the owner was there, he wanted to say hello, he's from the same small town, knows his mom, who used to own the place.  The waiter was nice and said the owner was in and went to get him.  Waiter came back, asked my dads name, and left again.  Food came, drinks refilled, check paid, owner never comes out to say hi.  How disappointing.  I know that is not part of the restaurant experience but it reflects the attitude  of the owner  I read in some past reviews.  My dad was surprised and commented it's not like we expected a free meal, I just wanted to say hi.  Anyhow, based solely on that, we will not be back. There are other good Jewish delis in the Las Vegas area.  How sad that the owner could not have stepped out on a slow morning ( there were many empty tables when we were there this morning ) and said hello.  They lost a customer and most likely more as my dad is his hoa president in the area and people talk.  Hopefully the owner reads these reviews and acts accordingly in the future.

s1oM1PerpFo5dYk47tEJYw.text: hands down best bagels (in the world?)

T8CzJz1nsN46qwWbYP-S_A.text: So, I have to admit something.  I used to be a regular at an awesome German Restaurant in Huntington Beach, CA called the Einbecker Inn.  Used to go there for their awesome Bratwurst and authentice, rare, hard to find German beers. Alas, they are now gone.  So, you can imagine when I saw "Weiss" while I was travelin in Las Vegas on business and it had great reviews, I had to try it.  Not really thinking that it's a NY Jewish Deli! (I'm not very quick on the draw with these things).  However, when I got my food here, I was blown away.  This is truly an authentic NY Deli hidden in a strip mall in Vegas!  I ordered the Remington sandwich which is roast beef with two kinds of cheeses, onions, horseradish sauce (missing the German punch).  I changed it up a little bit and ordered it on a french roll with no onions and was absolutely ecstatic.  First, it was huge.  Could have done with half and saved myself from rolling out of the front door.  Second, the roll was golden brown and perfectly toasted.  If you are a fan of horseradish and need the sinus clearing properties of such, ask for extra on the sandwich.  Not enough in my opinion.  It was excellent.  Trying to lose weight for an upcoming wedding and felt guilty eating the whole thing, but seriously...it was worth it.  Adding this restaurant to my favorite locations. Don't let the location, how hidden it is, or the dated motif inside persuade you....it would be a lot worse in NYC and if you lived there you would be a regular.  Get over it....ask for what you want, and enjoy!

obBLbYuYd6-Hdqjs6GbM2Q.text: Good food. Sloppy service and dirty. When the front door is dirty and the floor hasn't been swept or the ceiling fans cleaned we should have left.

EpV6jR5AKR6cMJI-iofepg.text: good old fashion food, I'm getting hungry as I write this, service is good...only draw back is things like service get a little slow when their really busy..

eJJWDf1ngbo2iyQ4SwX-Mg.text: I've been here a few times and each time I've tried something different and I have yet to be disappointed. Their traditional eggs benedict is quite tasty and even something simple as the hot dog with fries is yummy! Next time I visit I will have to try the matzo ball soup as I've heard it's out of this world. The hours are limited but it has the nice feel of a deli, quite New York-esque as I put it and for the price and friendly service, you can't beat it. I'm definitely a fan.

YRw7XHgpKWvPGod-51cnig.text: As a 45 year veteran of New York City who just moved to Las  Vegas, let me start by saying Weiss' Deli is authentic and delicious. We tried the Matzoh Ball soup, a Corned Beef and Pastrami sandwich, a scoop of Whitefish Salad and we had some Pickles and Pickled tomatoes.  The Matzoh Ball soup was better than most I have had in New York and as good as the best I have had. The Whitefish salad was excellent, nice and smoky, and a big portion as well. The Pastrami and Corned Beef were very good, not quite as good as New Yorks very best, but good enough to go back for. The pickles were very good as well. All that and fries for 35 dollars including tip with portions big enough that we could not finish half (the rest went home with us). Also, the fries that came as a side to the sandwich. They were fresh, crunchy, and a big portion as well. The decor was minimal at best, the staff was courteous and attentive, and we are looking forward to going back to try what is supposed to be the best challah and bagel in the Las Vegas Valley. Also the Rye Bread was home made fresh and better than any in New York.

FW0b8_GWoliVCxVksFYnyQ.text: Picked up an order this morning and it was great as always. I went with the ONE, it is a porkroll "taylor ham" with eggs on a nice soft roll with cheese. It was exactly what I wanted it to taste like. My wife got the Mother of all hash and she said it was the best hash she has ever had, it comes with home fries ,two eggs and a bagel with cream cheese. I tried the bagel and I must say it was fantastic and the cream cheese is awesome. We also got a blueberry danish that was very good and huge, we didn't even put a dent in it. We also got a brownie for our son but he is still sleeping so I will edit that in later.

_YOj5Kcy1Z3sb9uWnzMrxA.text: NY Jewish deli transplanted in Henderson!  Absolutely delicious and excellent service!!

v4jxAepyWk8vpCDwLhEceQ.text: This place is great but I've gotta break it down.   They make most things "in-house" including the breads  The portions are huge  The prices are fair  The taste is great ( we had the Ruben and chicken salad sandwiches)   Now I'm going to explain a few things so you can decide if this place is for you.  The decor is minimal and functional. Its the combo of an east coast Deli and Diner. I don't think you would like it if you're into "ambiance", but we loved it because it was just like back home.  Also when I say east coast deli , I don't mean the overpriced , over rated ones that you can sometimes find in Manhattan. I'm talking about the ones where the neighborhood goes for lunch and morning coffee with a bagel.  Now on to the food.  The rye is amazing and the corned beef was out of this world.  The chicken salad was like east coast chicken salad, where the chicken is almost puree and the ingredients seem equal in amounts combined. Most places on the west coast have chicken salad with big chunks of chicken and less of the other ingredients. I think both types are great, it just depends what you like.  The potato salad was close to east coast potato salad (once again I say it so you can get what I mean, not because I just like saying east coast ). There are no bits of egg in it and it has an underlying flavor of vinegar. I added a little salt & pepper to spice it up, it could be considered bland. It's also made mostly with whipped mashed and some small chunks of potato. The fries were fresh and hot.  Now on to the service, which I see has had the most disputed accounts on yelp. When we arrivedt it was around lunch time and the sign said "please seat yourself" so we did. The bus boy came quickly to take our drink order. The waitress came several times to see if we were ready to order, which could be misconsTrued for "rushing you" depending on how sensitive you are. The food came within 10 minutes and we were pleasantly surprised with the portions (as I said previously). The waitress wasn't very engaging at first , but after our food came, she checked on us several times. As we commented on what we liked she told us more about how the food is made and the owners. She was very pleasant.  As we were eating we could hear some employees discuss an issue regarding duties and other employees. Now if you are like most people you would find this inappropriate, but for us it felt like home. In any NY deli on any given day you can find the employees discussing everything from their after work plans to their cousin's bypass surgery while they take your order and make your food. I mean really have you met an "East Coaster" that hasn't tried to tell you their life story?  So now that you know,  you can decided for yourself. As for us it was definitely "East Coast Official" and our new favorite place

QREayc77xr9BkUkRbidPrg.text: On most Sunday mornings, you can find me at Weiss. I am crazy for this place. The food is outstanding whether you eat here for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. They have everything, from omlettes, homemade bagels, lox,  the best matzo ball soup, chicken noodle soup, patty melts, etc. When the special says 'Chili' order the chili, it is fantastic!  Weiss is a Las Vegas/Henderson treasure!

gsgq7Pm0HO3HJu-EsZPtdA.text: I've been going to Weiss ever since I was a little kid. My family tries to make it "thing" to go every Saturday and pick up bagels, cream cheese, and lox. I haven't found anyone out there in NV yet who can top their food. I'm in the process of converting all my goyum friends into Jews just for the food ;D

wctru79MjpJWr-wN4OvW1Q.text: Weiss Deli has rapidly become one of my favorite places to eat, whether for breakfast or lunch.  I love their chicken soup, it reminds me of home!  The bagels are just like you would find in NYC, made with substance if you know what I mean, not full of air, but definitely delicious.  I have never had a bad meal there.  The service is just okay and you do need to get there before the rush, otherwise you'll have to wait to be seated.

8MKMURxEJN0j9LpExkcKUA.text: Like going home.   I was raised in New York and I know deli.   This place is the real deal.  Great breakfasts, terrific soup and amazing sandwiches.   The breads are fresh and everything tastes like home!   We came back three times while in Vegas even though we had to drive clear across the city.  Warm, wonderful owners who are still excited about their trade.    Just go!

RfLLIPnuyssS2MTIPuD0bg.text: One of my favorite places to eat when I'm in Vegas! I love the reuben, especially how it's packed with corned beef, light on the cheese, and kraut. The portions are big, and I never skip on ordering the Matzo ball soup. Nice, casual place to eat.

m6iSS83Qdn38x86w54ko3g.text: This restaurant is a local mom and pop with good 'ol home cooking.  I ordered the eggs nova scotia which was filling.  The combination of eggs, salmon, cream cheese, and dill was great in this dish.  The "everything" bagel was fresh and when I asked for extra cream cheese the serving was enough to lay on a thick coat.  I've also had one of their gigantic sandwiches and the pickled tomato was tasteful.

wUvzTP7fQrPom51QhmkIIQ.text: I always liked weiss, when I found a hair in the butter the size of my waste, I said that's it! It is a turn off to see something like that in your food. Even though I told my wife about it she does not care she loves this place,but me, where it use to take me 5 mins to eat, now takes me 2 hrs because I am looking for another belt for my waist.

6848WlWW5bfWuUQWUyNfsg.text: Their french toast alone earns 5 stars.  The service is slow, so don't come here if you are in a hurry.  On the other hand, if you want to have a leisurely and casual brunch or lunch, I can't think of a better place in this neighborhood.  Everything is fresh and homemade.

cEH1w21GHMLSodRQJfiBtQ.text: This place is like being home. It is the first place i have been able to get a good knish and rueben sandwich since I left Brooklyn. Worth the trip. Good friendly, but not annoying, staff. Seems like a good old school east coast deli.

kAjOlfZFZJ02bKD6RbfwGw.text: This by far was my worst dining experience since moving to Las Vegas/Henderson 3 years ago.  First of all I know Jewish Deli's.  Living in LA I've been to the best. Nate n Als, Brents, Canters and Juniors. Factors and Solleys too.  This place Weiss' in Henderson is below average at best, but I went there because it was the only place around with jewish plates like Matzoh Ball Soup and Potato Latkes. The chef/owner Michael Weiss' ego  couldn't fathom that his Brisket of Beef was dry and I ordered something else. Which I happily paid for. He didn't want to take it off the bill, but did after complaining for a while to the waiter in the kitchen.  It was so obvious he was offended, that I became offended that he would question my taste.  I actually got up from the booth and walked to the kitchen window... (since I could hear everything he was whining about) and told him the brisket wasnt good. I let him know who I was and where I worked by throwing my very Jewish named business card next to his hand.  He finally took it off.   On my way out I asked the young waiter if the guy in the kitchen was the owner. He said yes, and said that's why he was offended. He also told me my "demeanor" wasnt  very good and I handled the situation wrong... Who the hell is he? Gordon Ramsey? What nerve to tell off a customer twice his age. Let alone anybody. I am assuming he's the son because he was very rude and defensive. I then walked to the table and took back his  25 % tip.  He told me not to come back in.  REALLY??? Because I wanted to come back for dinner. Darn it!  A food critic I know who was interviewing me this week anyway got a call early.  She then called Mr. Weiss for reaction.  In a nutshell he told me and her to F-off.  He says the RJ food critic Heidi Rinella once skewered his pastrami in a review... and that he sold more Pastrami after that then ever. He says any publicity is good publicity.  Have you noticed that people who offer crappy service and a bad product are the only ones who use that phrase?  If you like a bunch of cheap and pompous asses serving you mediocre food....then YES I hope I can help direct business to the restaurant.

8vjzuBZES9ttbXbHrAecJg.text: I stopped here on my way home from Vegas after reading the reviews on Yelp.  The food was really good and the portions were huge.  Try the chicken noodle soup.  I will go again next time I'm in the area.

1h_4AYiwPCzT2rRoRuNJxQ.text: My brother and his wife recommended this place when I mentioned that I had wanted to hit New York New York for their Pastrami on rye...the best. We'll I've found something better!! Everything was homemade from the Jewish rye to the Russian dressing. Their menu is extensive and everyone at our table loved their food. And yes, the service was just fine. It wasn't rush hour lunch but where is service great at 12:15?

qCoPhRTV8k8XODz0lXF4rA.text: Ok. Ever seen one of those early Martin Scorcese films in NY where the characters eat in a diner/deli? Well this place has that feel. A little bakery on the side with whitefish and tasteycakes. fresh challah bread. and the best damn chicken salad you will ever put on bread....but enough about the bakery.  This joint...and i call it a joint as a term of endearment is crazy good. Breakfast will send you home feeling like home. The lunch has these open face sandwiches that are monster and to die for. now don't get me wrong...this place aint too much to look at...but the food is amazing. If you live in Las Vegas or Henderson and if you ain't eating here then your a shmuck. NO SERIOUSLY.  Man the Hash stack is crazy good with creamy horseradish and if you want a sandwich...ask for a box to take home when you order it. Pickles are great too. I once took my family here for a holiday breakfast...of course i knew i had to wait...but if they know you...your golden...so get to know the staff. Their great. They got us right in; then they wowed the fam.   Just cause this place is a small and off the map doesn't mean it doesn't have a following. If you try to go in for breakfast on the weekend...you might wait...cause its that busy...FOR A REASON.  While all the idiots go to islop or to a chain for breakfast or lunch...THE TRUE CATS KNOW WHERE TO GO FOR A DAMN GOOD PLATE.

_d4uKxU0M-DSHpALhn1TeA.text: Great chicken noodle soup and brisket sandwich Get half sandwich on challah

JNgTNZN78r_aayzbQ4xuig.text: I lived less than a mile from Weiss' for about three years and never noticed it; it's kind of tucked away in the corner of the Trader Joe's mini mall and it's easy to miss. It bums me out when I think of all the crappy meals I ate when I could have been eating here.  The pastrami is always key for me in a deli, and Weiss' is great, not Langer's great but pretty good nonetheless, and they make their rye in-house. The open faced brisket sandwich with mashed potatoes an brown gravy is comfort-food heaven, and I haven't had a bad breakfast yet. The desserts in the to-go area, particularly the cherry breakfast pastry and the massive brownie, are all good. Decor is a bit lacking, but when the food is this good in a neighborhood joint- who cares?

0pXoIzZsT60DBqqwIGVXuQ.text: Awesome. Husband and I came in for a quick breakfast and ordered the corn beef hash with toast and fruit, and the Best Sandwich. Both meals were great- piping hot, salty but not too salty, crisp and not soggy, etc. Eggs were cooked well. It just seems like they actually care about their food. Oh another plus is that they give you a giant orange juice unlike most places that give you a shot glass. 2 giant meals and a drink for $24. Overall great experience.

m6r9RvoVm8CPkclqmXYbbw.text: An oasis in a sea of dreck!  Went to  Weiss to satisfy a craving for deli since moving to the OC.  Weiss did not disappoint.  We had pastrami on rye - delicious   Bread was fresh and the pastrami was moist and flavorful.  We also had whitefish salad on a bagel which was great. I don't think the white fish was homemade - tasted like acme, but I LOVE Acme whitefish salad. Finally we tried the French toast - perfect French toast.  Service was good and we managed to avoid a wait.  Will be back next time we are in Vegas.

zigC4_dvLIftg-oa7PJBsw.text: Most authentic food and great service. Owners are always so gracious!  Deserves a stop on every Las Vegas trip if you are from out of town.

naBvciLjp6FbPRxY-0Rv2A.text: Nothing could be finer than a breakfast at a diner, especially when it's served up with fresh ingredients in generous portions. It isn't technically a diner I suppose, but Weiss has that feeling about it: sparse decor, super efficient waitress and a stream of regulars.   The menu features a lot of things I wanted to try: potato cakes, epic sounding french toast and pancakes, some tempting oatmeal. (Yes, oatmeal tempts me.) However, I ultimately decided on "The Farmers' Market" hash because I could not deny the long list of vegetables being dealt with their homefries and smothered in cheese. It's like a sophisticated Waffle House scattered and covered gone Californian. Not a single vegetable was from a can!  To keep it simple: I loved it. I almost choked on potatoes while shoveling them into my gullet.   Now, on this morning I was a little sleep-deprived and away from my home base. I was hoping I would be able to set up my laptop for about 20 minutes for some must-do business. However, that was a no-go. We started getting suspicious glances from the waitress and coffee refills halted. I am not really holding it against them. I have waited tables, and I appreciate that "campers" can be frustrating. Just a little PSA that this is not a place for working remotely.  However, it is a place for a hearty, comfort food breakfast and a chewy bagel. Sometimes you can't have it all, but good eats should always come first!

-Fbu8Sj6Qeo1yuKHAVNwhg.text: Great pastrami on rye, coleslaw is tasty and homemade, I'll be back. Only 4 stars since it's pricey.

6Fjtl7lEonpwuKqUp8kZJQ.text: I went here for the first time about two weeks ago abd since going the first time I have been three more times! It's an awesome place to get awesome food!  The first time we went we got a couple orders of the chicken noodle soup and took home their homemade cream cheese for breakfast the next morning.  Let me tell you their chicken noodle soup was amazing it was just like the soup my Jewish grandmother used to make me. Oh the memories it brought back!  The broth was sooooo tasty and not oily the chicken is moist they use white and dark meat and that makes a huge difference and then the noodles they are so yummy I believe they may be a fettuccine noodle but I could be wrong there definitely not an egg noodle that I'm sure of. Okay enough about the soup let's talk homemade cream cheese! Holy amazingness they use a Philadelphia cream cheese base and then they add creams and things to it. We had the regular cream cheese and the lox cream cheese both were so yummy we finished them off in one day and I had to go back for more the next day!  I will never go back to Philadelphia cream cheese plain  I will only eat cream cheese from here now. I honestly am so excited to go back here again and try some of their sandwiches!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Philly cheese steak! My husband loved it
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The ruben! Probably the best pastrami I have ever had

lCracI788pIfchx0VckkGA.text: This place is awesome! It's always packed because everything is so good. You'd better be hungry 'cause the portions are whoppers!
