I love the eggs benedict, the lox and cream cheese and bagels, the pastrami sandwich(take half home)... and more... Great little hole in the wall place.

b54OUJEqob7l8qpW4Zyf7w.text: Food always tastes great here!! I'm not a big breakfast eater, but my friends and family who are say the food tastes great and portions are huge.   Sandwiches-great. Matzoh ball soup with chicken noodle is spot on. Just like my Mom taught me to make.   Servers are awesome. Jaques is always, kind, friendly and polite. The older lady that seats you needs to smile a bit (please take note; you are the 1st impression of this place).

j-mEPEEZSiq4Vb5tdNcA9g.text: I believe that "Weiss" is German for white. How appropriate. The food couldn't get any more white, bland and tasteless. I was really eager to try this place. The pictures looked great, the reviews were good, and I saw on the menu that they had cabbage soup, which I loved from Foxy's and from Jackie's in Commercial Center- two late lamented delis which reveal how incredibly old I am. So, and equally decrepit friend and I grabbed our walkers and shuffled on down. It was busy, but we were seated quickly and service was efficient if not particularly friendly. So far, so good.  We were disappointed that they didn't bring us a dish of pickles or a basket of rye bread, which were standard in the aforementioned old-school spots, but then, nobody pumps your gas for you anymore, either, so still o.k. I was trying to be conservative on calories so I had a 1/2 brisket on rye with cabbage soup, my friend went wild with a triple decker concoction involving corned beef, pastrami, and cole slaw. First, we got the soup. I was expecting a rich, tangy, tomato base. This was more brown. You know how when you cook soup and store it overnight it's usually better the next day? Well, this was more like they had been reheating it and keeping it hot every day for about a week so it just tasted old. The accompanying hard toasted bagel slices were clearly a creative use of leftovers that would have been thrown away. I am a crostini fan so I liked them. My friend did not. Then came the sandwiches. They looked good. Until I opened mine to add mustard. The brisket was mostly fat, and wet, soggy fat at that. Like catching a glimpse of myself getting out of the shower. Her pastrami and corned beef were almost tasteless. Again, I think they sliced the meat and held it in hot water repeatedly until they managed to leach out any semblance of flavor.  The only thing they didn't soak were the pickles, which still tasted raw. After sampling those and the flavorless rye bread, I no longer yearned for the free samples. I will say that the chicken noodle soup looked great, as did the breakfast ordered at another table. But ours LOOKED good, too. And what does it say about a menu where the standout is chicken soup? Bland, bland, bland.

wdCo_I_vtJJ1skrrhgoyuQ.text: I like this place for a once in awhile go to for homemade matzah ball soup! You can get it without noodles and just enjoy the goodness of soup. Probably best in town. They try to give you that deli feel we get back home but they don't put pickles on the table anymore and it's gotten further away from a NY deli thru the years. The sandwiches however are nice and thick loaded with fresh meats. The bakery section is quite small compared to others and the challah is better other places. But the food is good and enjoyable, if you get deli food, not a burger.... (Like someone at our table did....) The customer service has been variable the times we have been there and the cleanliness has varied too. Not sure if because of how long they have been there or what but hasn't been remodeled. Depending on when you go, you can be waiting awhile too as the place is quite small. I like this place and the local business but overall it's changed a lot thru the years!

7OwN9GkK3SH7Qmk7dBl-fA.text: Went here for lunch today.  Matzoh soup and a Reuben.....very good indeed!  Waitress rides a 55 Panhead, of which I was envious...  The rest of the menu looked good, I look forward to visiting again!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzoh and a Reuben...classic!

q4d-bCcXa3czgCB21bsTNQ.text: Quick service. Delicious corned beef sandwich, garlic pickle, and potato salad. We'll be back.

WiOBE9Lb6Arg0WFPqZJRiw.text: I come here at least 3 days a week. I always rotate from the breakfast menu to the lunch menu. I will say that my ultimate favorite is the open faced Reuben!! So much cheese! Nom nom nom!!  The portions are huge which is what I love! (That's what she said) the staff always remembers names and faces and even what I drink.

V-SkvXJIcW3w4j5l6RdaSQ.text: Come hungry, leave full. This Henderson deli is one of the best spots to grab a bowl of soup or a sandwich, and the portions are massive.  I have eaten here on many different occasions and have enjoyed my meal each and every time. The cabbage soup is some of the best I have ever tasted, and the bagel chips that accompany it are delicious. The sandwiches are huge, piled high and sure to fill up even the hungriest of appetites.  This small restaurant fills up quickly, so get here early if you don't want to wait around for a table. But don't worry, even if you have to wait the food is worth it.

u6qnnIuN7nBWkKsZW5jWRg.text: Had the hankering for a bagel, and I've been meaning to come here for a while to check it out.   There are two doors, but they lead to the same general area. If you want to sit down, then go to the restaurant side. Today was a quick grab a bite to go, so I went to the deli side.  Service was fairly quick, it wasn't really very busy on the deli side. Fine, not extraordinary. The cashier also went and prepared my sesame bagel with nova lox cream cheese.  I can only attest to the bagel at this moment, which I am devouring now. The lox cream cheese is a perfect blend of the salmon and cream cheese. There was plenty on the bagel, just how I like it. I asked for the bagel toasted, but I may not next time. It's just a little harder then I expected.  Overall, a good place. I'll have to come back and try a meal on the restaurant side.

bpm1bYJmiZtccFGGy30fGw.text: This place was recommended to me so I can purchase something for my father and one of his cravings.  Well I ordered to go over the phone.  I enjoyed the very fast and pleasant customer service.  I ordered a open face sandwich for my self I figured I would try it out.  I have to say that this sandwich was so flavorful and delicious.  The Pickles and the potato salad on point.  I would go back there all the time.  It is a nice medium size deli nothing fancy its very good.

gEW4DO-JZc1D9aOx4Cnz8A.text: Love their chopped liver on rye with pickles. I've had them cater platters for holiday brunches, funerals and just cause. They do a great job, deliver on time and make sure its all displayed nicely. Their chicken soup is perfect medicine when you are "sick" of cooking! Not sure i'm thrilled with the new wall-decor, but you can enjoy eating outside where they accommodate your four-legged kids.

y8x5dGBgvEVrZzxYa3tCvQ.text: Weiss deli has the best matzo ball soup, always a go to when I'm sick. Today we went in for lunch and I was craving Matzo Brie but, regrettably, breakfast was over so I ordered a soup and sandwich. When the soup came out I mentioned to Dad that we could share, our waiter Jaquez expediently brought him a spoon in anticipation of his needs. When the food came out, I was pleasantly surprised with a large plate of Matzo Brie! I was so excited! They put in a special order and surprised me! Excellent food and service!

RTF-ml9n-3rXDOAQXpl-Dw.text: Absolutely delicious! We were sat immediately. Had great service. We ordered the corned beef and pastrami sandwiches on rye and a bowl of chicken noodle soup. Best rye I ever had and an insane amount of meat. The soup was fresh and hot and delicious. We will def be back.

oxO0dovYAj1qooj0xlYY5w.text: I liked this spot - I had the Kosher Beef Scramble and it was a huge portion of meaty and eggy breakfast.  They have a huge menu and I'd definitely go back, but probably try sandwiches since those looked really good.  The service was good and attentive.

u991WGr24cM4_FCXufKcaQ.text: Sometimes the best finds are those you come across accidentally. After going to traders joes I saw this little deli/bakery tucked away in the corner of the mall. It is small and unpretentious but I saw plenty of locals there which is a tip off. Second the size of the sandwiches were impressive and big enough to share with two people. The pastrami sandwich was lean and stacked with meat. The only bigger one I've come across was the famous Carnegie deli in New York. Is this as good, no but if you are in Vegas it is an adequate substitute.

XcrAtxcvgzfxVopHTr7yKw.text: After the movie yesterday afternoon, hubby wanted to eat a sandwich.  I said, "Jimmy Johns."  He said, "No, I want a pastrami or a corned beef sandwich."  I suggested Weiss since I have heard about good corned beef there.  We dropped by and ordered to-go.  The place was split into a to-go and a dine-in area.  We  ordered the following:  -Pastrami on Challah: Over $10 for this full sandwich with a side of fries (you can opt for potato salad or coleslaw).  -Corned beef on rye: Over $10 for this full sandwich with a side of fries (same sides selection as above.  Both sandwiches were stuffed with the meat.  However, by taking it to-go, the thin bread does not hold up well.  We recommend that you have your sandwiches there.  Overall, it is pricey for the food we receive, so it is A-OK.  We do however, plan to try the breakfast menu.

MGXD_RafQMzSnT9Jx7J8MQ.text: We have eaten at Weiss a few times for breakfast and always for breakfast.  Every time it has been great.  We are usually here on Sunday morning and even when full the wait staff is quick and efficient.  The food is always hot and very tasty.  I had the french toast special with a huge pile of fruit. A berry with every bite.  That made my OCD self very happy.  The took good care of my daughter by putting chocolate chips in her single pancake.  She was in heaven and ate more than usual.  My wife also enjoyed her bagel, as she is always a fan of fresh baked bread products.   It will continue to a special place to take my family for Sunday breakfast.  Just thinking about makes me wish it was Sunday.

cKFaVVA9kyued0xME9ot_A.text: This is another one of those places that is really good but you know the service is not going to be that great. They're very crowded and usually very busy every time I've come but the food is worth the wait. The place is not fancy it's usually pretty clean and it's always noisy and busy. Again the food is very good the portions are decent but don't expect your coffee to be refilled when it's empty. You may have to flag down a different waitress or a busser to get a refill on your water or coffee. To me the food is worth it and I go in knowing what to expect.

jcW6OYf7DEx-4zdMaGRDdQ.text: We absolutely love this place for breakfast and know exactly what we want without even needing a menu at all (Mother of all hash with eggs over medium everything bagel lightly toasted with cream cheese and tomato slices for me, Mother of all hash with eggs Sunnyside white toast with jam and potatoes for my better half). Today we came in a little later in the day and had the pleasure of enjoying lunch. I got a half Reuben (if that's the half the whole must weigh more than the table!) With a small bowl of chili and hot green tea. It was all delicious and way more food than I could eat. Better half got the hot roast beef with mashed potatoes and gravy. In a word: fantabulous. The highlight, however, as always was the service! Jaques is fantastic. Super charming, gracious, never forgets anything, amazing good manners uncommon in society these days.  We both just adore him.

dwoMOaB84UAw0TV3NFqSDA.text: Best Deli ever. I had the Lox Plate and it was real fresh and trimmed perfectly. My daughter had the Corn beef hash and it was amazing. Our server Margie was a delight and the bagels were awesome. I f your looking for an authentic east coast deli this is it.

M9L2O_hkVfC2V2bk_1nMww.text: Review is long overdue... This place is LEGIT! What a hidden gem in Las Vegas (of all places). Reminds me of delis I go to in SoCal. Always have breakfast here when I'm in town. Food is amazing, portion sizes are very generous (Omelettes and French Toasts are HUGE), service is great and to top it off prices are cheap! Do yourself a favor and stop off here for breakfast instead of spending a fortune in any casino/resort on the strip with mediocre food and you will be surprisingly very pleased and satisfied! Haven't been here for lunch or dinner but I would assume it's just as good! Keep up the good work and food Weiss!

Upsvx-R4_54xlYTydzBGWg.text: We've been coming to Vegas for years now, and are always on the hunt for off-strip eats.  We found Weiss and wow, love it.  It's a small place, no frills, but clean.  The service is very friendly and attentive.  Now what you want to know is the food, so here is what we had:  1) Ciely's Stack with the brown gravy on the side. The thing was mongo huge! The braised brisket wasn't dry, but not moist. The gravy and cheese mixed with brisket on top of the potato was super yum.  Gravy on the side let's you combine with fries too!  If anything I would ask for a little less cheese, but that's a personal preference.  2) The Remington was great quite amazing. The salted cucumber that came with the sandwich was surprisingly very tasty. It was like perfect open face sandwich with roast beef, horse radish, onions on top of rye bread and smothered in melted cheese.  Again huge portion.  3) The Challah French toast....holy crap this was awesome!  Super soft and full of deliciousness.  If you like the cinnamon flavor you'll love this.  The only thing you might want to add on this is some strawberries.....and ice cream!   Next time I will try the pastrami, that looked amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

tP8r4_hrv8gJMLGUUrDIEw.text: The best staff in town AJ and Rachel ROCK Juices are always fresh and delicious. You may also want to try the smoothies.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. San Gennaro omelet
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Monster Hash
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Oh My! I love this (Hash Stack)

YrkdyzfMR01NBWDx43Cd_A.text: I've been getting my breakfast last 3 days while I'm in Vegas, the place is really have a good food guys. I don't usually leave a feed back but they deserve one.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

Knm-qQ3F5WSIsOa9wUgyGw.text: Ordered the Nova lox platter. Quite big, but for the price it should be. Around $15-16 or so. I enjoyed it though. Salmon tasted good, not too salty. Comes with plenty of veggies and olives and a bagel. Probably should have ordered two bagels because it's a lot of food for one sitting. Took some home and finished later. Also tried the matzo ball chicken noodle soup. Really good stuff. Giant matzo ball, probably could have been smaller. But all good. A little crowded at times, but decent environment. Serve beer and wine. Not a bad spot. Worth checking out.

B_1zDPP3pyOO3cX1zXDdHQ.text: I'm unashamed to say I've been here roughly 8 times in the last month. I keep giving them opportunities to disappoint me with a meal but it just hasn't happened. I recently moved right across the street and thankfully I yelped the area and I found Weiss. It's tucked back in the corner of the Trader Joe's shopping center so it isn't the greatest location but I hope that more people find it like I did. I love the people that work here, I love the food that they bring me, and I love the prices I pay. I stop in here a lot in the mornings for a quick bite before work (as, it would appear when I'm there, a lot of others do) and the service is always quick and easy.   Specific recommendations: black mountain benedict, everything bagel (either just with cream cheese or as the bread for any of the sandwiches), the latkes, the omelets, the French toast... I guess everything. But seriously that black mountain benedict is amazing and the everything bagel is the best I've ever had. And of course you have to get a black and white cookie and a danish from the bakery. They're huge and pretty exquisite.   Eventually I'll make it in here for lunch/dinner but as it is I'm perfectly happy to eat multiple breakfasts per week in here.

m9N8tMmdnBWxCfHPKwnWsw.text: Overpriced. Portions were big but ratio was poor. I would rather have a quality sandwich than a giant sandwich. Soup was meh. Potato salad was good though. Overall, I'd rather spend $8 at Arby's than $18 at Weiss.

W_Tl7kDQmetiLdxZayXrBQ.text: On my recent trip to Las Vegas, we met some family members here for lunch.  Most of our group ordered chicken soup.  Some had matzoh, some did not.  The small bowl was hardly small.  I've had matzoh soup in San Francisco at another deli, but Weiss is far better.  Fluffy, tasty dumpling in delicious, hearty soup.  The corned beef was delicious.  I had a vegetable sandwich.  My only complaint is that the caraway seed in the rye bread overpowered the taste of the vegetables.  I should have asked for a different bread choice.    No one left hungry, that's for sure!

Z5ztRUb6iC9exlnMonMwmA.text: I'm considering calling Weiss the 'Last Of the Great Delis' in Nevada!  Even if you have to drive from Summerlin like my fiancee and I do to eat at this fine establishment, believe us...IT'S TOTALLY WORTH IT!  Inspired by watching the documentary 'Deli Man' last year, we decided to research what delis are still left here in Nevada.  Very few sadly.  Along with my family, I've seen a wide variety of great delis in Las Vegas come and go since 2004.  It's very unfortunate to see how buffets, food trucks, and fusion eateries are causing delis to disappear more and more in Nevada.  Luckily in researching what's still here, we came across Weiss Deli and Bakery in Henderson.  It's absolutely the best we've tasted in a long time!  I'm Jewish but my fiancee isn't, however she has been learning more and more about Jewish culture and cuisine and she absolutely loves it!  My Mother even got her a cookbook of old Jewish recipes!  Weiss has one of the tastiest bowls of matzohball soup ever!  My Grandmother would roll over in her grave if I said it was better than hers, so I'll just say it is equally as good!  Their fish platters are amazing.  A hefty helping of lox or white fish with a nice plain bagel, sliced tomato, capers, onion, lettuce (I never eat lettuce but it comes with it), olives, cream cheese, and the pickle...can't forget the pickle! Weiss has some amazingly delicious pickles!  I'd love to just order a bowl of them!  Plus, their signature overstuffed sandwiches are so big and savory, you'll probably need to eat them over the course of two days!  They also have Doctor Brown's soda for drinking too!  Next time I go, I am definitely going to get a bottle of cream soda! Haven't had that in soooo long!  Weiss is a friendly place that's perfect for large parties as well as small groups.  I highly recommend checking them out!  From the looks of it, they're not about to be leaving Nevada any time soon!

OAVH80-woT0LFKrb2FER3Q.text: Fantastic place, whether it is lunch or dinner you are after. Homemade food, generous portions, great tasting everything! The server was kind and helpful and personable. I feel like this place is a well kept secret right next to Trader Joe!

7LGVx7zvFDgPjYBmLn4wog.text: Only the second time here and this is about to be a regular place that we visit!! We've had the same server twice and he is always so polite and the food doesn't take long at all. Super good too at a low price! Highly recommend. Love this place! :)

KW8GAcJJDn9pvHYpmidhSA.text: There was a time where I thought Weiss Deli had the best matzoh ball soup in town, but then I discovered The Bagel Cafe :X We happened to be in SE part of Vegas and decided to give Weiss a go since it had been a while... The chicken matzoh ball soup was a bit bland TBH and there wasn't much chicken. I did like that it is made with thin noodles and comes with bagel thins BUT Bagel Cafe's comes with an actual bagel.  The pastrami omelet was tasty and filled with meat!  3 Stars because the service was not that great... It actually felt like we were somewhat inconveniencing the server.   TIP: Opt for the cup over the bowl. It's huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

9VS58SzsrID-Jo18t2Bz8A.text: If you love homemade Jewish deli food, over stuffed sandwiches, huge portions ya gotta go to Weiss....excellent service and the food was off the chains...I try to stop whenever I'm in Vegas

SNZu6KgoX_BOz7hcRJ8kdw.text: I so miss this place. Their latkes are amazing a must try with apple sauce and sour cream. Their eggs Benedict's are also good they have four or five different styles if you choose from. And if you're feeling hungry try their Remington open faced sandwich with a slice of their cheesecake.

lXv9uO5N7HNNZgi8CG7lAA.text: My favorite breakfast  place. They are always consistently great. Giant portion sizes, always more than I can finish. I have been coming here now for over 15 years and it's always yummy .  They make fresh bagels each day. My husband gets the french toast and it's equally delicious. They use fresh baked bread then top it off with lots of butter and powdered sugar. I have to steal a bite of his each time. We usually come for breakfast however the lunch and dinner is also great. The salads  are giant size and filling. I only get a half of a sandwich because it's a ton of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Created my own yummy  omelet. Spinach, bacon  and mozzarella. Delicious! Bagels are excellent!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Everything bagel with cream cheese .

j6siq6VGP2BVOFEAVWk7hg.text: Great food with a smile. Try the liver and onions and the beef and cabbage soup is delicious

lPYiRjUNePpyxYjQWaNteg.text: This review is based solely on the service! This was our 1st time here. The food was good. However, the service was embarrassing for my family! Our waiter, a younger college aged guy, was not friendly and we had to almost track him down for our check. That wasn't even the worst part. He was too busy gossiping, VERY loudly, with the kitchen staff. Someone needs to explain that partial wall is NOT a sound barrier and I didn't appreciate his use of "F" bombs around my family. The 2 stars is for the water boys. They did a good job keeping our glasses filled.

VDD3cwUHQVZKmFfKNha_Qg.text: How have I not reviewed Weiss yet?? If you're looking for a solid breakfast spot and/or Jewish deli, Weiss is it. They have a sit down restaurant and a to go counter where you can get things like Matzo Ball soup, Lox, pickles, and bagels. They rearranged their dining area a few years back so they can seat more people and it's always packed on the weekends. They have bussers and waiters that have been there for years and they employ a lot of young people but everyone is always SO friendly and consistent. Their coffee is also some of my favorite: Douwe Egberts. You definitely won't need cream or sugar.   Their bagels are usually my go-to (with lox or.. in a sandwich or even just with cream cheese). Most of their breakfast and lunch specials are amazing as well. Everything is amazing, seriously. My boyfriend recently had their special of coconut and almond pancakes. Three gigantic pancakes, major fluffiness. And somehow we couldn't stop eating them. I've always wanted to try their lunch and especially Matzo Ball soup but I usually can't pass up their bagels. I still feel like this is hidden gem in the overall world of Las Vegas but the Green Valley and east side definitely know what's up with Weiss.

3q-gfGj6Y4rEUSc_Hy3YKw.text: Finally got around to trying this place out...I'm happy I did.  It's a small place but has plenty of seating and service was nice and very fast.    We came for breakfast so I can't speak on the sandwiches or lunch time offerings but breakfast was definitely good.  Now this is my first time here or really having this kind of food.  I had the "Eggs Nova Scotia Lox".  I was very impressed with the flavors.  Eggs cooked well and the salmon tasted great.  Potatoes were on point and the bagel that came with it (I got garlic) was superb!    My girlfriend got the Lox platter which came with all the fixing to put on a fresh bagel.  Also delicious!  Price was fair, even on the cheap side with the size offerings.   I will definitely come back to try out lunch.

HLcPLCyBrnmzpRPWp-5ZrQ.text: Our family came to Las Vegas for  couple weeks for fun. My wife use to live in Vegas a decade ago so she knew all the "local" places that were "off the strip". My wife knows I love authentic "New York" style deli food. This restaurant is in what I describe a "strip mall" but it's deceiving since the inside is spacious and busy, which includes a bakery. We were there when it opened, for breakfast, and all I can say was great service and great "comfort" food. We all had variety of dishes, corn beef hash & eggs, bagels with lox(smoked salmon plate) and kids choices of more bagels with cream cheese.  The food was delicious and bagels were fresh. This is definitely on my return list next time we in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

QSFIeHDevXVFgODBOtquZA.text: Great Chicken Noodle soup!! Actually everything I have ordered is great, but had to give a shout out for the soup. Could eat it everyday, and I do sometimes. This is a regular place for lunch good prices and excellent service and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Look at all that chicken!&#39; They don&#39;t scrimp here

9SYbTVnYd7EOWRECMQ8nXA.text: The only real deli in Las Vegas. It's excellent, just like back east. Been coming here for years, good family owned place. The server Jaquez is friendly and on point with his service. It's all about the food here. It's a staple in Green Valley as far as I'm concerned.  P.S. i just recently found out they make "Pork Rolls". Everyone should try it.

z9tHOR9nf5rCocf73sbU_Q.text: First time for this deli but definitely not our last.  We had the turkey melt open faced a side of fries and their potato salad. It's a good thing we split because it was huge!!! The sandwiches were very flavorful and oozed cheese. Maria was our server and helped explain some of the dishes we were interested in. We will be back to try breakfast!!!

FWcAqPGZxjiOwpUgnLlkSw.text: I was on the hunt for a local lunch spot  (that is NOT fast food) close to my work. I had heard good things about Weiss from my coworkers  I Ordered over the phone, asking for a 1/2 sandwich and I ended up getting a full sandwich. I didn't want to argue because I was hungry and didn't want to risk waiting longer for them to correct the error. I thought that maybe it was a good thing and I would end up with enough left over for lunch tomorrow.   I am not a picky person but I cannot help but being majorly disappointed.   The rye Bread was so soggy due to the amount of tomato and lettuce on the sandwich.   The upside was that the Pastrami was hot and fresh. Potato salad was very tasty as well but the pickle on the side tasted very odd. Maybe this being a Jewish deli the pickles are seasoned differently ? I am a pickle fanatic but couldn't push myself to eat the whole thing.  In the end I paid $13 for soggy mess of a sandwich that (despite being cut in half) I couldn't even pick up to eat. I ended up using the huge pieces of lettuce to make a wrap. This was not what I had hoped to have for lunch but I made it work.   Service was friendly and fast. I do not believe I will be back. The search continues!

VMuwvV7X9SEwyD3Q6cvwEw.text: Was not impressed with this place at all. The chicken soup was solid but the brisket plate came with gravy all over it which reminded me of a school cafeteria. There was nothing in the menu indicating they are going to be trashing the staple item of every Jewish deli. I could taste between the horrible gravy that the brisket was not good. The service was also lousy. They would not let substitute the mashed potatoes with veggies but they would for French fries which made no sense. We asked for bagel with lax. When the bill came they charged $3 for 3 slices of tomato, $3 for the cheese... in short we got stuck with an $80 bill! We threw out the left overs because they stunk to high heaven.

a93IJ10y9uLxEn4pCapE6g.text: This is a pretty amazing find  Not many Deli's left in Vegas  that are like back East. The portions are large and the service was quick. A little $$$ but well worth it. Will definitely return when in the area.

XzeNYj0Gxzj3c0h5DWkBKA.text: Go hungry or go home!  This deli/restaurant is crazy good!  Breakfast or lunch you can't lose!   Dang, even the coffee is good!  In the nicer weather there is dinning outside which is a nice treat. I have tried many menu items and not one item failed my taste test!  They nail it every time!  4 Stars because of the service ... always busy and always crowded.  Would like to see them expand the square footage.  If you are visiting - it is a must at least once!  Pancakes and hash are my favorite!!!  P.S. they are made from scratch !!!!

xeooQDSz6gvUY7n7vw9Lng.text: Lots of food that seems authentic, though by and large the food is pretty bland. I would go with the chicken noodle soup, which is pretty hearty.

yDaWSbybSsxaGq2x3VKpyw.text: I went here for lunch and his was my first visit, hopefully of many. The establish,em is clean and is furnished in deli style. I was seated almost immediately and the staff was friendly.  The menu is truly one of a Jewish deli. I came for a pastrami sandwich and that is what I ordered. The sand which was huge. The pastrami was close to perfect for my taste. To me it lacked some smokiness flavor and although the meat was juicy, it was close to but not melt in your mouth. The rye bread tasted good but proper Jewish deli rye bread should have a crispy crunch and his bread was lacking that. The side of cole slaw was great.  I will have to return to try the many other dishes that they have to offer.

09ASewi003psACfFBXmWow.text: Today is my first time here! Everything here thus far is absolutely top notch! The soup is a meal all by itself. Best chicken noodle ever! This place is packed. For obvious reasons!! Very friendly, helpful staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Yum!!

iMETezsWOBqMFtYGB7nSQw.text: Unbelievable East Coast Jewish deli tucked away in a shopping center in Las Vegas. Make a quick stop in the bakery and grab some bagels or pastries, or grab a seat and order off of their menu...or follow what we did, and do both.  They have a full breakfast menu with some corned beef hash, a healthy but not overbearing list of sides and omelette options...but the real flavor is in the deli sandwiches. I went with some exploration of a pastrami sandwich, but could have been happy with tongue, liver, or corned beef. The everything bagels were also made properly: browned to perfection and heavy on the seasonings.  Service is about what you'd expect at an old style Jewish deli. None of this matters, though, because look at this pastrami sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami featuring other, non-pastrami things

V9bB6t0LevqrwFJpgMOmvw.text: I get really bent when ppl whine about the ambiance of this type of place. It's an old ass well worn deli. That IS the ambiance!!! You don't go to Picasso (mmm.....lol) for a bagel! Ok..had to be said, so here we go:  The matzoh ball soup is really a 2 star to me, my girls (who'll do their own review) would prob say 3. It does have a chicken flavor that doesn't taste of chix base, I'll give it that, but it is definitely not cooked down enough (i.e. watery) and has neither enough veg or herbs for my taste. I agree with the yelpers who say Bagel Cage's is better. A good chicken broth must be rich in celery, onion and carrot flavors as well as chicken. Matzoh ball was a bit mealy too...  Now, moving on to the yum portion of the review! The lox platter was divine. The bagel crisp/chewy, the lox firm and fresh, and all the bells and whistles were perfect. (their capers were different than any I've tasted...almost boozy??? dunno...I liked 'em!)  The whitefish salad was soooo good! One child did not like it, but the other loved it and so did I. Finely minced, perfectly smoked and seasoned, the kid and I devoured it with their crispy, delicious bagel chips. We were glad kid #2 didn't like it! I also agree with the yelpers who prefer Weiss' whitefish salad over Bagel Cafe's.  The service was pretty good. We were checked on often, just never with coffee pot in hand. I had to flag for my refills, but the coffee was very good.  We've also had their corned beef hash, and loved it.  Over all, with the exception of the matzoh ball soup, I highly recommend this place...complete with it's comfy old booths and tables.

ToHc9ZH7sq0-Dm4oC1AxtA.text: Excellent food. Great Matzo Ball soup and bagels. Reuben is melt-in-mouth good. Slow service.

erHAtiPcj2JrrE_a6h_yrQ.text: I've been to probably 100s of delis in my day.  This one is about average.  Portions are decent for the cost and the place is always busy.  Being one of few Jewish style delicatessen in the area my account for this.  Overall... A decent place to get your deli fix if you need one.

_N56GnD6fngxbN05TU5Uow.text: I have been here three times now and always great food (humungous) portions!!! I cannot eat the sandwiches because you get about a pound of meat and they are good for 2-3 people or 2 meals. The chicken soup is luscious, a cup is the size of a large bowl at other restaurants. All homemade soups. The potato salad is the best I have eaten out at a restaurant. The cheesecake is better than The Cheesecake factory. The cream cheese pastry takes me 3 days to eat it is bigger than a pie. 'nuf said. Only negative is one waitress who is efficient but grumpy always. Not sure what is going on in her life. This is a place to go.

PAKZijzkIfIKag3LWT0L1A.text: They bill their BLT as "The Perfect BLT" and they aren't lying. Goes great with cole slaw.  But you MUST try the sweet-and-sour cabbage soup. It's one of the best soups I've ever had and comes with bagel chips.

20SbIMEgb0b_w9JcO5Kz2Q.text: I love this deli. I've been going there for almost two years now. Started off with fewer than once-per quarter visits but over time, I can't get enough! From the Mother of Hash to the simple pancake breakfast, to the huge sandwiches and straight up coffee, this place just rocks it. Every time.  I've also started getting my sliced meats, cheeses and fresh breads from Weiss, as well. Service in the dining room can be slower so don't go there in a rush. I've come to adore the character and care of the staff once I understood it's not a fast-in, fast-out joint. If you want quality, you come here. Speed, go elsewhere. I love you Weiss Deli.

IL4shF9kZk-GfTJhUPXKEw.text: Best matzoh ball soup I've had outside of my hometown (NYC).  Truly.  I can't wait to try their whitefish salad...  Also, their Challa is TO DIE FOR!!!  Why haven't I been eating there every day???

pZfTKs64Qtulgb0Ionb2ow.text: Lived here over 20 years and just discovered this treasure. My husband and I had the best breakfast ever last Sunday. I asked our waiter about specialties and he recommended the hash and the bennies- I had the best hash I've ever had and my husband loved his Benedict as much as I loved mine. I had a fresh made bagel as well- amazing. As was my fruit bowl- every piece of fresh fruit was so tasty! We're going back this weekend- loved everything about it from the very polite young men keeping my coffee cup filled to the cookies we had to buy at the bakery on the way out A+++

mzpeC7MSMtSY2E8L9hDxZw.text: Very good Jewish deli and bakery. Pastrami and corned beef sandwiches are delicious. Matzo ball soup is very good. Knishes and bagels and pastries are excellent. Best Jewish deli around!!

KXceU1uhlUx9mzz-YgBZgg.text: This is such a great little, hidden gem, tucked away in a Green Valley shopping center.  The menu is pretty vast.  The quality is definitely top notch.  Not a fancy spot at all, but definitely a good locals, bargain, quality business.

BAC305sUSDm8RlM26rLbRw.text: No stars for their manager's terrible customer service.  There was some confusion over the menu prices, and I was charged $4 more than I had anticipated.  The manager said "too bad".  She said she would rather risk a poor on-line review, than refund me the $4.  The customer is always wrong at this place.

I62yMx0nJw9MuzSRG2JaVA.text: How cool to stumble on such a cool little deli in Vegas.   Just got off the plane, "starving". This Deli was a life saver and it felt like home the first step in to the door.  Service was great and the portions were huge. While the group I was with are not big eater, we did put a mighty dent into the meals.  Walked away deeply satisfied.

rW3YruiMvwpF1krmr9M7-w.text: Sooo good!!! I am from NY and been searching for a good deli! Everything is so good.   The matzoh ball soup is yummy! A must try.   I liked it better than the soup at the Vig deli and theirs is good.   Great bagels.   NY deli /diner style home fries.   Only negative is sometimes they say your server will be right with you and a long time passes....... But the food did come quick.     I will return again again and again to try other dishes :) and sandwiches

W2zabuSAA0hLubulthp-Wg.text: The staff was attentive and friendly! I had the Reuben Sandwhich which was a delicious and I look forward to my next visit.

qDr1HBW_OrNnY8dMvffbHw.text: Yummo Jewish deli food that totally satisfies my bagel fix. You get a ton of food with your order so come hungry or bring a nosh partner. I order something different every time I go and I always leave happy.

3fyfcwOmOaFOVIii-F--3g.text: Bring a wheelbarrow you'll need it to hold up your belly after one of their sandwiches!  The portions are huge. I wasn't too hungry and I got the cup of soup and 1/2 a sandwich which in reality is more like a gigantic sandwich and bowl of soup complete with bagel chips on the side. .. Pretty good. For 9.95 I got lunch and there was enough to take home.  There is a potato pancake filled with brisket dish that is over the top. This was a really unique plate and we all loved it.  Soup is good for the most part. People seem to love the Matzo ball soup.   The service was fine. I ordered a bagel as my bread and then realized their bagels are too hard for me, the waitress got me challah bread with no problem. She was nice every time we went.  Starve before you go or plan on leftovers. The breakfasts look nice but I haven't tried them yet, I liked how they have a fruit option. I saw another diners plate and the fruit was a nice bowl of melon, oranges strawberries.  Even the coffee is good.  They have a take out section on the side where you can get deli stuff and danishes etc. The Danish is gigantic and very heavy, be warned its super thick and loaded with sugar and cream cheese or cherries or whatever it is that day. Everyone ate a little square off one to try it out. It just may be impossible to eat one by yourself. Most pastries are lighter or airy this is not.  Unfortunately for me I can't go here or when do I will have to be careful with what I order, I think I am allergic to something they use in their ingredients or maybe it's gluten..no idea. But something makes me sickly when I eat there which is a shame. Please note I am not flaming the place they are clean and attentive I highly doubt its them. I am just getting old I guess digestion isn't what it used to be. :(  Personal drama aside this is a great deli. You get a lot for your money. The decor is dated but who cares when you aren't being ripped off like in most of the restaurants in the area.

sCAw-x_mAXI6bltD80hb3A.text: The best corned beef sandwich I've found in Las Vegas / Henderson.

VDdV0raoypp79eGoIzAAtA.text: This is by far one of the hidden gems of Las Vegas/Henderson. I LOVE THIS PLACE! It's a good 'ol Jewish deli like the ones I grew up with in NJ. It's usually crowded here during breakfast and lunch so take that into consideration. The food portions are HUGE but everything I've tried is super yummy! I will let you in on a little secret....the chicken noodle soup is magical! When I'm sick, Weiss's chicken soup is the only thing I ever want to eat. It's plain, old fashioned chicken noodle soup so don't come in expecting anything fancified. The beef and cabbage soup is also surprisingly good! I love that they sell bags of bagel chips to take home and crush up into the soups later on. The hash dishes are great, benedicts are tasty and sandwiches are stacked high. For True east coasters, this place is like a short trip back home and always feels like family, KEEP UP THE MAGIC WEISS!

AGwzs4ak7ruOG3WSJYYndQ.text: We've been having breakfast at Weiss for many years and it is still our favorite. Others come and go but they are strong in the heart of Henderson.   My favorite is the Yalim Omelet and Sesame Bagels. My brother loves their Lox and bagels with capers cream cheese and all that good stuff.   Everyone makes you feel right at home!

S5Islbdd-nMcZSrd1OFN3g.text: I had the traditional corned beef on rye (whole) and my son had a tuna melt. He enjoyed his sandwich which was served open face and smothered with cheese. Both entrees were huge and should have been shared. My sandwich was dry and tasteless. Anticipating this possibility I ordered a side of slaw. Sometimes a great cole slaw can really help a dry corned beef sandwich and elevate it to an outstanding meal. Not the case at Weiss's. Their slaw was absolutely tasteless too - basically watered down mayonaise as the dressing - and horrible mayo at that. Very disappointing.   We had high hopes as we wanted to try a non-strip deli (beyond Canters and Carnegie) and hoping for a great find. I was disappointed. The prices are lower than on the strip, so I didn't feel absolutely ripped off.

9aQ2mW0O6N07imDr9SnynQ.text: Amazing food!  Huge portions and oh soo tasty!  Seating is scarce, so we always expect a wait, and if there is none, it's a bonus.  They have a small bakery attached, that is a must to take a look at while here.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Mother of all Hash!!

DVhpxQwyKdOLIuXGdie54A.text: The food is good, the service is terrible. If you don't care about being served with love try it out.

YgE_UQ-cQdwueXjKULg9Bw.text: This time tried the corned beef sandwich and chicken soup combo. The order took forever, getting a knife took several requests. The soup was ok, the sandwich was a mess, a bunch of corned beef slapped between 2 pieces of bread that themselves were falling apart. It wasn't a pleasant experience trying to eat the sandwich, nor did the taste warrant the effort. Did I mention the service was slow and uncaring?  Honestly after several visits I'd skip the restaurant and go to the takeout deli. Get the half sour pickles and dilled green tomatoes. The meat unfortunately is way way overpriced, i couldn't believe the prices they slapped on the meat to go.   Stick with the pickles and dilled green tomatoes, and skip everything including the restaurant, which reminds me of an uncaring mediocre dining room in a Jewish retirement home.  3 stars for the pickles and dilled tomatoes, 1 star for the service and food.

djNieALqSa4uhiQWW8gGWA.text: This place is amazing!! Portions are huge and prices are great!! Jaques was an amazing server!! If you haven't been here before you need to!

jKbW4Kk4ikc6ygCDgij9Xg.text: Delicious breakfast..scrambled eggs, great bagels and whipped creamed cheese, great home fries, yummy potato pancakes.  Generous portions, very cooperative, and hood value.   Grest lunches too.  Highly recommend.

VDl983Ke5yYd_EGfbq9oXg.text: OMG A great surprise of very good Deli food! All the tables around us were excited to check out each other's plate.

lm3OqzTSBCWNCJXX9YFQ5g.text: The food is great, but the service is a little slow.  I love me some good pastrami, but the meat isn't necessarily spread throughout the bread, so you end up not eating any of the crust because theres nothing there! I love when the meat overflows the sides!   Unfortunately, our drinks sat empty throughout the whole meal until I finally could get someones attention after 10 minutes and yelling "excuse me" for the whole place to hear...

bCX9ixP6HoX1G6jn9FInPA.text: I've had Weiss on my "to try" list fotever, but today was was the first time I stopped by and there weren't a whole bunch of people waiting to be seated.   The restaurant was almost at capacity at 11:30AM when I was seated and by the time I left at 12:10, there was a line. That's always a good sign when you are looking at trying a new Restaurant.   Service was friendly and quick. I ordered the whole pastrami on rye with fries and it was delivered to the table in under 10 minutes.   The pastrami was delicious and even though some people would do a double take at the price, the portion was very large and well worth the cost in my opinion.  The pickle was very good and reminded me of going to the farmer's market in LA when I was a kid and my parents getting us kosher pickles.  The pickled green tomato though... Wow! It blew me away.  I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Weiss Restaurant Deli in Green Valley, Henderson

kkQlbnGPcS7bd5ng8zWbhg.text: I'd prefer to rate it a 2.5.  Walked-in at 5:50PM on a Friday & sat myself, as directed by the sign.  6 minutes later, a guy stopped by the table & asked what I wanted to drink, but it took a little over 10 minutes before waitress Margie stopped by & took my order (the place was only about 1/4 full at the time).  I ordered an egg salad sandwich with lettuce, onions & cheese, and that they could hold the pickle & olive that the menu indicated came on the side with sandwiches.     I asked for the sandwich on an onion roll, but they don't have that.  The sandwich arrived about 15 minutes after ordering, and Margie didn't catch that it came with tomato on it, plus the olive & pickle on the side -- poor attention to detail, but not a huge deal.  I learned the hard way that they put ground up red & green pepper in their egg salad mix.  Seems inappropriate to me, as it has a major effect on the flavor.  I drowned that flavor away by adding deli mustard.  May be an 'authentic' (but plain-looking) & populate deli, but I won't have a need to return.  I was really excited to try this deli, hoping it'd be the source of a great egg salad sandwich, but the service & good didn't do much for me.   May be an 'authentic' (but plain-looking) & popular deli, but I won't have a need to return.  Nicest experience was that after refilling my iced tea, the bus boy left the pitcher on my table so I could refill my own glass.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Waitress Margie didn&#39;t pay close attention to my order, in which I just asked for lettuce, onions &amp; cheese on my egg salad sandwich.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Egg salad sandwich with cole slaw &amp; and order of fries.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Sitting in the back, looking forward at about 6:45PM on a Friday.

zFEU81TJ02p5euL_y_A64g.text: This wads soooo worth finding! Ill come back every time I'm in Vegas! Holy smokes! What a greasy pastrami and Turkey sandwich.

YmqjxbQNatvA90VfcmFcgQ.text: Absolutely amazing Jewish style deli. They have. A takeout station for ordering to go as well as the standard sit down and order. Service is always amazing but the good is down right spectacular.  Staples include the chicken noodle soup (which I always get without the noodle), rueben, or for breakfast there are several excellent omelets.  They sell a bunch of rare cultural foods, including lots i haven't tried.  Abundant in everything I have tasted is the special care and attention from a Jewish grandmother.

jVhZf_o_OGz88gZAEzL37w.text: Had a great meal here. Enjoyed the Corned Beef and Potato salad. Server was terrific. Highly recommend. Simple looking spot but the food did not disappoint. If your looking for real deli food, this is it.

9bPvuJuFQidKkzawf4LP6g.text: Great place for a deli sandwich or a great breakfast. Friendly staff and fast service.   We enjoy the pastromi and roasted turkey sandwich on rye with cheese and cole slaw, they use a special dressing thats really good and the pickles are big and fat!  It's a fat sandwich, three layers, with piles of thinly sliced meat, the rye is fresh and adds to the flavor in a big way, but the wet slaw on the bottom can make it a bit soggy.  its so fat, I've used a fork to help eat it!  Gooo lunches for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Biachi

MmcNii6DVMFUAcP_GVTDrg.text: A taste of the old country!   I love Eastern European goodies & we've been coming here for years to have some classics like potato latkes, matzo ball soup, chicken noodle soup (like grandmas), cheese blintzes, challah French toast, potato  knish, fresh bagels, amazing omelette's with anything you want (my favorite is ham & swiss) and the home fries are amazing! The food is excellent.   The ambiance is pretty basic & maybe one day they'll improve upon it but I can let that slide because the food reminds me of home. The service is always friendly & it's a very casual spot.   They also have a deli area for fresh breads, bagels, cold cuts & sweets. This place is worth the drive across town for me :)

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with fries
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Potato pancakes :) (BOMB)
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Cream soda :)

SUBtcLF3h9HcjO-weTNNDg.text: I just moved here from LA and I was craving a matzo ball soup and this is a little hole in the wall but I will tell you it's a little gem in the wall. The soup was delicious and very tasteful, I highly recommend this deli. My order was to go so I don't know how the services is. The girls upfront were nice and helpful, I will definitely be coming back.

2LvX_wtQkbe7nLbwm8Rqzg.text: This place is absolutely amazing. It's always packed and you have to wait but so well worth it. I've been here several times and everything I have had has been amazing. The portions are huge and will fill you up completely. If you've never been here you have to try the pancakes. They have their own special recipe and when they run out they make no more but they are so good.  The chicken soup is also a favorite. The sandwiches are also very good and piled high to the kilt. When my husband first took me here I loved it and will always go back when I'm on that side of town.

J_76eEQT0lK_qWB0H2I8vw.text: We read about Weiss deli and bakery on yelp and since we love delis we decided to give it a try and we are glad we did. I had the chicken salad and it was delicious and my hubby had the grilled cheese and it was also very good. He had a black and white milkshake and he seemed happy. We ordered the cheesecake to go because I was full because like any good deli the portions are large. The service was excellent. We saw some other people order sandwiches that looked delicious with very large portions. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was my salt bagel was a bit dry and the use fine salt not chunky like I like so the bagel was very salty. We will still go back. I'll will just try a different bagel next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Black and white milkshake
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Swiss cheese. Not the prettiest presentation
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Salt bagel. Tooo salty!

F0TkC0XTivCErFeWWtZP0w.text: Great Jewish deli tucked away in the corner of a shopping center. I expected it to be bigger, although was not disappointed with its size, their food or the service.  Smells, feels, and tastes like a typical Jewish Deli out of NYC.  Matzo ball soup is phenomenal! Great flavor, with chicken pieces and a giant matzo ball, just like my mom's. The bagel chips with the soup are a perfect pairing.  The sandwiches are huge and delicious. The bakery has all essentials, from the biggest hamentashen I've ever seen, to rughelach galore, and beautifully braided challah.  Highly recommend it if you are craving Ashkenazi food from your childhood!

1NF5lhqKlVP0skmTxJjxJA.text: A little oasis for fresh baked bread, pastrami sandwiches and desserts. Moving to Vegas from la I really missed deli's that are on every corner back home so finding this little gem was so exciting! We ordered: 3 Pastrami sandwiches with fries: the sandwiches are huge, we could have order one but so delicious. The fries I wouldn't order again.  2 burgers: huge portions! The burger buns where fresh, every bite was heavenly! As we where leaving they brought out a fresh tray of rye bread, of course I had to buy a loaf.

6mgIYn-izOhtqrvmKf6QUQ.text: OMG: I was sooo happy to see this cookie. DO NOT BUY. Two bites I had to throw it away. Did you see the size & how thick it was, ummm size is not always a good thing and this is why. Ok they where trying something different but, this is Vegas and not New York City. But when doing this put enough filling to compensate the thickness of the cookie. It was sooo dry & I was drinking tea with this. Bland taste and really never tasted the filling because the cookie took over.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

uZGhHQ2hfemLTetGezaMXQ.text: Always a great meal when dinning in!!! But I thought I would try a togo order for work with  7 orders....  Sara who took my order was so pleasant and precise with each order!!!  When the lunch arrived though... (next day...) the French Toast looked great!!! But no syrup ...  called back in to the deli...  and staff was not so eager to hear the news...  I asked if they could have the manager give me a call back.  But no call.... So I called in the next day because Sara was off...  and she was yet again very apologetic and was very sincere when apologizing  for the lack of concern the day before form the staff!!!  So we will definitely order again !!!!   Thanks to Sara!!!!   Hope their management team reads these posts and gives Sara a thumbs up and a bonus!!!  Everyone loved their lunch!!!

QGfw--ryDo9-umR4B7Ylxw.text: I've eaten here many times already. I like deli food so I'll keep coming back...my 2 star given is because the employees/servers that work here are just CONSTANTLY arguing amongst themselves or dishing attitude to customers.  the food is good. I typically get the pastrami sandwich. they serve it as a sloppy pile of meat on your bread of choice, which doesn't bother me much. the matzo ball soup, not bad at all...  but every single time I'm in here the servers and cooks are fighting amongst each other. the seating area is not large at all, so the patrons are kind of on top of each other if packed in the room. there is no music playing so you hear everything going on..  so to give you example of what I mean...you'll be sitting there eating your food and out of nowhere you'll hear "order up" from the cook and the server just yells from across the room "I KNOW" and not the friendly tone.   as we were walking into the place the last time a gentlemen in uniform was complaining loudly about his work. this was before we stepped foot inside.  another example, sitting down eating a separate time and 3 servers were just going at it, arguing about the dumbest stuff all taking place in front of us..  this also carries over into the "deli" area at the front. if busy, the girls there are yelling and arguing with each other, and I've seen them dish attitude our way like we are doing ourselves a favor in buying there.  this can't be news to management, if there is any, because it happens every time I come here. I dunno who owns this place or who is in charge but they let them run lose for sure.

2Yg7c2dYRYOZmoZzrywpdQ.text: If you want an authentic Jewish Deli, this is the place to come to.  The menu selection was great!!  It is tucked away in a retail strip mall, so it's a sneaky find.  This is the spot, the service is great, very friendly staff.  There is lots of options for everyone, they keep your coffee cups full and the portions are very big.  There rye bagel hit the spot as well as the lox. YUM! YUM! YUM!  I took home some bagels and lox for the rest of the family.  If you are in the mood for an authentic Jewish breakfast this is the place. I am looking forward to coming back and trying other options!!

iOBrOa9YTzd4mMTgSfCyDA.text: Tucked away in the non-descript corner of a retail center at the corner of N. green Valley Parkway and Sunset is Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery.  The place was doing a brisk business at lunch and now I know why!  Lots to choose from on the menu.  It's a real old school deli with large portion sizes and reasonable prices.  Salads, soups, sandwiches...  for a first timer, the menu can be overwhelming.  They also do breakfast too!  I tried the Open face Brisket sandwich with mashed potatoes and gravy.  Melt in your mouth goodness!  Fork tender brisket with a great brown gravy!  Our server was wonderful too!  Helpful and friendly!  Definitely a place to try again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Open face brisket sandwich with mashed potatoes and gravy

yz3sIF87IYVBcqpBjGbbvQ.text: Had a Doctors appointment and I was starving so we had nice Jewish food. I brought my German Hubble because he likes Jewish food. I had 1/2 of a tongue sandwich on rye of course with a bowl of their delicious matzo ball soup. Talk about delicious. I also had an egg cream, which was very good except it could have been a little colder. Pickles galore & sour tomatoes. Wonderful meal. Then we went to the take out section. I got a lb of the tongue, pickles & belly lox. It doesn't get any better then this.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Tongue sandwich
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzo ball soup

Y-4D-_nodv8-e-AJTwXjhQ.text: Great menu!  Excellent service! Yummy Yummy Eats!  Our coffee cups were never empty. I love that they cater to your caffeinated happiness.  Big portions mean you don't leave hungry. The hubby got the hash which was huge! We should have shared it. And I don't like corned beef and this one was so tender and flavorful! I took a couple bites just to make sure I wasn't imagining it. Ha! My smoked Lox Benny was good. The lox was cooked and a bit too salty for me. The poached eggs were perfect tho! Soft cooked whites with tender, silky yolk.  Because it's a deli, we had to try their everything bagel and their rye bagel. Both were really good. I'm just a bit too biased ... In that I love NYC bagels. I don't know what it is... New York City just does bagels differently and I love them! Anyways, I digress.  Lots of options!  So if you are indecisive, this could be a problem because everything sounded and looked good.  There is a deli store attached in case you want to take home some bagels or cream cheese or lox or salads or such.   Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked Lox Benny... Tasty!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Stacked Hash Omelette... Wowzer!

VJ1Y6YQm4d6ULztkI_tTdA.text: Nothing has really changed from our review a couple years ago. We still visit here once a week. Good is to notch and large take home portions unless your really hungry. We have gotten used to the service over the years, while it can be rather slow at times we do not have a problem with it as some have noted in reviews. We come here for Michael Weiss' great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Fresh white bread
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken salad Platter
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. 6oz lox. Platter for 2

8jBp9T1R95L5mAUz74yjOA.text: I love this place. It reminds me a lot of a very popular Jewish Deli in NY (Katz). They do get busy so be patient. Sometimes I just go in for a bagel and some cold cuts and others to dine in with my kids. Their chicken soup is great and I love their Philly Cheese Steak  and from the cold cuts the smoked beef tongue as absolutely divine.

bbQvLGmDI_eqi6650lELyA.text: Super happy I finally got to try this place after so long! It's a trek when you live all the way in Summerlin but worth it. I went to town with matzo ball soup, chocolate egg cream, and bagels and lox. For the larger lox order, you get two bagels which is awesome! It served as two meals for the day. The lox was very fresh and delicious. I can't wait to return to try the huge reubens! And Sharon made our first time feel welcoming - she was fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

7CrD7AcbU-6iAue8lLt5YA.text: We've dined at Weiss twice and ordered once through a food delivery app and it has been great every time. First of all, they have excellent bacon and it has never been overcooked. I especially appreciate it in their breakfast sandwich (The Usual). The french toast is huge and delicious and their pancakes are really good- they remind me of DuPars. The combos at Weiss are a great value! I think they have a better bagel than Bagelmania and I might even like their bagels/breakfast menu more than Bagel Cafe's (gasp!). I do wish there was more bagel variety; I've never been able to get a blueberry bagel there and I think our server this last time said they don't make blueberry. I really appreciate that they don't burn all or any of the garlic on their garlic bagel. Everything is affordable and the portions are generous.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The Usual

KyhonQKRS5DwGSZKhBqOBg.text: I can go to smiths and get boars head meat make my own sandwich for under 10$ not worth 13.95...

pVXtSqgbxGBPNWO2kJKCnw.text: The food is excellent but sadly the reviews are not wrong. I never judge a restaurant because of comments but they're all True.. Our service was slow from the time we sat down till we had to ask for our check multiple times..  the patty melt was amazing and the French fries were crispy and fresh.. However will be only coming if a friend truly wants to eat here. I'm personally all about customer service. You can win a crappy meal over with excellent energy and great customer service skills

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. 2nd time having the bowl
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Roast beef brisket
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

Vfg20OBxiG2wuG6AGEiI9Q.text: A restaurant that I crave regularly. They always are willing to modify my order to meet my ketogenic dietary needs. They are always friendly and the service is fast. Based on how busy they always are, I'm clearly not the only one that loves this place.

XaX08bfoZ6ZsG1rTKwhgng.text: FINALLY tried this place for take-out lunch...it was absolutely amazing...had the Clary Silver which totally beats all sandwiches I have ever had my entire life...the meat was so tender and juicy...the coleslaw added to the sandwich took it to the next level...the potato salad was creamy...the pickle was seriously legit (I could have eaten a dozen of them)...totally worth the price and totally worth going over and over and over again

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Clary Silver

2jZEkZffJ6X3Fa2fnkFAIQ.text: Our friends recommended Weiss Deli as an "authentic Jewish deli", and they were right.  The menu offered the expected wide variety of deli meats and salads.  I had a corned beef sandwich with coleslaw.  My friend had a pastrami sandwich with fruit.  Both of our sandwiches were huge and the meat was moist and flavorful.  As good as NY deli?  Maybe not, but quite satisfying for a LV deli.  Another friend had "Man's Best Friend".... a hot dog!  She enjoyed it.  My wife ordered a bowl of the matzoh ball soup, which she declared to be one of the best she's ever had:  large, fluffy matzoh ball; light broth; plenty of noodles and veggies.  It came with bagel chips, which soaked up the soup and were quite tasty.  The large portion made a full meal.  For dessert, we split a large black & white cookie.  A perfect end to a delicious meal.

RjPDIg_MuQ7Ur9_rinGncA.text: I always go here at least once when I am in town. It is a must try place. The pickles are some of the best you will ever try. The potato salad, simple but perfect. We had a pastrami sandwich, which was so loaded, we could have made two sandwiches with all the meat on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Outside

rXjXZxQQJO3kEhgr8Rzy_g.text: We are here while out of town and craving a matzo ball soul for my brother in law who unfortunately got sick during our trip. We all thought he needed that good ol' "Jewish penicillin." He loves his soul and it was a giant portion! I got the tuna melt "open faced," which was the oldest concoction I've ever seen. It was literally a mound in a plate. A giant white cheese slab covering tuna salad over toast. I had to eat it with a fork and knife and there were greasy globs of cheese. It made me gag pulling them off. My sister in law enjoyed her "regular" tuna salad sandwich though.  Waitress and staff were nice and attentive. Deli's have that comfort level and overall it was good between the three of us. We would like to come back to try breakfast next time we are in town.

XzXgHcbaSAQg1czKiP0IiA.text: Being some what of a Jewish deli snob - this place was amazing - we had a 'Clary Silver' that could easily feed two people without a problem - the cold cuts were fresh, warm and lean - CAN'T say enough - try it

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Picture of the Clary Silver

GtBKrqb_31LQJpppXnogEg.text: Remarkably poor service.  Not a clue about customers, and no one cares.  We've been going to Weiss, and it's predecessors for over 20 years, and it has just eroded into a horror.  Poor service and dirty tables, floors, etc.  I will never go back...it's a shame.

e3n_owsnoWzLL7NCLl_z0w.text: Not what we were hoping for, we are recent transplants from NY and enjoy some good pastrami,  Brisket ftom time to time. I don't think we'll be returning anytime soon,

08mKcQsAP8xp64ElcProxA.text: All i need from this place is an onion bagel extra toasted with chive cream cheese. Thanks thats it! = heaven....

mF-b6MdXYi0QMh6HafGvSg.text: Was recommended by a friend to go here. So glad he did. It's a short ride away from the strip. Chicken soup was awesome. I had the two gigantic potato latkas stuffed with brisket which was out of this world. The service was very friendly and attentive. We will definitely stop back on our next visit to Vegas.

N5ddoGLYYa1nuhWNgu_Fdw.text: The Asian in me is drawn to the odd cuts of meat that Americans throw away as scraps. Due to this fact, I naturally gravitated to this Jewish deli. I love tongue and was even more enthusiastic when I saw their specials board. The offering of calves liver and onions ($15.95) caught my eye and I knew I had to get it. Liver has a strong flavor that can be off putting for most, but growing up with all these alternative cuts, I enjoyed it. The caramelized onions where sweet and contrasted well with the salty/peppery bacon. Add a brown gravy on top and the dish was tasty. If that was not enough food, it came with a choice of soup or side salad, veggies, and mashed or broiled potatoes. I am starting to think that the Jews and Asians share similar souls because of what we are willing to eat and the quantity given. Nothing that came out of the kitchen was skimpy or small. In fact, most things could probably be shared. Watching the monster sandwiches pass by made my friend question how someone could eat it without dislocating their jaw.  Sadly, this score is given for the lack of customer service. The busser did not look too please when we first entered and sat ourselves. After we asked for water, refills did not come often. After a few rounds, he got the hint and topped off our glasses. The server took our orders, delivered our food, and asked if we were ok in passing. When she wasn't doing one of these tasks, I did not see her.

H22Rt7T0cHGaWfjZqEfGkQ.text: I'm picky ok and when it comes to pastrami on rye, i'm pickier.  Everything about my sandwich was spot on.  The deli might as well be some deck chairs in the middle of a parking lot on a 150 degree day, I wouldn't care, they'd still get 5 stars for that sandwich.

Ex4DtUlo4ZCQro87N5SB3w.text: Super awesome!!  Home made everything.  Cole slaw good.  Potato salad good. Pastrami and corned beef good. Potato pancakes and brisket good.  Highly recommend.

D_GLSBbLj2PUoX3OmlzGHw.text: Our new spot! Fresh & tasty!   This place may not look much inside but the food and service makes up for it. We ordered roast beef w/ au jus & corned beef sandwiches w/ Cajun lentil soup. Wow! Blown away with flavor and portions!

uCfPfhGQeEM8YWXNmCTlRA.text: My family has been eating at Weiss's Deli for about 10 years. We also order it for our call center about once a month for 40+ people and they love it too. My favorite is the Ceilys Stack, but l'll go for a Reuben too.

NMBPDHK1LsOa6OPdL_MtTg.text: Was a loyal customer of Weiss until today! Came in with my wife and ordered our regular...2 eggs, bacon, bagels and a side of belly lox. HAVE NEVER SENT AN ITEM BACK EVER! Today the belly lox tasted odd...sort of a chemical taste and was too thickly cut (His lox is not fresh but acme packaged). OWNER REFUSED TO OPEN ANOTHER PACKAGE!  Am really really disappointed and saddened that i must now go to Bagel Cafe! Cannot believe this owner is so cheap, he wouldn't try to satisfy a long time customer. Well he's lost my business and anyone I can tell! (He offered NOVA, which is pointless since I order belly for a reason!  Place was starting to look run down anyhow.

lxWAcZ-PkCI5R0shMzFjSA.text: Breakfast/Brunch and lunch are winners!  Always have superb service and anything I have eaten has been delicious!  Corned beef hash, breakfast sandwiches, bagels, sandwiches... YUM!  There a a ton of things on the menu I still can't wait to try.  The macaroons in the bakery should not be missed.

xWZtq-Ont3IiqdX_kFb_Ww.text: For the food I would have to give 5 stars.  The only problem is the shaky service.  If you to during lunch rush except very bad service.  Not sure why they can't hire another part time server.  There have been times that we almost had to leave because of the bad service.  I have to admit that I keep coming back for the matzoh ball soup!

FkXYp0ORoBjgSSC1JWXLnw.text: A real deli. massive sandwiches that taste so great. A True oasis for New york style deli lovers.

hP45ct_8QF_W7xw0tEhu-Q.text: As close as you will get to a NY deli in Vegas, everything is great and the portions are HUGE.  This place is hidden in the back corner of a shopping center so get the address before you head over...

Of1xhMLzo7cZH1WfA_kPSg.text: The Weiss deli was a good find.  I stumbled across it one day in the back of a strip shopping center at Green Valley Parkway and Sunset in Henderson, and have returned there many times since.  Weiss in Henderson and the Bagel Cafe near Summerlin are my two favorite Jewish delis in the LV area.  Having lived in Manhattan (NYC) for so long where I had my choice of high quality delis, Weiss probably comes the closest in comparison to any found in NYC.  The food is prepared the way a traditional Jewish "bubbie" would make it (lol).  Try the pancakes...they use a special cake flour from overseas that makes their pancakes flavorful and fluffy.  They're killer, and put ANY IHOP or Denny's to shame.  I introduced several of my friends to Weiss and they ALL go bonkers over the pancakes. Weiss makes a proper chicken soup, too.  If you order one, the tasty baseball-sized matzo ball is like a prize in the the middle of your big bowl to keep carving into.  I also like the chopped chicken liver pate.  Not too many people would order such a delicacy, but it's the best I've found in Las Vegas--and I'm picky.  Lastly, the sandwiches are generously portioned and made the right way.  Simple, high-quality ingredients are used--none of that processed "meat" you find at Subway or other sandwich shops.  The bread is freshly baked and cut on the premises.  At Weiss, the full menu is available all day long, so you can have those special pancakes for lunch or dinner if you want.  And as you leave, stop by the adjoining bakery, for a sack of fresh bagels to go or a sweet rugelach bite for dessert.  I highly recommend Weiss for a good value, high quality, authentic Jewish deli meal anytime.

QNNpqjihNgkLvuCDpLKTXw.text: For lunch my wife ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup and I requested my first ever matzo ball soup.  Same soup, but my matzo ball acted like a sponge without any noticeable benefit.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzo ball soup

Ar9Xjh3xiJBG4jgTbCk1rA.text: The owner here is really passionate about homemade Jewish deli. Last visit, I orders the Ceily's Stack, sans cheese. It's brisket sandwiched between two giant latkes, smothered in brown gravy. Mmmm. This place has the best challah in town, surpassing even the venerable Bagel Cafe. However, I must say I like Bagel Cafe's matzo ball soup and hamantaschen better. The hamantaschen at Bagel Cafe are of the softer variety and have a nice lemon zest in the very flavorful dough. I know Weiss receives laudits for the matzo ball soup, but I found it didn't have quite the garlic kick I desired. The corned beef hash here is superb as is the smoked whitefish, which I find much more satisfying than Bagel Cafe's chunkier variety. You must have their blueberry danish, which is out of this world. It has a delectable cheese and a compote-like filling which is amazing. On my last visit, I was a little surprised that they seemed to have changed the menu, as they axed much of their traditional Jewish dinner entree fare. Disappointing :(.

k3Lj5O90syQuIC_rGGGhiA.text: My husband and I have become regulars here over the last several months. I first want to say that I do agree with some of the posters here that the service/seating can be slow. However, everyone has always been kind and courteous. Perhaps with just a bit more efficiency with front of house - seating, busing, etc. - things could be streamlined a bit. However, the place does get busy and everyone is working hard. The food is outstanding here. I had been searching for a proper everything bagel, and the ones here are addictive! As vegetarians, my husband and I also appreciate that there are a number of dishes for us here. It is a great local place with a family feel.

d3AXm-PPzB3TK82s9Uq9UA.text: My food was just ok. Not exactly what I ordered. Asked for ham but got bacon. The service was very bad. I had to flag them down to fill up coffee and they acted as they were doing me a favor. But the coffee was good. I may give them another chance.

UCj5GXUca9QzVA2jkhZzTg.text: Great breakfast and lunch. Authentic jewish sit down deli. I especially love the "Black Mountain" ... it's beef brisket married to an eggs benedict basically ... but the sauce is homemade, the brisket is sensational, and the presentation is unique. For Las Vegas, a city severely lacking in local staples off the strip, you cant go wrong with Weiss. It's basically a "dive" but it's pretty unique in the city as far as I can tell.

hooaj_gIk5vs9n4zX4x16A.text: Unlike most of the reviewers I actually had a pleasant experience with the staff. Yes, for the majority the staff is young but I didn't get the impression they were that bad. I also didn't actually eat in the restaurant but rather picked up from their small deli. I wouldn't really call it a 'deli' but they did have some really beautiful looking challah and breads. I picked up a large matzah ball soup because I had a hankering and I wouldn't say I was disappointed but I wasn't blown away either. Pretty basic...not overly flavorful and the matzah balls are a bit big for my liking. Also picked up a half a pound of rugelach - and they were pretty good!

9Jl7AxvzfgjdUeFoGHaElw.text: My favorite Jewish deli in town! Great corned beef on rye. They even have kishka! OMG this is the best deli in town! I try and get there before the lunch crowd which starts at about 11:30. They have really tasty pickles, my mom and daughter like the sour pickles and I prefer the other ones...they are crunchier. Everything looks so good here that I am often tempted to order something other than my usual hot corned beef on rye...yummm so delicious! Also do yourself a favor...dont order the corned beef lean, it needs just a little bit of fat to give it that perfect flavor you love so much!!  The potato salad here is the best on earth! I am not a fan of potato salad usually but at Weiss deli, I order an extra helping every time I come!! Its That Good!!   They also have a take out section which carrys tasty kakes...my husbands favorite brand of snack cake.  Treat yourself to some delicious food ... and some huge portions !! I love it.

Zj0nOcAbVZoNOzLlpyjiAQ.text: It's a bit funny to me that I've spent most of my life in Green Valley, yet cannot remember ever eating at Weiss' Deli. Intent on breaking that streak, and trying one of "The Best of Green Valley", I sent the Hubbers here on a Friday night to pick up some food to go.   He got a couple of small matzoh ball soups, (which were huge, by the way),  a couple of sandwiches, and a black and white cookie. I  had originally thought we were going to share a Reuben, and then he comes home with 2 whole sandwiches! We both enjoyed the matzoh ball soup, and it was our first time trying it altogether.
