The soup was filled with chunks of pulled apart chicken, carrots, and skinny noodles. I prefer my soup to be a tad saltier, but I would order it again. My Reuben was ENORMOUS. It came stuffed with sauerkraut, cheese, and pulled high on rye bread: perfectly toasted, perfect amount of thousand island. I loved the little side of cole slaw too. It was such a big sandwich (on top of splitting a small soup), that I got 2 meals out of it. My husband had a Remington sandwich made with roast beef and horseradish. He enjoyed his sandwich as well. So much in fact, that he was wanting to go back and see how Weiss Deli is on breakfasts. The cashier had handed him a menu with his takeout order and he is very eager to return and try more things.

7VwkR2n4c1RrgCUhfVA5sQ.text: A good solid four. Pastrami on rye is a good go, nice pile of meat on the sandwich. They also have something called halva which I detest but my wife loves, stuff can be hard to find. Staff was pleasant, gets a little crowded around the counter but food is worth it.

vfOEAujFvHFVbKWnz-yb7w.text: I'm only reviewing my one visit, but I can't stop thinking about that darn chicken noodle soup. It was delicious. Also had the turkey melt, this thing was huge, I couldn't finish half of a half if that makes any sense. Our waitress was very attentive, constantly coming by and refilling our coffee and waters. I can't decide which soup is better, my mom's or Weiss, ok, Weiss it is. It's been haunting me ever since.

oqp19J8TsJs6Gu3i-X6cnQ.text: If you are looking for a huge sandwich this is the place to go.  The food is good, the menu is perfect but the price is way too high.  $16.00 for a sandwich kills the idea of eating a sandwich.  It has way too much meat on it, probably not proportional to a typical sized person.  Eating a good deli sandwich shouldn't be a food challenge.  The soups are great, the pastries are eh.. ok. What killed this review is the language behind the counter.  F bombs and other colorful words were dropped as casual as could be.  The wait staff however were very patient with rude customers so I give them credit for being professional at the front of the house, the back could use some curb. I liked the food, just didn't like the portion size and the price.

oLjJmyyHI7l8SyyI1IGWIg.text: One star review. Wow!  Hadn't been in 3 years when it was wonderful. I add an extra 2nd star because it's New Year's Eve and the staff was very obviously understaffed.   But greeting at door and or the table might be nice. Taking less than 20 minutes to take a drink order might have added a star. Saw the food under the lamp for 2 of the 4 orders 45 minutes later, then 10 minutes later the French toast came on a dirty plate that actually made the French toast taste like garlic and a Large dirty smudge of different color under the French toast. The orders came 5 minutes apart and the omelette was dry spinach on the outside and semi cold home fries. The redeeming value was the staff Was pleasant when they showed up to the table. Needs some attention to details on the staff. Simple basics that used to be there, but are missing now.   It might be a while before I dare going back though.   I took the lack of charging us for coffee as an apology, but I think it was more likely attention to detail.  I made that undercharge go on the tip that I struggled to give my normal 20% standard.

noXcycWemmRU9YVgSSbe-w.text: I've been craving Chicken noodle matzoh ball soup!  Usually when in l.a. I get my fix at Canters.  In Vegas, I hadn't found a place yet. . . that is until I found Weiss. We had potato pancakes with brisket and the most delicious gravy, Pastrami sandwich, and of course matzo ball soup.  We were beyond full, but it was so delicious that we just couldn't have any leftovers.  Worth the trip from anywhere in the valley.

DzNKS0EyGDM9d5PiG2WD8Q.text: A Pagan and a priest walk into a jewish deli... Not the beginning of a bad joke but my first entrance into Weiss.    After living in Hong Kong for the past 14 years a proper jewish deli was something I missed dreadfully so now onto the review.  Upon walking in with my buddy the priest, I noticed this was the old Samueli's deli.  So having gone there a bit during my university days I was quite pleased.  Then I noticed it was even better than samueli's.  Hot Turkey open faced sandwich to die for, latkas to die for, bread pudding is so huge you take half home. Actually everything so huge you take leftovers.  I have been going about once a month and I havent had anything bad.  The partially cured pickles are great also. Matzo ball soup is also good.  Everybody walking in acts like a kid on their way to Disneyland.  Service is friendly.  New york diner ambience, not a bad word to say about the place other than I wish they had a nap room in the back after I eat there.

nFZiFaLFFiHLpDkCg1uR1Q.text: Black and white cookies! Omg, I thought I died and went to heaven, which it kind of felt like eating breakfast there. Everything was outstanding, home fries, their bagels tasted like Angels halos and were perfectly toasted. Crisp and chewy. Got seated upon entering and this place was hopping with a steady flow of guest. Staff was friendly and fast. Had the Nova plate yesterday and today I tried with all my might to finish the potato pancakes! Huge and delicious.

7pc3WTw6tne1Y272vcAsHw.text: The only reason I'm not giving these guys 5 stars is because the table wait is typically long. Of course, that's just because lots of people want to go there to eat! Not much they can do, unless the next door neighbor moves out, I guess.The staff is great--friendly and have been there quite a while. I recommend the fried bologna sandwich on rye with Provolone or the smoked lox platter. Also, the corned beef sandwiches, and the omelets in the morning. When they have the split pea soup, it's very good, too. I often have friends tell me about their standing date on a certain day of the week to go to Weiss's, so I know it's a favorite for many.

o7VYd809LsGPhti4Y6El0w.text: Went there after they'd been closed for a month for vacation/re-model. Have been eagerly anticipating their awesome matzo ball soup for a month!!! Let's just say they were seriously unprepared for their re-open. They had one server who was clearly needing help serving. The busboy got our drinks and was actually much more friendly than the server. She came and took out orders w/o even saying hello and was very curt. We got our soups promptly and were seated close enough to the kitchen that we could hear that they were clearly out of A LOT of things and the server was not happy and barking orders at both the cook and the busboy.   The soups were still excellent and the busboy was great w/keeping our drinks filled. We got our food and the busboy accidentally spilled a little soda in my potato salad, I didn't even notice. But he did and promptly apologized and explained he would get another one since he'd spilled soda in mine. I then heard him explain to the server what had happened and heard her belittle him while explaining to the cook why another potato salad was needed. I would say we got the best service by far from the busboy and it sucked that the server treated him so poorly. She clearly needed help both serving and with attitude.   We regularly dine at Weiss' and always enjoy the food. We always get excellent service from the young male server that works there, the female servers not so much.

FdX_C-oTVAWBpnlSktUE0A.text: I'm excited about this spot. never been to a Jewish deli before.  I only had the Mickey Ansell which consists of liver, tongue, and roast beef. never had liver before and turns out I like it. the cost of these sandwiches are more than your usual sandwich price, I believe mine came out to around $18 but these things are HUGE! I'm definitely coming back to try more things and looking forward to it.

5v55RZYxmbLk1zsto_ZBEg.text: Outrageously surprised! had never been. Portions and quality rivaled the best New York delis. The waiters were attentive. Food delivery was slow. But I will wait for great food!

b7KwKsI3iSl4D10dqDAXFQ.text: At least twice a month I pick up a Corned beef Sandwich to take home. I have noticed the past 4 or 5 times I seem to end up with the ends of the rye bread (heels) I have asked to please have my sandwich on the centers of the bread. (old teeth) ... The answer I got was that all sandwiches come this way because it is the way the bread is cut (on the side) ??? ... this time I once again said there was to much crust on the bread & guess what? I ended up with the toughest Stringiest corned beef imaginable! I will now go to Jason's & pay 1/2 the price & get a Perfect Corned Beef Sandwich with the center of the bread & no stringiness!

BgHqsGeZkbip89NOrOof4w.text: Great restaurant! Reasonable prices for the amount of food you get. The chicken soup is ammmmmazing!!! I ordered a grilled cheese on challa bread. The challa was fresh baked and tasted great. Also their brownies are to die for!!! Don't leave without checking out the bakery section!

52LPcRk6EU3_fwHfYQKMJg.text: The chichen noodle soup is great!!

oCZeRIvdd5Y_0AaVBot_hg.text: Mmmm what potato salad dreams are made of. Authentic Deli. Open face Reuben will not disappoint there is a long wait typically but always worth it. We always have to get a large potato salad to go. I love this place and don't go here nearly enough. Try it will not disappoint.

QmpnwlXSmwkIWOB7-wUo1w.text: I was gonna give it 4 stars because its a pain to get seated. Long lines and not to big of a place. Then the food shoots it straight off the charts. We decided to give it a try awhile back and was blown away. I never heard of this little gem hiding in Henderson. While we were waiting, it gave us a chance to look over the menu. They have a pretty good size menu from Breakfast to hearty lunch and dinner style entrees. They also have a white board with daily specials that change day to day. When we finally were able to sit down, the service started to shine. The waiter came right away and was very courteous and efficient. We already knew what we wanted since we were waiting for about 30-40 min. Was the wait worth it. I sure in the hell say YES!! Waiting for our order, I noticed the food coming out. Big hulking sandwiches piled high with Corned Beef, and other huge deli sandwiches being ordered. Matzo ball soup with asteroid size Matzo ball in the middle. My wife ordered the Homemade Corned Beef Hash plate with eggs, skillet potatoes and a fresh made Bagel with Cream Cheese. Who wants toast when you can have a fresh made bagel done the real way. The Cream Cheese was fresh and you get a big ol helping of it. The Corned Beef Hash looked heavenly. Crispy and flaky with a hint of caramelizing on the meat with an amazing blend of seasonings. The best part is that it wasn't salty like the can stuff. It was perfect as is. The bagel was fluffy and toasted just right. Just enough crunch but still kept its soft and chewy texture. I ordered the San Gennaro Omelet. Loaded with chunks of Italian Sausage, Basil, Garlic, Mozzarella Cheese, and Marinara. It wasn't sloppy and it was made flat and not folded which I liked. Made it more appealing and easier to eat. It covered the whole plate. It also came with a side of skillet potatoes and your choice of Toast or Bagel. Yeah, I went for the bagel. You can get toast anywhere lol. I had to try the bagel and glad I made that choice. I jumped in to that Omelette and was blown away. You could taste each of the ingredients and the blended together perfectly in your mouth. Normally, I scarf down my food hella quick, but this had me take my time and enjoy it. I can go on and on and there is so much to choose from. The big hulking deli sandwiches, breakfasts and lunch entrees I know Ill be back again. Plus, I know where to get some amazing bagels to go, since they have a little shop on the side to get stuff to go. The desserts they make there look amazing and I will be sure to review that when I try. Till next time..Let's Eat!!!

Tpc-b29KUOxqAmQtgaVPdQ.text: Massive sandwiches, you should share.  My deli fix is this joint. Anyone say black and white cookies?  Apparently Zappos CEO likes it too, I saw him ordering for the office around Passover.

eJALwGNaoh5BuNwQGIyRpA.text: Excellent, made from scratch, chicken noodle soup. It is so hard to find soup like this. Next time, I will try the soup of the day. They ran out of Pea soup last time, which looked excellent. My friends raved about the eggplant soup. The restaurant is a simple diner look  and a little dated. The main reason I go there is for the great, homemade soup.

z-cQkU114dZPn3yEnxB8HA.text: We've tried just about everywhere is Henderson and believe me, Weiss has the best breakfast in town!

0QXPQJRlCHDpBkiOBqCdnA.text: Been going here for years and just finally got around to reviewing. We usually go in on Sunday mornings for breakfast. Usually there is a little wait to be seated but it goes quick. I recommend checking the special board when you walk in. The specials are always great! The omelets are to die for and the hash has to be the best in town, oh and don't get me started on the bagels!! SO GOOD!! I have only had lunch here once, the roasted turkey sandwich, piled high with turkey, very good. This is a little hidden gem, a tad far for us and tucked away but worth the drive on those Sunday mornings we are craving a good breakfast. P.s. I could drink their coffee all day! It's nothing too fancy, its the just right mug of coffee to go with great food!

FUSH6sHF5IyZY667OWbpng.text: Good, but overpriced. Paid $12 for a pastrami sandwich. It was good, but either needed to be bigger or a few bucks cheaper.

aaDQH3S091QmeOmLwJiHFw.text: Been going here for years. It is the best place for breakfast and sandwiches. old school baby. the hash stack is silly crazy good. staff has been there for years so they what they are doing.

ZJY-z5yRm2YoBk4fzavJBw.text: OK let's be honest... I love this place!!!  The soup and half sandwich is HUGE!!!! The chicken matzo-ball soup and pastrami sandwich is huge, and hot, and SO SO good!!!  I order the beef brisket, potato pancake, brown gravy, smothers in melted cheese and extra brown gravy is to DIE FOR.... Damn, order the pancake well done and you have got an orgasm in your mouth!!!!  Get more sour crean on the side, yes, yes, yes...

cuaGat4oxGGeuevwl34nVA.text: NOTE** The Yelp map location is wrong.  Weiss Deli is in the shopping center on the South East Corner of Sunset and Green Valley, NOT the North East Corner.  After trying all the famous delis (Carnegie, Stage, Canter's, etc...) in the big Casinos and noticing they are all a shadow of the originals that I love, I set out to find a real deli in Las Vegas.  Delis are best when they are being run by deli people.  And that's the problem with the casinos.  They are being run by people that don't know the difference between deli mustard and Dijon.  I'm dead serious, I once had someone at the Carnegie argue with me that grey poupon was a brown deli mustard, and my only choices were yellow and Dijon.  If they pulled that at the original Carnegie in New York , there would be a riot.  So although it's a little off the beat and path from the strip, Weiss Deli is well worth the trip.  Only in business since 2006, Owner Michael Weiss is using his Grandma's recipes.  Which explains why Weiss' tastes like it's been around for 60 years.    As I always do when trying a new deli, I went with pastrami on rye.  This is the best pastrami you'll get in Las Vegas folks.  Sure the Carnegie is starting off with a great product, but I've had it tough, cold, and sometimes they get lucky and make it right.  But from the first bite of this sandwich, I knew they were serious about how to prepare pastrami.  It was piping hot, it was perfectly steamed, it had plenty of fat on it (which adds to the flavor).  Even though it was my only time eating here, I can almost guarantee it's great every time.  The guy cures his own pastrami, enough said.  The flavor was perfect and while I might prefer Langer's in LA just a little better, this is a good 2nd.  Every bite of that sandwich was a joy to eat.  Also we need to talk about one of the most impressive rye breads that I've ever seen.  Each slice of rye is about 8 inches high and 10 inches wide.  Freshly baked on site, I'd love to see a whole loaf of that rye.  It had a nice crunchy crust, but with a rye bread that large, even with a huge pile of meat in it, the crust was almost a picture frame surrounding the delicious soft seeded rye.  Served with National Deli Mustard, I can't wait to enjoy this sandwich again.  Also not to be missed was the side of potato salad (which I couldn't keep my wife from eating - I think I only had like 2 bites of it before she claimed it as her own).  It's almost like a mashed potato salad since the potatoes are so soft and mashed together with egg and mayo.  It reminded me of the flavor of the famous Rascal House Potato Salad, and that's the highest compliment I can pay it.  The wife had "The Remington".  It was hot roast beef, melted swiss & cheddar jack, grilled onions, on grilled rye bread.  It was supposed to come with horseradish sauce, but she isn't a fan of that, so we went with a side of brown gravy to dip it in.  Excellent sandwich.  They messed up a little bit, since we ordered it open face (which is usually how it comes) but it was still good as a sandwich.  The roast beef was very tasty and their brown gravy outstanding.  Her side of french fries were pretty boring however, but so what, the sandwich is so large, you don't need them.  Each sandwich was served with a half a pickle and half a pickled tomato.  I wouldn't be surprised if they pickled them on site.  I also tried a combo appetizer of chopped liver and white fish salad.  What a great idea to be able to get a scoop of each right next to each other.  I was surprised it was only served on a large lettuce leaf with a black olive and a pickle spear.  It wasn't brought by our waitress, so when I asked her where all the veggies were, she was shocked that they sent it out like that.  So she rounded up some tomato and red onion.  I'm used to carrots, and cucumber, maybe bell peppers as well.  The presentation wasn't very good, but since it got messed up, I'm not sure how it's supposed to look, or what's supposed to be on it.    I preferred the white fish salad to the chopped liver.  Excellent whitefish salad!  Not too salty, nice and smokey with plenty of mayo.  The chopped liver was just ok, but still better than most places.  And last but not least, the prices.  Only $10.95 for a huge Pastrami Sandwich.  I was shocked.  For that quality and size, that's $15 anywhere else.  And if you get one at a deli on the strip, maybe it will be $20. (Of course it will have even more meat than Weiss, but you'll most likely be throwing half of it away which is a shanda).

RSUlqUNNhLdqR7klaqOALg.text: Best bagel I've had outside of New York. Better than any place I've been able to find in San Francisco or Los Angeles. I'm surprised it's not better known. The bagel is just a great combination of flavors plus the bagel has that combination of spongy and chewiness that you get in New York.  I also got their hash with eggs for breakfast. Excellent hash they make themselves. The only partof the meal I didn't like was the potatoes. My service was fine, but I came during breakfast when they weren't busy. I don't know that people want a Goy to tell them what a good Jewish bagel is, but this was noteworthy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Hash and eggs
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Everything bagel

Meza4fITES5DfVjLmlk7rQ.text: 10/29/11 BREAKFAST.  It greatly pains me to write this review, but here goes.  Many months ago friend Kathe took me here. She was hungry, I was not. So I had iced teas while she had a "Black Mountain", an eggs benedict with beef brisket instead of ham or such.  I tried her food. It was AMAZING. The brisket was a nice not-too-thin cut of beef, fatty and tasty. The poached eggs were perfect, runny inside. And that hollandaise was one of the best I had ever had. Unusual with the amount of lemon flavor, but that made it refreshing. A great plate of food.  TODAY I returned for the second and LAST time. I ordered the "Black Mountain". The brisket was paper thin and boring, except the fatty part. The eggs were overcooked, hard inside. The hollandaise was dull and thick, just not good at all. And my spouse, his words, had the worst omelet he has ever had in his entire life. In fact, at our table, no one really liked the food that much.  I don't know what has happened to this place, but now, sadly, it's off my list for good.  PS And the service? Well, I've read people having problems with service here, but it was half-filled with customers and the service was well-meaning and fine. A good tip was left.  PPS According to internet sources of various kinds, Weiss USED to be one of the 5 places in Vegas with the best hollandaise. Now only 4 remain:  1. Peppermill Restaurant & Fireside Lounge 2. the coffee shop @ Jerry's Nugget Casino 3. Bouchon @ Venetian 4. Verandah @ Four Seasons  Now, from that list, I've only been to the Peppermill, but not had the hollandaise. Guess I'll have to try it, next time, but I'm not a huge fan of the food there. I know nothing about Jerry's Nugget. Bouchon and Verandah have been on my "to do" list here since I arrived. I can believe Bouchon's hollandaise is great. And I hear the brunch @ Verandah, in general, is fantastic. Hopefully I'll get to all 4 soon.

oVRdrAGsZGlWA52UkV-v6Q.text: I kept hearing about this place so finally decided to drive over. It was good. I had a pastrami burger. The burger could have had a bit more flavor and the pastrami was good. The chicken noodle soup is homemade and excellent. Inside is small and the decor outdated. The appearance of this place wouldn't make want to eat here but the good food sure does. If you like a good Jewish Deli then give this place a try.

YPri0DLK7yLIqQS8L2qNCQ.text: No pictures,  we dove into our food.  The food was so good.  I had chicken soup and salad, huge bowl of soup, with large pieces of chicken breast.  The salad was huge as well.  The half pastrami was thick, the BLT was huge, and save room for dessert.  We had bread pudding,  and rice pudding we shared. The ice tea was fresh...everything was win.

qO12AWRsdIvaa0Hq7Jl7xQ.text: Love this place! Everything on the menu is awesome. I especially love the pancakes, the French dip, the soups which rotate daily, and the potato salad is amazing. They gave BIG portions and is kid friendly. The staff is great and there is even a to-go area with lots of choices to take home. Thus us my favorite breakfast and lunch spot in the valley!

4BMhZ6Z_SSN3fpKTzI5j0Q.text: Not for nothing, but this obscure, tucked in a shopping center, little bit of Jewish Heaven on a Plate, is the best outside New York (yes, I'm a New Yorker).  The simple look, the plain wrapper, combine with a great menu, friendly and efficient staff, and fine smells.  The food is to die for, the prices are not bad, and on the way out grab a little nosh at the bakery.

ONi_IPgiV8QOAx_4UUl4iQ.text: Great Jewish deli.  Best bagels in town!  Homemade cream cheese that reminds you what it's supposed to taste like.  Corned beef on rye that my New York relatives did not turn their noses up at.  Only complaint is they don't open as early as I'd like for breakfast.

sLLbXpqKy_3QFUtWOh9rZQ.text: Love breakfast here. Bagels are great. Sandwiches and sides are good too. It's my comfort place.

j5HKZXyhRGEJ5RO5V0AG6A.text: I live on the other side of town.  I called earlier in the day to confirm the last seating as I would be coming from another engagement and I wanted to take my father visiting from out of town.  They said we'd be good to go as long as we arrived quarter till.  We arrived 21 minutes till and was told they had just had their last seating.  Lady at the front  was the same I spoke to on the phone.  When asked her what happened with quarter till, she shrugged.  With so many restaurants in town, I will make sure to visit somewhere that honors the hours that they advertise and want our business.

sVRE5W0RhS5UkrQe7IAR7w.text: We had Easter breakfast here today with all the fam (11 ppl) kids & adults & everybody left happy with full bellies! The service was outstanding, our waiter (taller young guy) was refreshingly well mannered & very attentive to all our carious requests. We sat on the patio, which was spacious & nicely shaded. The food was delicious & we had quite a variety! Their toast is made with fresh bread baked in their bakery, as was my bagel and both were excellent! We make every effort to support locally and/or family owned restaurant when possible, we'll definitely be returning to Weiss!

uKFYTdhQCI7OHcrbprbBUQ.text: Best chix noodle ever! Pastrami great too...pickles are weird meh. Egg cream soda yumm!

hM8XcBtOXuE0XQyV_mwdog.text: Not the best deli I've ever been to! The women at the front are kinda rude and aren't on top of their game when there's a rush. I ordered a sandwich and the 4 people who ordered AFTER me got their food before me.   The sandwich ingredients were good quality, but it was literally slapped together so haphazardly that it was impossible to eat. I got one with turkey and salami on it, and half of the sandwich didn't have turkey and half didn't have salami. You could just tell it was put together so carelessly, it didn't make me feel good about spending $17.  The toothpicks were stuck in sideways and defeated the purpose of having them there in the first place, and the side of fruit was dried out and gross. Like really, if you're going to only give me one strawberry among my "side of fruit", make sure its at least a good one.   They have a wide variety of things to choose from, but the customer service, and the way they prepared their food left me just thinking "Meh. I've experienced better".

z9qF47kZMfw713BozI-GPg.text: Amazing food! Unfortunately, the place is so unappealing aesthetically. I would even go so far as to say it's grimy. I can't go there too often because I am always thinking about how dirty the kitchen probably is. Wish they would do a better job of maintaining the place. I would give zero stars for cleanliness, but the food is def 5 stars

Myr17is-_mti6jUn7-G7vQ.text: The quality of the food is unquestionable. However, generally we have found the food to be lacking in seasoning. The servings are plentiful. I had the Philly cheesesteak and it was good, but very bland. It has a very busy and noisy atmosphere. Fun place to visit, overall.

hW2RE_WBqkIdNirhKu537A.text: This is a very popular diner with families and the geriatric crowd. From this, you might correctly infer  that  "daring" is not what this place is about. But this is Jewish home-cookin' with all the good and bad that this implies.  The various bagel and lox plates are wonderful. The latkes are just what they should be, and are served with both sour cream and apple sauce.  The omelets are huge but often kinda dull and dry.  The blintzes were the only item that I've received that I thought were a bit on the small side. But they were so rich and yummy that I was not disappointed in the end.  So, if you like Jewish soul food (and maybe a bit of bacon on the side) this is worth a try. ...and on your way out, grab a slab of noodle kugel for later.  It couldn't hurt.

kKyAjAWRU9m6GseGkXV4WA.text: This is a two for one review since we came here two consecutive weeks, once for breakfast and once for lunch.             For breakfast  I had the corn beef  hash with eggs and french toast.       The corn beef was ground up and had some diced potato's in it. It was crispy and tasty, I prefer my corn beef a little chunkier but that's a personal preference.        The french toast was a couple huge slices of challah bread it was solid nothing special to me, if it was Hawaiian bread instead of challah I would, Hallah! ( I know lame)         Our next visit for lunch , wife had the Clary a triple rye sandwich filled with pastrami, corn beef , Swiss cheese ,cole slaw and Russian dressing. This huge sandwich is a winner.             I had the Ceily's stack potato latkes stuffed with braised brisket , provolone, muenster cheese and covered in brown sauce. I would have liked more brown gravy but it was pretty good, anyway, I think if you like potato latkes you would love this dish , me not a big fan of the latkes but that's personal taste.        Portions are huge, food tasty , I like this place alot.  Service was good     I

DMXTej6bYuAJt3NqEAaf6Q.text: I could taste the love in my sandwich. Service was great my server was so humble and gracious. It was love at first bite. I had the best rubin I have ever eaten. Cole slaw was amazing and they give you a fresh made pickle spear.

mssc_cUB8mGben6hJ0W2yQ.text: Much better open faced Reuben than the "other" deli on Buffalo.  Can't wait to go back.

DR09QOWPHEycGHailEknGg.text: Am in need of another trip here soon. Good delis are few and far between here. Have had the tuna, egg salad, pastrami (all on rye!), cheesecake, latkes, and black and white. Yum! Please open another location in the west side!!!!

kT9EkAGE37cxt81yIeW9Xw.text: Everything is truly fresh.  Pastrami, chicken noodle soup, potato salad, hotdog, turkey sandwich, tastes like they make their own pickles.  It is a neighborhood deli with a higher standard and respect for quality

AfnfiflRbZuzNIYDrrnH7w.text: Brisket is often a hard meat to get right, but Weiss put a nice twist on my brisket sandwich. In NY, the brisket is often crumbly, dry and lean and excellent. In the Weiss version, it is still lean (on request), but it is braised which makes it a bit moister and delicious. It still needs 1000 island dressing, but was quite tasty.  I liked the fact that you can get 1/2 sandwich and soup ($1.25 extra for matzoh ball) if your not that hungry, but the sandwiches aren't as big as Carnegie. THe soup had its moments, but was not seasoned enough, but after tossing the dark meat out of the soup (a big No No), the soup was above average and matzoh ball was giant, but needed salt.  Only negatives were my battle with the one fly in the place that was buzzing the back of the restaurant and no free cole slaw/pickles ala NY deli's. Rye bread was fresh too. Huge menu, so must go back and try other items including a rare sighting of an Egg Cream.

XKAjSaVtoDYmsr13e_jLGQ.text: Great place to get Matzah Ball soup and rainbow cookies!!! It's always very busy!! I love this place!!!

2TfZkI9zw7v9B_F6Abq9_A.text: Delicious, from-scratch cooking, large portions, and reasonable prices!  We stopped here on our way to the Hoover Dam.  My veggie omelet was delicious, the fresh fruit was ripe and sweet, and the bagel was almost sinful.  Maybe we were having buffet rebound, but everyone in my group was raving about the food.  Nobody wanted to leave their leftovers behind so we got some togo boxes and threw in another bag of bagels for later.

_e6-2aF9AxEzOfoPAFoi5w.text: This place has terrible staff and service!!. Me and my father couldn't event get in our order before we were treated so rudely that we looked at each other and said did this really just happen and decided to stand up tell the owner what our thoughts were, she seemed to be part of the problem, it all starts from the top! Oh by the way this place looks old and horrible inside, its decorated like a bathroom.

Rr4urhSPQPX4xnvbdslyoA.text: There was nothing really special about this place, they actually took kind of a long time. The waitress had a lot of  "regulars" to take care. Umm if it was me I would pay more attention to the new customers, (if you want them to come back). The food was good., the bagels were amazing, but with little customer service I cannot give a four star.

WFlxIFeeJvRuKaMdEEBR7g.text: Don't eat outside, we have young children and thought it would be better to sit out on the patio - 3 families went in after us and where already eating before we received our food, not to mention we had to make 3 trips back inside for condiments and remaining order items.

moWRx0_WIEGVKkUo7ZbKVg.text: When visiting my sister in Las Vegas we never fail to stop in at Weiss's at least two times; once for a "real" meal, and another time just to get pastries, or maybe lox and bagels. Their motzah balls come in two sizes and their soup is the best I've ever had. Extra plates are cheerfully provided (as we often divide plates so we can share more things), which brings me to one of the nicest facets of this restaurant: their waiters are the best! We were a party of six this week, with a four year old and a need on my daughter's part to get to a business meeting. When the rushed situation was explained, Jacques and another waiter served us quickly with smiles that made us feel as if we couldn't be more welcome. (My sister says Jacques gets hugs from long time customers, he's that hospitable!) I highly recommend this place--except when I'm in town! Please don't go then; my favorite pastries already sell out early!

rTaQPP2WmrEB5wlsWATPOQ.text: for the money you can find better, i expected cheaper prices for a sandwich but if the price was right hell i'd pay it but no indeed it was not, my roast beef came out looking great but the taste of the roast beef was mediocre at best it tasted like a cheap pot roast i've ate much better roast beef for much cheaper, the au jues was good though and the homemade potato salad was very delicious! half the soft drinks come in bottles so it's non-bottomless which is a shame, overall i will not return due to the high prices and medium food quality :/ i prefer jasons deli much better for your dollar! Thanks for reading

jzc9d0_jgh6ynG73Z4vUCQ.text: Went into Weiss Deli and was seated in the back by a very pleasant host. Sadly, we were next to a customer who was talking five times louder than a typical person, and he didn't stop for a moment to come up for air. I decided to look for another table. The restaurant has a somewhat strange configuration, and as I walked toward the front, I was entering a work zone for the wait staff. The waitress didn't bother to explain this to me, but instead gave me a death stare, and was pointing with her head that I should move to the next aisle. Her expression and body language was sending the message that I must be a total idiot for attempting to continue walking in what had been a normal pathway just a few steps before. So how is the food here? Don't know. I found the proper pathway and walked out the front door, never to return again.

xf1FSymvUCs91_GK7hXVWw.text: I wish I could say I had a great meal at this place because I love pastrami and corned beef sandwiches. I was also told the Weiss deli was a good restaurant by my grandmother. Unfortunately I can't tell you how the food was because after I was seated and the busboy got our drinks, we weren't even noticed by the wait staff. I tried to order two Reubens from the busboy and he told me Jaquise would take my order. So I sat patiently waiting. Jaquise was busy with his other tables. He passed our table at least ten times without even letting us know he would be there shortly. We sat there for twenty minutes. We felt as if we were invisible. The final straw was when a group of elderly ladies sat down and I watched him go up two minutes from the time they were seated and take there order. We up and walked out. Nobody stopped us or even said have a nice day. As I walked out I yelled BYE and nobody batted an eyelash. Very poor service. I'll never go back there again. Maybe we weren't Jewish enough.

K2z1WHFPqwOEbBnHXMSgOg.text: Ordered take out twice last week.Had the chicken noodle soup,was excellent.Lots of flavor,generous amount of chicken.Matzoh balls need a little seasoning,at least salt.Potato pancake was good.We look foward to dining in,sandwhiches look really good.

b6m8J3JkW9vwd2-s6DtnMA.text: Was in Vegas for high school volleyball tournament and had a break between matches for breakfast. Highly recommend Weiss'! Nova was great, bagels were solid and service was strong. I had the Eggs Nova with onions, green onions, dill and cream cheese. It was a something I'd eat again. Weiss' is a high in the list of Fatty Rules breakfast joints in Vegas! L'chaim!

xkgvuKsmH_3slQLH3yAA3g.text: Hands down one of the best spots I've been to in Vegas. Everything was fresh and tasted so good! Best sandwiches and omelets!!!!

XMq3DJQi63MO2B49xOWYZg.text: This is a great deli. I have been here lots of times and every time it is great food.This time I ordered the soup and sandwich combo.My honey had the pastrami on rye. The matzo ball soup is huge a cup is the size of a bowl! comes with bagel chips. And then i had the half  chicken salad sandwich on halah bread so good.The wait staff is a little lazy and unobservant, the hostess texting when she should be seating people.Food is 5 stars. for the two of us it cost 28$.

DfE5GaCYo1gl3cRC9A8oKQ.text: This little gem of a Jewish deli in the Trader Joe's strip mall at Green Valley Parkway and Sunset  rocks!.  Food is consistently very good, sandwiches are huge, service is excellent.  The potato salad is supreme!  Looks, feels and smells like Brooklyn... kind of ambiance of an East coast diner.  I eat here at least once a week.

cMoAsdyF_LA1QfLIXMXafg.text: Wow, local spot off the strip is thriving on Jewish favorites like motzah ball soup and pastrami on rye.  Get the motzah ball soup and 1/2 pastrami sandwich.  You'll be full and you'll be pleased.  Great soup & sandwich. Big bowl of soup and plenty of lean no fat pastrami on their home made rye bread.

fw-91N_nNBiwi14re1F5-w.text: Oh my lord- East coast Jewish delis are amazing, and this place can holds its own with the best of them. As soon as I saw the menu here, I started (favorably) comparing it to Miller's on Polk Street in SF, where I first had matzo ball soup.  The soup here, which we started with, is just as legit. And the portions are just as huge, too- the one pictured is a cup. It could easily be a lunch, and is served with a couple of tasty-ass bagel chips too. Rye flavor, natch.  BF opted for one of the most expensive (and largest) sandwiches ever, the JR Boucher, which is a triple-layer with pastrami and liver. Yeah, that didn't sound tasty to me at all, and it's $18. But we got it, and it's frickin' delicious: all the components work so well together, they harmonize like a choir of angels. Oh and one sandwich is easily like three meals. We shared it and still had half for dinner.  And, because I'm a total glutton and never on this side of town, I had to get my own dish, too. I got the Ceily's stack- latkes stuffed with brisket, topped with two types of cheese and brown gravy. It's even more amazing than it sounds, priced at $12, and is also easily split into thirds. Just finished my order for lunch today.  With two heavy take-out boxes in hand, we rolled ourselves out the door... And promptly axed any plans of looking for a rental property in Henderson, because I don't want to weigh 400 pounds and if this place were nearby, that might be a serious possibility.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch and dinner
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Jr boucher
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Ceilys stack

BVCNwY8LxTeaJKeivTdRuA.text: We got seated right away.  I ordered 2 iced teas and they gave us our own pitcher.  Service was very good and there were enough servers and wait staff walking around if we needed anything.  Food was very good!!!!!

BptbY0RfUvKjSVbRu-GbXw.text: I come here for the Beef dip and the chicken soup. Both are out of this world good! I am originally from LA County and if you've lived there than you know of Philippe's in Downtown LA. Well your in for a treat because the beef dip at Weiss reminds me so much of the taste of Philippes. But I like Weiss a little more because it is LOADED with a ton of beef and you get a nice big serving of aujus. Now the soup, it just soothes the soul. Just something about a homemade chicken noodle soup that really makes you feel good, this one has it! Every time I have been the service is amazing and the food even better.

hovJXqv0UGlfksPfGSqQOQ.text: This is as close to NYC as you will get in Las Vegas. Pastrami, corned beef, brisket and matzoh ball soup. Half sour pickles and tomatoes its all good. The sandwiches are HUGE and then bowl of soup a monster portion. If you leave hungry something is wrong. Service is getting better each time we go

Oreu0lbY0BVoMdwJQoVTYA.text: First of all..... Might as well say this is on sunset vs green valley D: I was traveling east on the 215, and it had me exit off Green Valley Parkway and drive North... all the way to almost Sunset... I was like wahhhh i could have taken the airport bypass and got off on Sunset D: Save me that loop i drove =[   Located on the corner of the Trader Joe's shopping centre. Pretty easy to find. Super busy. The restaurant side was packed. As i was on the way to an appointment for work, i decided to do take out.   Overlooking the menu... quite extensive. Lots of options. As i had this place bookmarked for "TRY THE PASTRAMI SANDWICH !!!" ... thats what i got. Pastrami sandwich on rye bread, with a side of potato salad, and half a pickle. Little did i know how BIG these sandwiches are. Can easily match if not BEAT jason's deli sizes (and those arent small either).   Total wait time was maybe ~10 minutes. Not bad. When my order came out, the waitress asked if i wanted mustard. I told her it was my first time at the restaurant, and shes like "yeah you are getting mustard..." then she proceeded in telling me about these two guys who came in for the first time, about 6 months ago. Ate there, then since then, found EVERY chance to go to the restaurant and tried the ENTIRE menu. 2 guys, 2 different items each time, and shared. I'm like.... bravo... Luckily i dont live on that side of town HAHA !   Since i was on the move, i ate it while driving to my appointment. My god it was hard to eat (size issue.... yah yah -.- dirty minds). I had wished the pastrami was thick sliced like some deli's ive heard of in NY but oh well. Good flavor. Needs to be eaten asap or bottom bread gets soggy :( like all pastrami or corned beef sandwiches... Potato salad was nice. Not overly heavy. Pickle was a bit underflavored? Maybe they make it themselves. I like sourness. XD   Overall. Pretty good. Would like to come back another time and try other things !

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich with a side of potato salad and half a pickle

oLR4kvLr5_-6HlkBnnCMYw.text: The atmosphere is like being in a Miami Deli. The Matzo ball soup taste pretty good. the Reuben sandwich are large.

w0tKr3nnBW_dNEnAjuc4tg.text: My new favorite place! This is a good 'ol, small-town feeling deli that feeds you like your grandma does.  The menu is relatively large with every option sounding more delicious than the previous. The prices are good, and the servings are VERY generous.  The bread is homemade on site and every option is delicious (I LOVE the whole wheat and the hubs loves the rye). I am also a huge fan of their chicken salad. Yum! I enjoyed a LARGE bowl of matzah ball soup with my sandwich and it was the best matzah ball soup I've ever had. $1.50 for a bowl that is easily for 2 people. Can't wait to come back and try more things.

GcUx3YxWm07Cr_1ywte37w.text: Was strictly here for the food.. Definitely the food! The actual restaurant and decor was a little outdated and small for me..  Quick and tentative service. Staff were friendly. Only minus for me would be the tables put together so sometimes you'd be really close to another group. Guess that's expected for the whole place itself being so tiny!  Food was great! We first had the Chicken Noodle Soup with Matzo Ball. I've never had a matzo ball before, so for a first time this was delicious! Big chunks of chicken and even amounts of noodles, carrots and celery-- homemade, hearty soup!  Then we had our main dishes : I had the Pancake Breakfast - pancakes, bacon, eggs and potatoes. Pancakes were really, deliciously light! From what I was told, they make their own bacon! The little things are always a plus! Fiance had the Pastrami Sandwich. Although I had wish to have experience the full sandwich, the pieces I stole from his sandwich were sooo good!  My son had his usual, Chicken Fingers with Fries.. Huge, huge portions!  I'd def come back here again to try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Fingers!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pancakes!

YrMB87lw-krxI5k6_eejIQ.text: The food tastes homemade, baked goods are fresh and flavorful. I would probably come back and not sit by the server/kitchen area. The busboys/waiters which were behind a pony wall where we sat cursed and spoke about women in a sexual manner. It was unpleasant.

5vBDFR73jFxxu0L8MRyCJw.text: There are few restaurants that truly deliver what they promise but Weiss Deli never disappoints! Morning, noon or night whether it's breakfast, lunch or dinner your belly will be full and your tastebuds satisfied beyond belief. We just had THE MOTHER OF ALL HASH & The  BLACK Forest Mountain modified with brown gravy....yum! Fast service, decent prices and the best breakfast in Henderson!

1EBG0JAssj_M87kchhTL6A.text: Very friendly and great service.  Really enjoyed the Mother of All Hash and a Potato Knish -- if you are from NY/NJ you know how hard it is to find a Knish in Vegas.  Definitely great find and will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

oc5sLahSTct8XiU_JzWRvg.text: A popular place with the locals, we dropped by after visiting the Ethel M chocolate factory (a 5 min drive away). We split the Lox Platter with an extra bagel between 2 adults and 2 kids and it made a delicious spread. We also tried their cheesecake which was excellent - slight lemony tang on a biscuity base. Good value too, our bill coming up to just $30. A refreshing change after being on the strip.   Tip: try Mothership Coffee Roaster just past Trader Joe's. The cortada is a very good cup of joe! For Aussies - a piccolo is more like a cappuccino here and a cortada is slightly larger than a piccolo (aka Gibraltar).

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

EnaTINwHceC_m4DF07CIMQ.text: wow i was super impressed with the food here. i ordered catering for my wedding, the sandwich platters where beyond good! super fresh and tasty my fav was the roast beef! i asked to have all condiments and veggies such as the lettuce and pickles on the side and they provided a large beautiful platter with it all!!! the fruit platter was so good (large slices and fresh) the Cesar salad was very good and my guests were all loving the food!! the presentation was beautiful and very appetizing!  i recommend their sandwich and fruit platers for catering  you wont be disappointed! i will def be coming here more often after my first experience ;) thanks for making my wedding reception a tasty one !

QAT7SRgWoxE9rSY2xI18Dw.text: This isn't a fancy place. It is a crowded but delicious authentic deli. Good eats with large enough portions. I've been here many times. It reminds me of a similar Jewish deli I frequented in New York.

KvOoada3v39wBv6I3C5Ztg.text: A new day and a new place to try.  We stopped in for weekday lunch.  To my surprise there was still a wait to be seated at 1:30.  Must be good!    We were seated and had some time to look over the menu.  Our waitress I could see was busy.  By the time she came over to us, all she said was, "Ok, ready".  I guess she lacked in her customer service skills.  That, in a nut shell, was her personality for our dining visit.    I tried the Chicken noodle Matzoh ball soup but just a small bowl.  Let me tell you the small bowl was pretty huge.  I think that would have sufficed for my entire meal.  The flavor was great and would definitely have that again.  I had also ordered the Grilled Cheese and added ham and grilled onions.   The ham and onions were an additional charge to the sandwich.  Fabulous and very tasty flavor!  I loved every bite.  Even though I was full from the soup, I couldn't stop eating the sandwich.   The grilled onions really gave it that extra umph!    Yes I would recommend going here to eat but just don't expect the best of service.  Hopefully it will be better next time!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken noodle matzoh ball soup
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled cheese - provolone, ham and grilled onions. Yum!

KKgRLHXATct9EUvQXn9gYA.text: As a born and bred New Yorker, I know my deli sandwiches.  ;). I also know how hard it is to find a decent one outside metropolitan NYC.  But on a recent visit to Henderson, I discovered Weiss.  I can't speak to the other items on the menu, but the tongue sandwiches my husband and I had were absolutely fantastic!  (Dare I say even better than NY!). Were dreaming about a second visit to Weiss on our next trip to LV.

W4lbLWWxCs9xIYjfhp4kwA.text: The Mother of All Hash ($8.95): Shredded corned beef, new potatoes, and Mayan onion; two eggs with home fries and toasted onion bagel. This is the BEST corned beef hash I've ever had. The corned beef is flavorful and the crisp on this hash was unbelievable. It was perfection. Also, the amount of food you get for the price is amazing.  Side of Smoked Fish ($6.95): Hand-sliced Nova Lox. Since I couldn't decide between corned beef hash and smoked salmon (I love both equally), I ordered a side of lox. It's a nice portion that worked well with the bagel I received with my meal and delicious.  Potato Latkes ($6.95): Grandma Ceily's recipe, served crispy with sour cream and apple sauce. These were nice though I would have preferred more seasoning. The apple sauce was great with it!  My friend had an order of pancakes and they are so fluffy and tasty! Definitely one of the best pancakes in town.   As if it wasn't already difficult to choose between all the amazing choices; everything is so great! Seriously, delicious eats and fabulous service. They're doing it all well.

CqtO1xDsMpuJpqGbJYfJrw.text: Been wanting to try this place out for awhile, as I love deli food, the menu is pretty good with all standard deli fare , but I wanted to try something a little different , I opted for the Remington , which was shaved roast beef in a slice of great marble rye bread ,sauteed onions all covered with a cheese blend and baked till melted and gooey !! Sounded good , buuuutttt, the meat was dry and the combined flavors left a bit to be desired , I had to ask for a side of gravy which helped it along , but not much ! (And I was left burping , the rest of the day ). It was such a shame cuz I really really wanted to like this place !! Maybe I will give it another try , but for now it has quite literally left a bad taste in my mouth !!   Side note !  On the way out I did decide to try a couple of baked goods , and choose a black and white cookie , eh ! Very cakey and although quite large , nothing to write home about , but the shining star here was the cheese Danish !! Which I had the next day , very soft and sweet pastry dough ,filled with lots of sweet and decadent cream cheese filling ! It was large and filled the whole take out container , and is easily at least 2 or 3  servings !! Absolutely sinful !! For that alone 5 stars , but my other menu items were average at best , so I'm sticking with the 3 stars ,until I go back and give this place a second try !

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Looks like there maybe mashed potatoes under that cheese , but it&#39;s a mound of beef !

-II9VF38vKukb7nwJGwsFA.text: Weiss offers breakfast, lunch and pastry goods and seems to be frequented by many locals. It was pretty crowded when I came in during lunch time and I almost felt claustrophobic getting packed into the small restaurant. The service was pretty slow but there were many customers to serve. I ordered the "The Dip" which is the French Dip Sandwich with roasted beef served with au jus reduction for dipping. The good thing about this place was that the portions are huge! I could only finish half of my sandwich. The bad thing was that after a while, it got very tiring to eat the dipped sandwich since the flavors were pretty bland. I didn't have much of an appetite to finish the rest of my sandwich either.   My boyfriend also tried their 10 oz. Burger, which he ordered medium rare but it really came out as medium. It was dry and not juicy at all. The fries were also average, nothing spectacular.  The prices are on the high end for sandwiches ($12-15). Given the lack of flavor, price, and slow service, I don't think I'll go out of my way to go back anytime soon.  But if you're into huge portions and a wide variety of sandwiches, this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. French dip sandwich

G56-MiIe0w354makdY4xDg.text: They continue  to ruin a good thing...the latest remodel in all beige makes it feel like your in an office cubical ...the hostess is clueless, the scowling father of the owner pushes people around and what vibe they had is erased. Its cold, unfriendly, hot and never go on Sunday. They should move to a new location and get a designer who knows how to create a beautiful inviting atmosphere, ditch the parents of the owner and continue making fabulous food. Will only do take out from here on in... from a former loyal customer. All I wanted was some chicken noodle soup for a cold and couldn't even achieve tahat as take out was so crowded with slow service. We are now at Sammys having bottomless Mimosas....way better atmosphere fast professional and friendly service!

jHUkAGsu9KzbjbCgAr_nIA.text: They give big portions for cheap however, the hash browns and eggs were dry. The   onion bagel and garlic bagel with the chive cream cheese were very good. I go back just for the bagels but don't get breakfast.

FZwnMZf21FF7k2ZT0TDl0g.text: This place was really awesome. But honestly the portions are so big you can def split a sandwich with someone. Or Bring half home. We had a nice server and they didn't make us feel uncomfortable even though they were closing soon. I really like that :)

az3PIH1qHQBBD9waCC2cFw.text: Not unlike my weird yucca craving that led me to Havana just to order that one day, I had a strong desire for tongue meat last week and just could not wait any longer.  I was nearby since I avoided the tunnel and took surface streets, and decided to see if Weiss sold their meats by the pound rather than ordering a sandwich.  Sure enough, they do!  They sell everything: corned beef, pastrami, tongue, smoked salmon, etc - you name it.    I got 1/3 lb tongue sliced, and then I decided to order a beautiful small challah.  They slice it for free, but I kept it whole so we could rip it.  I ended up eating a few slices of tongue on the drive home, then made a small sandwich for a pre-dinner snack, and then had another one for breakfast the next day.  It tastes like childhood!  I look forward to going back for more meat or a meal soon!

cgOAKHW6_GEO_SU1_Rkf1w.text: Great food and great service.  Simple as that! The French dip add cheese is my favorite and my girl loves the ruben. Hard to go wrong with whatever you choose.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Ruben sandwich - best we have ever had!

tPxerdA_1TIJjkiJA29vZQ.text: I stopped in here for a mid-morning breakfast sandwich to go.  I ordered the Egg Salad on a toasted bagel.  The egg salad was very good!!  I ate it in the car with a fork while driving to a meeting.    I would have given 4 stars but was disappointed in how long it took to get an egg sandwich to go.  Both the Egg Salad and Bagels were already made - no cooking required.  The restuarant was not busy, only one other person waiting behind me.  But, it looked like they were making a lot of catering/pick-up orders which meant that it took them almost 20 minutes to put the Egg Salad on a toasted bagel.  I can understand waiting 20 minutes for a cooked-to-order egg and ham sandwich.  Fine.  But when I see the Egg Salad sitting in a bowl in the front chilled case, it shouldn't have taken so long.  The front staff seemed a bit disorganized.   I would love to go back and sit in the restaurant and try the breakfast.   This was my first visit to Weiss - which many of my friends have recommended.  I will return soon.

cwgw0mf1lwFRJ_6bzvLUBw.text: Weiss pay attention....you have a staff problem. Been eating at your restaurant now for over 5 years.  Always a long wait...we never cared because you have the best chicken noodle soup and sandwiches ever and your employees are really nice and they work real hard BUT you have a waitress that is screwing your business up. She never ever gets our order right and we watch her all the time go from one table to another with other people's food. This is unacceptable and if this continues we will not back.

7Av3BlBikhcGNaYQ8FTw9A.text: Was hesitant to write a review as used to love this place and  the food is excellent but the service and cleanliness of the restaurant need attention. It used to be booths and a few tables but they removed the booths and now all tables and there is just no room, it is very cramped. The service was extremely slow and then the order was wrong and items forgotten. My main issue though is the cleanliness - the bathroom was dirty, with restaurant cleaning products lying around. The hallway to the bathrooms was cluttered with boxes of cleaning supplies. Again, food is superb but the place was just dirty and staff seem totally uninterested.

tVOxoEt2HuEeZpWFQg1t9Q.text: Best deli around!! The  portions are huge and filling you get your money's worth here!!

93yFYV18_QZxOMvLbNecgg.text: Good place for good ol healthy comfort food! I could tell this place was legit by the more than 90% filled restaurant. The place just oozes New York style deli restaurant ambiance. Loved it.   Did the 'not too hungry' special with the chicken noodle soup + matzo ball and a pastrami sandwich. The soup was good but wasn't a wow factor for me. Personally I thought the flavor of the broth was too light. There were lots of vegetables, noodles, and chicken though which is a big bonus. The star of the soup was definitely the matzo ball. It came out super hot and was pretty much just how I expected, a fluffy dumpling. The pastrami sandwich was also THE BOMB. They give you so much meat inside the sandwich. There was no way I could've straight up taken a bite. The pastrami was very tasty and it paired well with the rye bread I got. Total for me was $10 which I thought was a very good deal considering I couldn't finish the lunch. xD  Overall, chicken noodle soup = eh Any of the sandwiches = thumbs up (since they are a deli)

J8Qv68Vdv0Jk6CbZUz5Yig.text: Tiny, local restaurant with some of the best food in Vegas! Do yourself a favor and share whatever you get because you'll have leftovers for days if not. I'm not saying that's a bad thing, just know you definitely get what you pay for. . .and then some! I don't have to write a long review about this gem; it's just incredibly good food priced just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Peaches and cream pancakes and reuben omlet

yqpS_wr9X1HtcI9ILUrfrg.text: Great place, we were here for breakfast back in November and was very happy with everything I ordered. Great menu and friendly wait staff.

xMg1AHFl8xIfsynbRKJzfA.text: Love the super sized breakfasts and friendly staff. You can't go wrong with having breakfast here. I love it

0Ymsvhsmg-QV9N1A-kZgAg.text: I use to come here a lot with family and friends back when it was Samueli's. There sandwiches were the size of a small dog, the matzoh ball soup was as good as my grandmothers, and the prices weren't too bad either. What has changed? I'm happy to say just the name.  My wife is from Japan and has never had matzoh ball soup nor has never eaten in a east-coast style deli. I felt ashamed of this considering that I'm a Jewish boy from Boston. Where was my mind!? I had to correct this crime!  We got there a little bit after noon and the place was busy, but not packed, and we were promptly seated. Just sitting down you know this place is a real deli, not like one of the chain ones that popped up in the valley that feels like you are eating in an cafeteria. The sounds of dishes and silverware being banged around by the busboy, conversations drowning out the radio, the yentas in the neighboring table kvetching about their bill to the waiter, and waiters zooming around.  I decided the best option for the wife was to do the "Not so hungry" combo (1/2 sandwich and choice of frieds, soup, or salad) and I ordered that too. We both got matzoh ball soup (extra charge for the matzoh balls) and she got tongue while I got corned beef, both oo rye because it's only right. Of course my meal was washed down with a Doc Browns.  For a "small soup" it sure was filling, it had a baseball sized matzoh ball, noodles, and chunks of chicken. The soup was a bit cool when we got it, but it was served in a shallow bowl, but the matzoh ball was piping hot. The soup was garnished with two thin slices of toasted 'everything' bagels. The chicken soup here is just perfect, more sweet than salty the noodles weren't breaking apart, and of course the matzoh ball was a ball of doughy, chickeny, soupy heaven.  The menu may say "half a sandwich" but that's really only relative to the what they considering a normal sandwich. By size comparison I would say this would be a 6" sub at any sub shop but with extra meat. My corned beef was stacked with care, warmed to just south of 'hot', folded over itself properly so I could sink my teeth into it versus having just a brick of meat fighting me. The rye bread is a treat on its own.   The bill came to $24, and we both were stuffed, happy, and already planning a return trip. Between the atmosphere and food it's amazing how much a meal can take you back in time and someplace else. For a brief second I thought I was going to step out onto a street in Brookline, MA.

l2A0plprXliU51uTjsxvLA.text: Good food but Expensive. If you are OTHER than Jewish be prepared for scrutiny not kidding or facetious. Our party of 4 seemed to be a cause of concern? but I'm used to looks etc. I am a Matzo Ball Soup Fiend and theirs is pretty good the balls are light fluffy etc. The sandwiches are Expensive so a lunch for 4 was 67$$ not economical considering it was 3 soups 2 sandwiches and 3 beverages. The pastries/cookies are Delish But Again Expensive 8 Rugalach weighed a pound and was 9 and change. Its in a shopping center so parking is easy so if you want Kosher and don't mind spending then get your crave on.

5AQlyZ4GfI0GwIhBguvFgQ.text: Best deli ever!!! You better get there early though it can get a little crowded.  I have tried breakfast and lunch a everything I have eaten has been delicious.  What a great staff as well. Thumbs up for sure.

lIVPtkC0xp5d1QTNTd0xuw.text: After reading a few reviews, this place gave me the Bagel Cafe vibe, and it's not too far from me so I decided to give it a try. I went with my family and another family so we had a party of 7. They managed to accommodate us pretty quickly. The service from beginning to end wasn't bad, but it wasn't extraordinary either. At least half of our party started with the chicken noodle soup that they're famous for. I enjoyed it very much, but I did notice I had way more noodles than my boyfriends bowl. Between us we ordered an East Coast type sandwich made with Taylor Ham (a personal favorite) it was piled 4 slices high with American cheese and raw onion. Good sandwich. An order or chicken fingers, a BLT (too much L), an open faced roast beef, a burger (big but average), and a side of chicken salad. Ill go back for that chicken salad alone, it was one of the best I've ever tasted. Towards the end when we paid, we gave the waitress our bill that was only about $2 over. We were going to leave the rest and main part of her tip on the table as we collected it all. Well in the mean time she gave us dirty looks and assumed we only were leaving her that as a tip and talked smack to other employees. It was a little funny and annoying at the same time. As for a Jewish deli, ill stick to bagel cafe, but return here for Taylor ham and chicken salad Togo!

o6yaxF73J2VBxqerd4QVwg.text: I'm going to make this short and sweet.  Chicken Soup here is unbelievable.  Imagine a Jewish grandmother making a fresh batch of it for her favorite bubala who came down with a flu.   THAT'S how amazing it is.    The omelette was OK, so I can't go with 5 stars.  Service is great, too.

GNlP770On06-iy7Qf7-dmA.text: Best place to get chicken noodle matzo ball soup! Sandwiches are awesome. Going for bagels and lox in the morning for breakfast.

UO6iW4Qh7MOLx8W-vAvJKA.text: This place was great .My friend took me there for my birthday. It was busy when we got there and by the time we were almost done, there was a line.I ordered the Ruben sandwich. It came with lots of cheese, a little bit too much sauerkraut. It was a huge sandwich. The bread was toasted perfectly. It was served open faced it was yummy. The only downfall was the regular iced water. It was almost undrinkable. Even with lemon . I refrained from it and ordered soda. I'll definitely go back. By the way the potato salad was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. This was absolutely this was the best potato salad.

yUkSUeQgngKBvUEQ7o6HEA.text: Hello and welcome to Weiss Restaurant Deli & Bakery. I have been seeing reviews of this place for a while. And since I like a good deli sandwich we decided to stop and check out and see what they had. As you walk in its very hole in the wall in its decor. Pictures of menu items on the wall and that's pretty much it. This place was crazy busy. We were sat immediately and drink order taken (yay). We got the Pastrami on rye to share with fries. Sandwich was of good portion for 2 people to share. Fries were normal house fries. The meat was tender and good for any carnivore to enjoy. It did take a bit to get the attention of the staff to get a refill and our bill. They get busy and possibly understaffed. Thank you for eating at Weiss Restaurant Deli & Bakery. We will try again just to try the different sandwiches. Was not overly impressed but I did like the good, meaty sandwich. If in Henderson check it out. Good deli style meals.

1zM_6anWp8yPSDDE44oYlA.text: I have eaten here twice,  but have not been able to explore the menu.  We lived in jersey for a few years many years ago and appreciate a good diner.  That being said, we aren't in New York for astronomical prices, nor would I like to only be able to share a meal when eating here.  Half price and half portion would be wiser.  We just don't go here because you get four meals instead of one and they just up the price.  I don't want leftovers for a week.  I want one meal. When making a lunch date I don't want to have to share and when with my husband at a diner he wants a Reuben and I do not.  Basically,  this is the long time, most  authentic New York style deli in town and they know it and are taking advantage of that.  So they haven't gotten anymore business from us.  I glanced in their bakery before leaving and couldn't get any service.  Haven't been back for years due to these issues.

qx275vWcRJGw5Kt7DJosCw.text: Its a small place in the corner of the Trader Joe's shopping center, (Same side just in the corner) people were very friendly, unfortunately I did not go into the restaurant, I went in there to purchase some Kosher Salami, the price was $14 a pound so I just wanted a little for a sandwich and got 1/3 of a pound, unfortunatly later on I went to Costco and saw the SAME Kosher Salami, for 2 1/2 pounds for $11, so it was a little high there, but I guess you have to pay for the overhead some how.  Other then that it looked nice.

nDnvoBmboTwTTIgZT8DPnQ.text: Wow! I have been in this area for 20 years and did not know this place existed.  I was treated to a birthday lunch and what a lunch.  I have always been fond of a Reuben. I usually judge a place on the quality of the Reuben.  The open faced Reuben knocked my socks off.  I could not finish the whole plate which was accompanied by pickled green tomatoes and kosher dill pickles.  One of the other guests had the closed face Reuben which also looked awesome and the other guest had the chopped liver with onion sandwich.  I was fortunate enough to get a taste of the chopped liver(which I have never tried before) and I was impressed with that as well.  We are very fortunate to have an authentic deli that obviously cares about the quality of their food and the happiness of the customer.

M9-GjXH6-Gut8yPpPDquNg.text: The first time I came here I had the dip and loved it so we decided to come in since we were close by!  This time I tried the chicken noodle soup and the southwest chicken with fruit as a side. The soup was real tasty with nice chunks of chicken!!  My sandwich was good but the chicken was a little plain.  My friend got the chicken Marsala special and said it was good.  My bf got the top sirloin special and said it was ok. I tried a bite of his roasted potatoes and they were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Southwest chicken

WAClbdFDV6H-G8b1BDb_Pw.text: Went for breakfast Saturday morning.  For a first time, it was decent.  I had "The Usual", a bacon/egg/cheese breakfast sandwich, which was very filling.   I didn't try the bakery, but I'd like to next time.  The menu definitely has a lot of options I'd be willing to try again.  Service was OK.  Our waiter definitely wasn't bubbly or energetic or even peppy.  However, he didn't mess up our order and was friendly enough.    Atmosphere is probably the weakest part.  Walls are a plain white with only pictures of their own food in framed photos throughout.  The wall dividers in the main dining area seemed off; hard to explain without visuals, but it felt like being closed in.  Place wasn't completely clean; noticed dust or drywall bits on a nearby booth and vents looked dirty.  It just wasn't inviting.  Overall, the place isn't bad, but it wasn't as memorable as other delis (Jewish or not) I've been to before.

u7W2RJ4AF53Er13OJWbG5Q.text: Well we seen the reviews and came in. Sorry to say but the sand which I ordered wasn't good. Soggy all over the place and fell apart. The matzah ball soup was good!! Service good but not the sand which. SORRY. MAYBE NEXT TIME.

_7Xu1JiakH4IyV9f96zSZA.text: These are the best bagels in town. Soups are very good and sandwiches too. Nice outdoor seating and take out deli. Great place!

lIPlZTF1QxRIt9xzzSLEHg.text: One of the best breakfast spots in the country! The challah French toast is incredible, as is the corned beef hash. Service was great, drinks were always refilled and did I mention how delicious the food was? If there's a wait, it's worth it. If there's not, consider yourself lucky.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. The challah French toast...with a cameo by the latkes and bagels.

p_v7apt0gxm7QkSr1BoK8Q.text: We eat here a couple times a month - at least! It's a small place and is usually packed, so we go around 1-2pm on weekdays to avoid a wait.   It's almost always the same meal - we share a small order of the matzoh ball soup (makes this Jewish girl's heart sing!) and we share a Reuben sandwich. You should really share any sandwich here as the portions are HUGE! The food is delicious and comes out quickly. What's not to love??

gN3Xjbz93BdTsNrOK7axeQ.text: Best deli in the valley. Their chicken noodle soup, with or without the matzoh ball, is the best soup you will ever taste. I always get it when I'm feeling under the weather  (like I am today) and it always warms me up and makes me feel less miserable. Their sandwiches are delicious as well, and their macaroons are perfect. Everything they make is tasty. Only tiny downside is price but you get what you pay for, and that's quality.

ckXSNedt4GQ0613NbrRgIg.text: For Jewish deli in Las Vegas I rate it 5 stars. Corned beef hash, bagels, Matzoh brie, potato latkes, noisy, True East coast deli service... We enjoy this place for what it is but this is not your regular breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Dales way Matzoh brie

AA7x55x888lCJixA0rYGAQ.text: Glad to have been introduced to this Deli today! Super excited to have found a Jewish deli with all of my favorites! I cannot wait to go back and try some more good stuff!

rBai0RUGsuMptYtUzgC3qw.text: I was told that I had to give this place a try. Amazing food, and great service, I had the eggs Bene the Canadian bacon was a quarter inch thick the potatoes were spot on. The level of service was excellent. I would recommend Weiss Bakery to anyone.

08PJJ2iibMFpI_sjVFnS7A.text: 6.18.17 update- Had the challah bread French toast breakfast that comes with eggs, and delicious home fries, and it was incredible! Finally a place that serves French toast with home fries!!!   Hands down best matzo ball soup in Las Vegas! Shredded chickent, tons of veggies, noodles and generous portions! They also make a delish chicken salad sandwich. Only wish there was one closer to the SW area.  The inside of the restaurant could use a makeover but I'd much rather go to a place with great tasting food then pretty decor.

ezfEbOmtB8hMpWeiiwRR7g.text: There are 5 simple reasons why this place gets 5/5 stars AND is a place you should stop into:  #1: DELICIOUSNESS.  This place has great food! I am a huge fan of Nova lox, and this is the best in the Vegas area. Their sandwiches are good (corned beef...yuummmm), their breakfast menu is good (oatmeal is fantastic), and their bagels are fresh and flavorful!   #2: HUMONGOUS PORTIONS. You ever walk into a place and pay $12 for a sandwich, have it put in front of you, and wonder "How in the hell can that sandwich have actually costed me $12?" Well, you think that same thing when you come here...only for the opposite reason. You start trying to figure out how then can squeeze so much meat into the sandwich and still make a profit! (And quality cuts of meat at that!)  #3: FRIENDLY STAFF The staff is always friendly here. I have yet to come across a server that is unfriendly (unlike a number of other delis I have been to where it seems like sometimes you are there to serve the waitress. Not like that here!) You can tell that this place is packed full of regulars because you often hear the customer and waiter/waitress call each other by their names. (That is usually the best sign of a good restaurant.)  #4: PICKLES Lots of pickles. Delicious pickles. And they're free pickles. What's not to love about that?!  #5: BAKED GOODS Their baked goods, in addition to their great bagels, are fantastic. Personally, I never come here without getting some rugelakh and half&half cookie.

4FFALJTzhJIWpIrfhhUrNQ.text: Went in for breakfast today and forgot to check in cuz I was so busy eating.  Got 2 eggs scrambled with egg beaters and they also offer egg white only for .95 extra. With country fried potatoes seasoned and they are extra tasty. Also comes with any bagel and huge cup of cream cheese. All for 4.95 + .95   Then it's mandatory to get a small bowl of the absolute BEST chicken noodle soup on the planet ( just don't say that to your mom ) but it rocks! Service is pretty good but don't expect gourmet because it's a deli style place. Always a good experience here. Food is always very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. 1/2 turkey melt Sammie. Enough said, just try it!!!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Y&#39;all know that&#39;s the world famous chicken noodle Souper Soup with bagel chips. Foodies charge forward!
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. 1/2 open faced hot turkey melt. Mmmmm

lbFtj1LM9kxcanCSxgQXzQ.text: I am pretty obsessed with Matzo Ball soup I heard this place made a great one I thought the soup had too many onions and celery  You an still make a great soup using a potato peeler and slicing off the outer celery U can also cut the onion whole for just the flavor  It would be more authentic Other than that I liked this place  Just disappointed in the soup recipe

EdUOjjJ-6izyTGfY-zRL0A.text: Very good deli food. The corned beef sandwich is mostly lean (not always) and gigantic!!  They also have an incredible French Dip on the best soft roll. The Chicken Soup is to die for!!  The atmosphere...I'm not really a fan. Its crowded, loud and plain with seating very close together. I prefer booth seating and would rather not eat next to strangers. Not crazy about the renovations or the seating.  The staff is efficient. Have gone there at least 25  times in two years. Not as busy from 1:30 to 4:00pm. We now go at approx. 2:30 as it's much less crowded.

bNxhPsGSWJLDh-nmR6j9KA.text: One word: Magical  This place has sandwiches the size of a small child. They have the BEST potato salad I have ever had. Reminds me a little of Canter's Deli in Hollywood but smaller and more homelike. I love their bricket and their Matzo Ball soup is to die for. Great service, too. Friendly people!

g7RxXGbg4lswZfDZWYv0XA.text: I would be 200lbs heavier if I lived close to this place.   The pastrami open is a monster - even I as a big eater, chose to only eat half and finish the crispy golden fries.  Sure, the sammich was $19, but I was full, and had another half sammich to go for lunch.   FF to lunch the next day - everyone's eyes bulged at my half pastrami leftovers.  Worth it.    Pros: lots of good food - just order how they make it and you'll be overwhelmed.  Cons: all the way across town.  But I'd be there for a personal treat every now and then.

F32iiR9-n1uY_HmA_7q3Lg.text: good Jewish food, corn beef was amazing, the prices are not bad at all. my 3 stars are really for the Bakery. not much there and no sugar free baked goods at all, I was hoping for something good after dinner.  how ever I would go back for the sandwich again.

-tw81eOCNowmwCsf1XzwPg.text: This place needs some Love. Dirty, dingy, drab. Food is good, Benny's are spot on. Service was good, but not friendly. Step it up and you could have a complete package.

0ydZJ8rxUcKd1bA-pf06cw.text: The sandwich can feed two women! It is monstrous! I had the pastrami with Sauerkraut and mustard! It came with a pickle, tomato wedge, and coleslaw. I also ordered a heated knish. Everything was delicious! My husband found this place after going to Big 5. He always brings home the matzo ball soup when he's near here! The soup is fantastic!
