D7jtZUCtcgWBNayk5Hjigg.text: Last time I came and got the Reuben sandwich and it was really tasty so today is the sweet and sour cabbage big bowl of soup not the small.  change my mind from ! Motso ball which I'm sure is great also

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Okay, I guess I better take home some other good stuff. But I think I will move over to the desert section :-)

QMvmU-WK5DtJQ9HFXxoaQQ.text: Not my favorite bagels in Vegas, but everything else is excellent.  Staff is always friendly.  Food portions and quality are excellent!  Price to value is much better then other "bagel cafes" in Vegas.  Homemade potato salad is very good.  For sure a go-to place.

qRUp9n7PP9E5BZeIV-iFsA.text: A few months back, my fella wanted for me to try pastrami for the first time.  We asked for suggestions, and while the great sandwich debate of 2015 ACTUALLY ended in a showdown about homemade/vs restaurant sandwiches, and someone getting mad that we don't subscribe to the "Get in the kitchen and make me a sammich" mentality...we DID get some good restaurant suggestions, and Weiss was one of them.  We found ourselves on this side of town on Saturday, after a movie, and even though we had eaten a HUGE breakfast AND popcorn...we had to stop in.  When I was younger, my mom used to make "Jewish Penicillin"...aka Matzoh ball soup. I saw that this was on the menu, and I almost died.    We ordered a whole pastrami on rye, and a SMALL cup of the chicken noodle with matzoh balls.    Holy generous portions, Batman.   For real, this sandwich was as big as my head.  Fella and I split it, and I STILL couldn't eat the whole thing.  Huge, heaping portions of flavorful pastrami and delicious rye bread...they offered standard yellow mustard, and whole grain mustard (of course I used whole grain). This sandwich was perfection.  The soup made me cry.  It tasted JUST like my Uncle Sherwin's recipe that my mom used to make when I was younger.  I haven't had matzoh ball soup in probably 20 years.  It was amazing.   Service was super polite.    I will DEFINITELY be going back to try some other offerings!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastrami sammich of doom! Delicious
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzoh ball soup!  Amazing,  just like my Uncle Sherwin&#39;s

i6GPqDJp1j4WUx6tSphm2w.text: How does this deli compare to Katz's in New York . The 5 Stars is for Katz's I recently left a review on yelp for Katz's feli

LqFqF2VEXf29Ec7A4acqXA.text: GOOD FOOD. The service is basic and adequate. But, the food comes out fast and tasty. Second best corned beef and hash that I've had in Henderson.  The challa  bread French toast is pretty great too. It's a little cramped but comfortable and clean. It's definitely in my top 4 breakfast spots in Henderson. It's not fancy but your tastebuds will be happy.

Q6zz9F0YGAeeOoMcgL45wA.text: Jewish Deli? not many in Vegas..but this is the best. Clary is a must. Way better than Canters...Portions are huge so don't balk at the prices..you are basically getting two meals for one here. Matzo is on point and authentic. Shut up and eat here already.

t9LNRNjhtyK-ooPRr5l1Mg.text: The matzoh ball soup is so delicious with noodles and shredded chicken, served with crispy bagel chips. It's a bit pricey however the sandwiches are huge and piled high with meat and I can split with my husband so it's definitely worth the money!

kRPOHDMDaqOxB9fWIkCggw.text: I love this place! They have the most delicious white fish salad I've ever had. My friend and I really enjoy Lox and bagels, so we figured we'd try it here with their whitefish salad and we were not disappointed!!! We got 2 everything bagels, plenty of smoked salmon, whitefish salad, onions, capers, a pickled green tomato, a crisp pickle, and smooth cream cheese for about $20. They're servings are very large, so 2 people can definitely share and get full. Their chicken noodle and their matzo ball soups are amazing! Their brownies are toe curling goodness. Their rugelachs are delicious!  The service here is always good, even when they're busy...and they're always busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Lox and everything bagel w/ whitefish salad

6cpZ3ui1xku1RxlW96_Ltw.text: I had instant love for this spot. This has been on my list of restaurants to try forever, but it took needing matzoh ball soup to get me here.  The menu here has far more options than I ever expected. They have a large selection of sandwiches and various types of fish. In the take-out area I noticed they even have stuffed cabbage, chili, and other delicious foods.   I had half of a sandwich with matzoh ball soup. My husband had the Beach Club. The portions on both were huge, we could have definitely split the full sandwich. The matzoh ball soup blew my mind and nipped an almost cold in the bud. The rye bread on the sandwiches was SO good! I could tell the difference between their rye and something I would buy at the grocery store. We also had a pastry that was buttery and tasty.   Pricing seemed reasonable for a deli and portions were very generous. I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Matzoh Ball Soup
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Beach Club

jCApmDFZc0kNqU_ce-WCoA.text: Terrible Dining Experience!  Early dinner time, 4/2/18, tall thin waiter (wearing a ball cap) served.  We are 2 senior ladies and I am disabled as well.  The server was nasty (sighing and eye-rolling), and I asked him if were annoying him, and he responded saying, just tell me what you want so I only have to make one trip to this table. We were missing a dish we ordered, knives and butter. The Reuben's look nothing like the photo. The chicken breast was overcooked (charred and very dry) and barely edible. We didn't dare complain ... because ... He was around the corner from where we were sitting talking about us and laughing with 2 other boys. They were also hitting one another with menus, and their language was awful... such as yelling "F***ing A!" loud enough for customers to hear.  It seems asking for butter was cutting into his play time. Before I got a bite into my sandwich, they turned over chairs on top of the table immediately next to us.  Obviously the restaurant owners were not present. Even if not for the abusive server, the food wasn't good enough.

moQ-Kuq3YWSAi7c0uoPQvQ.text: Best breakfast place in town! Haven't had anything here that wasn't fabulous! If you're looking for an authentic Jewish deli then you're in for a treat!

twPV4j3_SyQ4K87a-3YrJw.text: After a long time being away, we were both looking forward to breakfast here. We love the Farmers Hash with all of its veggies and melted cheese on top. We split this meal, as it is a really good size. We chose the sesame bagel, and it comes with a generous portion of cream cheese on the side.   Well, this time was really disappointing. They have changed the interior from the last time we were here. They have put up these 3/4 walls along the front and side of the dining area. This has created no room to move around. We had to stand in between tables and wait while a waiter took an order, all while on our way to be seated.   When we got to our table, it was only a two-top and was crammed with condiments of all kinds. Our table was just far enough away from the tables on either side of us so that you could squeeze by and sit on the bench. I didn't like this at all. No privacy at all. We got to listen to both conversations next to us.   Our service was not the greatest. The servers were so busy that we felt ignored. The food was pretty good though. That was the only good part. What did come back to me was that there is always the lingering odor of burned toast/bagels. I don't know if they need to clean their toaster, or turn down the heat...but it was unpleasant. Today was especially bad. The table next to us got toast, and I'll just say that it was very well done. Eww.   We had a hard time leaving as well, since a table on one side was just being seated. Won't be coming back here to dine in. Might stop for bagels to go, as that entrance is off to the side and their bagels are tasty. The burnt toast smell is bad, service is mediocre and it is way too congested in there.

CLU11y3lnWsgLO_RKVYETA.text: This place is fantastic.  A great place for great food in Henderson Nevada.  We go out of our way to come here every time we come to Las Vegas.  Matzoh ball soup is fantastic!  Service is very nice as well and don't forget to stop at the deli for some to go treats!

wtLgxbrrcGjZnoHqoG1HRQ.text: I'll keep this short and sweet if possible, this is a very comfy family style diner. Food portions are large and have a kind of home made tasty appeal. The staff is always very nice and helpful however they are always rotating in new young people. They have Deli and bakery items as well as the classic New York style lunch offerings. Pickles are made in house based on the taste of them, and they have delicious pickled tomatoes as well. So far I've had their pastrami, turkey melt, and chicken soup and they've all been very satisfying. The only reason for no five stars is that it just seems like there could be a bit more room for improvement on server training. Seems like we get the wrong sides every time we go.

lE049jANjDCM2mFyEbttNQ.text: Had really high expectations for this place because of the reviews. Ordered the pastrami sandwich full size. $14.50 for the sandwich with a small side of fries. The portion was huge I only finished half of the sandwich but the flavors were lacking I added Swiss cheese for an extra fee which helped but the pastrami had no seasoning and the bread only had spicy mustard.

6XH4kTc8KOquSAZYMiwg3A.text: So delish! You feel like you're going to walk outside after and be in NYC. Fast (and exceptional) service, lots of conversation going on around you, served quickly, delicious food, reasonable prices- Weiss has it all.

jC70iJXy4mAZ7lPg1BApMA.text: An outstanding experience, the service, food, were all fantastic. I've never enjoyed a better chicken noodle soup or club sandwich in my entire life. Visiting this fine deli reminds me of a New York style deli, having said that based on my experience this place is better. One of the best appetite pleasing restaurants I've found. VBb7S8N7kGa3Cx-zYCuFjg.text: I've been to Weiss' 3 times now and all 3 have been great experiences. The most recent was when I stopped in last week for breakfast and it's had me craving another  visit ever since.  I came in around 10 min after 8 (they open at 8AM) and was seated immediately. My drink order was quickly taken (coffee) and was brought out moments later. The staff consistently stopped by to offer a re-fill whenever I was in need. After scanning the menu I decided on the farmers market with over-medium eggs, fresh fruit (great option guys), and an egg bagel recommended by my waitress. The homey decor and mom and pop ambience made for a pleasant/comforting wait. Various travel photos are hung on the walls throughout the shop, providing me a welcome distraction as my breakfast was prepared.  My food arrived in a timely manner and it was absolutely delicious. The eggs were cooked perfectly (IMO the best over-medium in town) and the swiss cheese (I subbed it in) over the hash was a great compliment to the dish. The egg bagel was tasty with a texture that was dense yet soft with a slight chew, the cream cheese was not over powering, and the subtle flavor was very good. My fresh fruit included 2 slices of cantaloupe, a strawberry, and an orange, a nice refreshing way to finish a great meal. Thanks to the Weiss family for a great dining experience. Here's to many more

VxKCRPu_4Bj3ozoUxJvFqA.text: Weiss deli was another fantastic yelp find! I was in Henderson a few years back and searching for a break from my usual eat spots and read several positive reviews for Weiss and decided to give it a try. Since that fateful day I have been there approximately twenty times and it has been consistently outstandng. My favorite menu item is the pancake breakfast. The price is exceptionally reasonable as compared to other breakfast places in Las Vegas and Henderson. The eggs, I prefer scrambled, are always light, fluffy, and delicious. The bacon is crisp but not burnt, and the pancakes are fluffy and simply divine! Another go to menu choice for me is the soup and a half sandwich. The chicken soup is among the best I have had in Las Vegas/Henderson. Do yourself a favor and give Weiss deli a try you will be glad you did!

Tz3P3K9wL9Uv6htvnuZlTg.text: So being married to a Jew in Las Vegas and there only being two Jewish Delies this place has been high on my wife's "to do" list of Jewish places to go to. Well it has only disappointed with its mediocre food and sub-par service.  I only say sub-par because if you go there mid-week the service is amazing and it trumps the fact that the food is mediocre, which is why we have gave it a second and third chance.  If you really want good Jewish food, or just good food in general check out the Bagel cafe.

QMvWl-HTnU2k5R1p1lIh8A.text: Best Corned Beef Hash in town.  And the bagels are amazing.  Eat here.

vjUbtxkmBic7GeJuDjLA1w.text: Work down the street so I thought I'd check it out and got hotdogs once, and it was 9 bucks for a average dog, then I got some chicken wings for 11 bucks and seems all frozen, 4 pieces and some fries. pretty disappointed, I guess maybe I'm not ordering the right things but still.

ZTgZmIntt6yc_7omXOIC5Q.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants! I love the chicken noodle soup and the potato salad! Great sandwiches like the BLT or Tuna; pretty much anything you get will be amazing! It's a cozy little spot where you can sit down with great service or take your order to go.

The cabbage soup was amazing and so flavorful, we also got a roast beef open face sandwich ((I forgot the name)) and it was also amazing! We shared everything since the prices are a little high but it was more than enough food and worth it. I'll be coming back for sure

QPxSerKXPKqheZVnrx365g.text: I'm not quite sure it's as good as the Bagel Cafe but it's damn close. Vat a Deli ........great corn beef, fantastic club sandwich, chicken soup to die for. Real atmosphere. Customer next to me asked if they had lettuce wraps !!!!!! I almost fell out of my chair. Honey you are in the wrong place .

adaVOrpy6vB2FdN9X3r2eg.text: I love Weiss Deli...my girlfriends and I go a lot...their sandwiches are filling and the meat I usually get (pastrami and  corned beef) is so lean and delicious also the Matzo ball soup is great. And can't forget the service, very nice people work there.

KLvOTWfXnsoTmRDYelXcvA.text: This place is pure magic.   I have never actually eaten in the restaurant, I've always gotten my food to go and today was no different. I was in need of some bagel love in honor of National Bagel Day and the sadly the hot bagel spots are lacking in Henderson... on to Green Valley!   I went with the, "The Bomb" bagel sandwich on an everything bagel and the layers of love never seemed to end on this heavenly sandwich. Get this... A three egg western omelet sitting atop a mountain of hash browns, bacon, and cheese fully surrounded by a massive everything bagel. This was a Viking sized breakfast that also became part of my lunch later in the day.   The bagels at Weiss are always warm, fluffy, and come with a light toast on them for that perfect crunch. The omelet was filled with flavor from both the ham and peppers, plus the added pile of hash brown was just the extra carb push I needed to get the day started off right. This is a solid tribute to the massive bagels of New York.   The weekend can get packed here so you're better off waiting until around noon or 1pm to cruise in for those weekend snack excursions.

26ccOfrV7_hsI3LzQHCoVQ.text: A friend of ours recommended this place. This is the 3rd time we've  been here and everything we've always tried has been AMAZING! Today i order macaroons from the deli. They're usually out and now i know why! Delicious! Tasted like a vacation! Coconutty, soft but some crunch...WOW! Also got  a Rueben, just a half and the photo i took is half of a half. HUGE portions! Also amazing!! Figured i should share the experience as it was a good one!

HBGWyrR99dPt6m8Omw8H2w.text: Dropped in here for Valentine's Brunch (ok, it was just me, alone) after my hike and the place was pretty full. A table for 7 was seated quickly before me, and I was seated fast as well. My order was taken quick, food delivered about 15 minutes later. Service was fair, a little slow but understandable with the crowd.  Tables are tight inside, so you can hear lots of conversation. Off to one side is the bakery, but I didn't look at what was available.  Lots of people ordering the chicken noodle soup with matzah ball so it must be a favorite. Looked pretty good. I went with a standard breakfast fare of eggs, bacon, fruit, and a garlic bagel with cream cheese. The bagel was ok, heavy on the garlic flavor to the point I couldn't finish it. Bacon was nice thick strips and 4 of them so good portion there.   Overall, just an average meal for $11. I'd come back to try the pancakes as those looked delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon, eggs, fruit and a garlic bagel

h1PbUk3OTuOPGi4bHouIDg.text: Just amazing. Everything from the service to the food screamed perfection. It is a must for a complete meal or for just a nosh!

UdfFF_6aZ_gH316XaHn52w.text: My boyfriend and I came in around 5 o clock pm and it was dead. We seated ourselves and someone came by to grab our drinks and we were already ready to order ( I really wanted a French dip and I heard that the ones here are good ). The busser grabbed our server and she came right by to get our order. I didn't catch her name but she was really sweet! Our food was out in no time...and it was huge!!! I was not expecting the sandwich to be that big. It was also on a roll which was different but I thought it was neat! I added onions to it which made it so much better (I love grilled onions on my sandwiches). When I dipped it in the au jus sauce I noticed it kinda had a funky taste. It was very yummy but the au jus sauce was a little bit different than what I'm normally used to. It wasn't terrible though! They really do stuff the sandwich with meat, so much I might ask if they can do light meat next time! anyhow, I enjoyed the vibe that was in there and I will most likely be back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. French dip with grilled onions and French fries.

K2_fa7tMxFAnleHf39zVdQ.text: Super good! Corn beef and Pastrami were both delicious and the sandwiches are big with lots of meat. A little costly but a nice treat when you're crazy a good sandwich and a side of Matzo Ball soup.

bIoFqo48Pz3kFKUZqYfrVg.text: After a horrible experience at Bagel Cafe in Vegas, I can't even say how grateful I am to have stumbled on this place. I grew up in New York/Philly and have lived in Chicago so I've eaten some top-notch Jewish food and know the real deal when I see it. My standards are extremely high I admit. Even though it's 30 min from where I live, I would drive here 3x a week or more for the food. It's a little, unassuming hole in the wall by Trader Joe's that I've actually missed seeing before while in this shopping center. First glance at the menu I was a little surprised at the prices, but after eating there last night I totally get it.  First off, the chicken matzoh ball soup is like grandma used to make. Not too salty but flavorful, I like their take on it with the small noodles, not egg noodles. A lot of white meat chicken floating around in it. The matzoh ball was the size of a small baseball, easily enough for 2 or 3 to share. Perfect density, not chewy but firm and well seasoned, unlike the swill that passes for soup at TBC.  It was a trough sized bowl to boot, easily enough to make 2 meals out of by itself. My gf and I made the rookie mistake of ordering 2 sandwich platters. Omg I've never seen a triple-decker sandwich that size before at any Jewish deli. It's basically 2 sandwiches for the price of one, so any objections I may have had to the price was put to rest. It was awesome, good quality corned beef, turkey and swiss on marble rye. So good! We'll probably be sharing from here on out.  The service was excellent, the opposite of what you normally get at TLC. We sat down and were acknowledged immediately, and I think Jacques was our server. Super friendly, he hooked us up with an extra matzoh ball when we left for no charge. This place knows what service is all about. Fortunately, they had lox/whitefish and all the trimmings to go in a little take-out nook in the corner of the restaurant. This is when it gets real for me - good nova lox and whitefish salad to take home and make my own sandwiches with is no joke - I take my Sunday brunches with good friends and better Jewish food very seriously.  They knocked it out of the park! It's so hard to find whitefish salad that isn't too greasy or over-loaded with mayo - it's perfect. Creamy and super-delish. The chunk whitefish is just as good and the homemade nova lox cream cheese was superb. The prices are on par with any major city and well worth it to me.  I normally spend lots of time and $ digging up every Jewish deli I can find when I move to a new place, Jewish food is pretty much a staple for me. I can say that my search is over, I don't need to go anywhere else. I would drive an hour to get here if I had to. They could compete in cities like Chicago or Philly with their food. The owner Michael was a great guy, I chatted with him for a few minutes before I left to thank him for the experience. I can't wait to go back and try the breakfast specials and especially the potato pancakes - if they are what I think they'll be I'll be a fan and customer for life. Kudos Weiss Deli!!

nWzcVAPNz_uAwqvpZBC9iw.text: me and my pops took a drive to arizona to get some powerball tickets on the way back i thought i could take him since we live on the other side of town and most likely wouldent come here even if it were 5 stars as we live in summerlin. Ok so the feel of this place is old as in you need to update this place..its dated badly...im ok with it but it could definetly use an updating. the entry and the entrance to the eating area and deli counter are too tight for a wheel chair. But,in any event i wasnt here to rate the decor if the food is good im down with it...my dad had the chicken noodle soup..i had some too was good a bit bland but a little salt and pepper and it was good to go..he also had a dinner salad which looked good fresh and plenty of food. I had the patty melt and this was outstanding huge serving,ample meat..a classic..had some fries with it they were normal nothing spectacualar. i was given a new pickle which i hate so i asked for old..good old pickles need a snap..these were really bad and soggy to me its just poor quality control to serve that to anyone ...i would nevber serve that at my restaurant..horrible. i got some whitefish salad and some danish to go..the whitefish salad is great but the danish is super ridiculous size..who eats that much danish in one sitting..its a diabetic special....parking was easy but as i mentioned its too far to go back with any regularity..but if i lived on that side of town i would probably go regularly as they are the only deli that i know of on that side of town.

9fSNhgBA-DRY5doiVRU_LA.text: I read the reviews before I went and was really hoping for something special.  What I got was something average.  Walked in and seated ourselves as directed by the sign.  The problem was that though there were several empty tables, most were not clean.  Neither were the floors.  The table we selected had been wiped down but there was a 1/3 of the lower half of a bagel in front of it on the floor.  Elsewhere on the floors were discarded sugar packets and straw wrappers.  The bathroom stored much of the cleaning supplies and smelled terrible.   Our server was very good.  Took a few minutes to arrive, but was friendly and attentive.  Drinks were refilled timely, our bill was presented at the correct time, and he was gracious and helpful. The food was rather bland.  I had a classic turkey club, but all I could taste was the turkey.  The bacon, tomato and rye bread flavors were no where to be found, yet all were easily identifiable, so it's not like they skimped. If not for the cleanliness, I'd give it another try, but if the front of the house is messy, imagine what the back looks like.  One and done for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States

or0mhEvVrXy-gbxmn9YP-g.text: This is one of my favorite places near my work. There breakfast is always good but I'm here for the sandwiches. Hot or cold they are always packed with plenty of meat. I like getting a half sandwich with soup. There chicken noodle with matzah ball is the best! Comfort food at its finest!!

9fTfGp8_PEa3gZLpPsyNDQ.text: I met my favorite, Jaime W, here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Weiss had been on my radar for a while, so when she suggested we meet there I was excited to finally see if it lived up to the hype.   I ordered a pretty basic breakfast that came with eggs, potatoes and bacon, and we also decided to share an everything bagel. I have had some good bagels in my day... when I first started dating my husband he worked for a man that had relocated his bagel shop from New York City to Arizona, and I ate man, MANY bagels from that shop. The everything bagel we had at Weiss was, without a doubt, the best bagel I have had in Vegas.  My only real complaint about Weiss was the service, it super spotty. I asked for more half and half for my coffee... Our waitress came back 5 minutes later to see how we were doing, empty handed. So I asked again.   Despite the so-so service the food was fantastic. Great breakfast potatoes and the bacon was cooked perfectly. And that bagel, so good!!   Weiss has definitely lived up to the hype thus far, next time I will be sure to go for lunch so I can try the soup I have heard such wonderful things about!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast of champions

DXjo2hdN7C09AYqpdXpRQA.text: Have you ever gotten that feeling that you walked into a place that was secret? All heads turn to look at you as if to say 'uh oh... someone new found out about this place and tables will be harder to get now...' Well, this is a secret and it's for a reason. The food is fantastic! The portions on most dishes is twice the size of others. If you are a New York Deli regular and want to traditional feel in Vegas (confirmed by my New York raised wife!) you have found the spot.

uW3hhtgWMXiJA1wgLU-OLA.text: One of the best NY style Jewish delis I have ever been to outside of NY and definitely the best in Nevada.  I loved my turkey Reuben and they have real NY Kinshasa (the square ones!) flown in from NY.  The black & white cookies are the biggest I have ever seen and just as good. Add a dr brown black cherry soda and it was a near perfect meal!  Nice friendly staff although I don't think any of them have been to NY.  Definitely come if you miss NY or just want the deli food.

Fg5K9E0iHJ_GFVIIFJgTdw.text: If I knew this place was this close to my house I would have been here years ago! I've been in this shopping center billions of times and never seen this place. It's in the corner of the shopping plaza almost hiding. This place is the real deal Jewish deli. Harries has nothing on this place. It was mid morning when we came in, we were seated right away and recieved breakfast menus. I didn't come for breakfast I came for on thing in particular and that was the famous chicken noodle soup. I asked the server if they had it and she said yes so she brought me a lunch menu. It's available early if you ask for it. I ordered the chicken noodle soup on a combo with a half corned beef sandwich on rye. The fiance ordered the corned beef hash breakfast with potatoes and eggs. I received my chicken soup first then we got the rest of our order a few minutes later. The soup was perfection. The broth had deep chicken flavor the veggies cooked just right and the noodles were thinner than angel hair which is my favorite pasta. The matzoh ball had no flavor and I didn't enjoy it at all. Save the $2.00 and use it for something else unless you like matzoh balls didn't have any taste whatsoever. The corned beef was very good but the bread was too soft. Almost mushy so next time I know to have the bread toasted. The corned beef hash was very good as well, eggs cooked perfectly with runny insides just as asked. Service was pretty good but they took forever to bring the bill after we asked for it. I would definitely come back that soup was so comforting and delicious. I just wished I knew it was this close to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Half corned beef sandwich combo that came with my soup. Bread was too mushy after the juicy corned beef. Toasted bread next time
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned beef hash breakfast with eggs over easy.
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken noodle soup! Amazing Rich chicken broth lots of chicken and noodle thinner that angle hair. Matzoh ball had no flavor :/

66Qm0JXps-Ch8nvN1ik3zw.text: Excellent service!! The food was delish (I'd recommend the latkes stuffed with brisket ) but the service was even better!! Our waiter Jacques was amazing, the True definition of a gentleman. As we were leaving we noticed they had several different types of cream cheese you can purchase to take home with you, too!! Definitely will be coming back for some matzo ball soup!!

7LvqfN1X07VzV8lA5fp8gA.text: This place has the best chicken soup ever! It's authentic New York Jewish deli food. We arrived a little after noon and the entire restaurant was jam packed.   We both ordered chocolate egg creams, they were delish! The only bad part is that they don't give you a gallon sized glass.. ;-)  All three of us opted for the half sandwich and cup of soup. Their portions are huge! I ordered a half of a bagel, they served a whole bagel as a "half portion"... Superb!   The half portion of chicken soup is a full bowl. It comes out really hot too. Their matzoh balls are softball size.   The prices are very fair considering the portion size. My daughter ordered a hot dog-- it was a 1/4lb! They serve Hebrew national brand, yummy!   I can't wait to go back! 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Everything bagel with whitefish salad.... Yum!

8vrF29hWEO852NRLoWv-TQ.text: We just finished lunch here but looking at all the pics posted, I want to go back already to try more things! We drooled at every plate being set down at the tables around us. Luckily, we were a party of 5 so it allowed us to order and try more items. I had Ciely's Stack with the brown gravy on the side. It was so yum and the thing was huge! The braised brisket wasn't dry and the combo of flavors from top to bottom totally hit the spot. (Gravy on the side allowed us to use it for our fries too. Yum!)  We also ordered a French toast that exceeded my expectations. (I love FT but rarely order it as I'm normally disappointed. But not here! I would totally order it again here!)  The Remington was great too. Loved the salted cucumber that came with the sandwich. The layers of flavor starting with rye to horseradish to roast beef and the cheese and onions makes for a party in your mouth!  We're definitely adding this place to our list of "off strip dinings" to recommend to friends and coming back, for sure!

Id5IvNyhu4IrzkBXtkM2JA.text: This was our second time having Sunday brunch at Weiss.  They have great specials daily and last Sunday was no exception. One sounded better than the next.  So my guy and I had to do it, and each picked a special. My guy had the Eggs Bradley which was like a variation of a benedict and the home fries as his side. He cleaned his plate, so I'm guessing he enjoyed his food. LOL! I had the fresh blueberry challah french toast special.  My portion was huge! Everyone around us commented on it. The guys at the table next to us laughed and said "Good luck with that!"  It was super tasty and I loved the fresh blueberries.  And btw, I ALMOST finished the whole thing. We enjoyed this local place in Henderson for sure and next time we'll be back with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Fresh blueberry challah french toast
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs Bradley, which was like a variation of a benedict and the home fries.

eNYk7SS9VrvtCVkJ59D9Ag.text: We went for a late breakfast on a Saturday. The service was slow (minus 1 star) but the food was exceptional. I knew once we got our coffee that we had chosen a good place, they have really good plain ol' coffee (a sure sign of a good breakfast spot). I had the stack (combo of an omelette & hash), which was delicious, but my dining partner had the silver sandwich and it was AMAZING. Their sandwiches are a little pricey ($16 or $17 for the silver) but it was worth every penny - we even had leftovers, a rare occasion.  I enjoyed looking at everyone else's food going by - the pancakes looked wonderful as did the matzo ball soup and french toast. Even their salads looked plentiful and delicious.

3xa5qPCi-k6TTx2qo6bNrA.text: This is definitely the best breakfast place in the city. If you want to go to a really good deli at a reasonable price with unbelievable food and huge portions this is the place to go. They have a brisket eggs Benedict that is really good but I prefer corn beef hash on my eggs Benedict and they made it for me special. It may have been the most tasty eggs Benedict I ever had. They also have the best bagel sandwiches that I've ever experienced. I would recommend trying the pork roll breakfast sandwich as it's a combination of ham and salami with egg and cheese and will probably fill you up for the day. It's just crazy crazy good... I go here with a friend of mine pretty regularly and we just love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Brisket eggs Benedict

JT9b9AwcIeylfpmb0RhJhw.text: Good portions and great service from the waiting staff. There is also a bakery/deli adjacent to the restaurant - great bagels!

tJckkCkMwGBDZJDtq8XCQg.text: Decide to whip out a magazine or your MacBook, and voila, you WILL stop receiving coffee! They weren't even subtle about it. Eye-rolls and whispering about it among the waitstaff. Wowsers!  That's exactly what happened to us. And we weren't even there for 25mins at that point. The impressive waitperson-to-table ratio makes this a turn-and-burn establishment that clearly does not want you to linger. Eat and run, or else!  I guess that's OK because Weiss's 1970s decor, cramped booths and low ceilings do not inspire a lengthy meal anyways. You get the feeling that by 9AM the rent has been paid; the rest is gravy.  Feeling 3-star-nice because the food was pretty good. But it's True that bad service keeps you from going back. Too bad - when we're recording at the studio on East Sunset Road, we're there for 3 or 4 days in a row for at least 2 meals each day. Still looking for our go-to spot in that neighborhood!

LnCXICEyHgiVFMfSa0jdtg.text: I love this place for their egg bagels and cream cheese. The price ($1.20 per bagel) are about the same as Einstein, but taste better.

s46yYNqondyUgVekwqDRHg.text: This is one of the top Jewish Deli's not only in this area , but the entire country . Whenever friends come to visit , this place is a must . I eat here regularly . The best corned beef , great brisket and my favorite bagels in Las vegas . Also 5 star homemade salads : tuna , egg and potato . The fresh breads are also worth mentioning . Ending this revue , I would be remiss if I didn't comment on the fabulous matza ball soup . Please try it and thank me later .

UwzoKfDx8xTry8OzyDjHPw.text: I remember when a couple of other businesses occupied this location that Weiss Deli is at so I was skeptical about if Weiss was like them or not. The reviews and delicious pictures on yelp got my to finally try this Jewish deli. It is tucked in the corner of a shopping center. They have a decent amount of tables and chairs outside if eating outdoors is your thing. Inside is clean, but the decor is dated. The booth I sat at had gashes in the seat. The inside isn't very big so I imagine trying to eat here on the weekend is a zoo. When you walk inside towards the left they have bagels & pastries for sale. I took a look but the case was empty and I was told by our server that they sell out quick in the mornings. They have a board when you enter that tells you what specials are going on that day.  They have a section on the menu that says "not so hungry" for those feeling like they can't tackle a whole sandwich themselves. You get 1/2 of a sandwich (your choice from the sandwich station area on the menu) and your choice of either a cup of soup, fries, coleslaw,  potato salad or fresh fruit on the side. I decided to order this priced at $9.95 and I can assure you that you do need to be hungry unlike the menu claims because the portions are generous. I decided to try the "Chicken Noodle Soup" and it was the best I have e-v-e-r had in my life! It was hardly a cup like the menu suggests and was filling all by itself. I could just sip on the broth for days! The soup had a couple bagel chips on the side that had such a nice garlic flavor. For my sandwich I went with the "Roast Turkey" on challah bread. The 1/2 sandwich was so big that I had to cut it in half just to eat it. The bread was seriously delicious!  I could only eat a portion of my sandwich and took the rest home for later. My hubby ordered a "Pastrami Burger" priced at $9.95 that came with a side of fries. He said the pastrami had good flavor.   I saw on the menu they offer catering.   The next time I stop in I will be trying out something from their tasty looking breakfast menu. I would stop in when working on this side of town just to get some of the soup to-go!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Pastrami Burger&#34; @ Weiss Deli - 6/20/13
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Roast Turkey Sandwich&#34; @ Weiss Deli - 6/20/13
Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Chicken Noodle Soup&#34; @ Weiss Deli - 6/20/13

CuOBqp3XbctrQlrCaGS_9A.text: My dad is obsessed with finding a good Jewish deli; in his world that means chicken noodle soup, a corned beef sandwich, and real raw horseradish - none of that inferior creamy stuff.  Every time we're in Vegas together, I humor him by yelping "deli," never expecting to find anything worth trying out.  Imagine my surprise when Weiss popped up in my results...   Curious but not expecting too much, we hopped in the car and drove over.  My skepticism proved to be no match for this deli - we all walked away pleasantly surprised and with full bellies.  Service was excellent - honestly one of the most professional and efficient, not to mention genuinely nicest waiters I've ever interacted with.    The portions are HUGE.  A bowl of soup could feed all of Boulder City.  So much real chicken, veggies, and super thin noodles, make this a hearty and yummy start to a meal.  The bagel chips that are served with the soup were delightfully crunchy and included a big variety of flavors (plain, pumpernickel, everything, etc).  Only complaint on the soup is that my mom's and my matzo balls were really soggy, like maybe they were undercooked or left in the broth for way too long.    The corned beef sandwich was very large - tons of meat, on seemingly homemade rye bread that was super tasty but could have been toasted a little more to provide a more solid structure to house the meat. The meat had great flavor; for my taste it could have been a bit leaner or more cleanly trimmed of fat, but I am extraordinarily picky about that - for most people, the way they serve it will be perfectly fine.    The best part?  Raw horseradish!   One suggestion?  More pickles!  One pickle per person does not a deli make!  I'm kidding, this place is definitely living up to its Delicatessen name.   But I'm serious about more pickles.

StfUqY281lZYbc_Ki6tpuw.text: 2 stars only because I didn't get to try the food yet, I'll adjust when I can get down there...hopefully tomorrow. I posted on FB bc I had a bad hankering for a great roast beef sandwich - I had multiple people tell me to come here, so my wife left the gym tonight at 5:50 by our house and asked me to call in our order while she drove the 20 minutes to pick up the food. After calling (literally) 25 times in a matter of 10 minutes and getting the answering machine that said to call back, I let my wife know I couldn't get ahold of them. She decided to keep driving and just order before the restaurant closed at 6:30. She called me very disappointed at 6:18 and said the girls at the counter just got the phones fixed and that the kitchen closed at 6:15 and they wouldn't cook us anything. Apparently the lady in front of my wife was livid...Usually when a place closes at a certain time they take orders until that time, but hey such is life. I wish we would have reached them on the phone at 6 to put the order in, but that was beyond our control tonight as well. We had planned on taking the night off cooking but that didn't happen...can't wait to try this place.

ULcTbWXVqRodiFiv_2tnwQ.text: Right now the "Jewish Deli" is monopolized by the hotels on the strip, and as a local, why would you want to go down there? Especially on a weekend! What to navigate taxi cabs and pedestrians to park in a massive garage and walk a mile to the restaurant? Battle through the smoke filled casino to wait in line with tourists to get a sandwich? No way.  This deli is really traditional. It has all your basics, big sandwiches, ethnic food, Dr Browns soda, soups, etc. It's even good for breakfast, but there are tons of breakfast places so just save this place for lunch or a real early dinner (since they close early). Even if you're "all Americana" you can get some plain Jane sandwiches or a burger, but you should expand your horizons and get at least some pastrami.  The place gets packed on the weekend lunch hour. Not too bad, but if you're in a group larger than 4 you may have a wait. Portions are huge for the price, which is good, unless you are looking to slim down.  The only negative is the bakery inside. The cookiees and pastries are really expensive. I bought 3 small cookiees and the price was almost $8, compared to my entire lunch which was only $15! The 3 cookiees weren't even that tasty.  Skip the bakery, come hungry, leave happy.

T_JW_PfWDr8eGe1OAfJ9Ag.text: I'm so glad I live so close to this awesome NY style deli. Been coming here for over 20 years. As close to NY as we have here in Vegas. The matzoh ball soup is the best & I always get it when I'm not feeling well. Works every time.

irfBKihxOszgCggR76Th-A.text: 2nd visit to this awesome deli. Great food and friendly servers. Absolutely the best deli in town. Worth the drive from the strip. Had the best chicken noodle soup and a chopped liver (half) sandwich. Awesome!!!

rb3wGjnB9S3zc3niS2VHYg.text: From the moment I walked in the door I had such a great experience at Weis deli. I ordered the special of the day which was the chicken parmigiana sub. I have had chicken parm subs all across the country so i was a little hesitiant at first.  When the chef came to get the chicken cutlets for my sandwich he looked at me and told me I was about to have one of the best chicken parm subs I have ever had. That man did not disappoint me in the least. I would recommend Weis to anybody. The staff was more then friendly and the chef is one hell of a cook. I will definitely be back.

xB8BFv0i_6Yv8Ztku5g51g.text: Lets start by asking why are you reading this, go eat here now. I had the ruben and was asked open or closed. I got the closed, and still had to cut it up. A moster ruben and the ice tea was fresh too. I will be back and try everything.

H14TQ1OCSoU5UlLZNYlZbw.text: I'm a big fan of big portions, a home style atmosphere and deserts. That being said Weiss definitely checks all of those off!  Weiss is a smaller place located in a strip mall. There is normally a wait when I've gone (both on weekends granted) but the service is speedy and they turn everyone pretty fast.   The sandwiches are better than your average deli but priced really well for the portion and the sit down nature. I've gotten an open faced turkey as well as a bagel brisket. Both were very good, however a slightly different style than I'm normally accustomed to, thus the 4 stars.   I normally grab a giant dessert from the to-go counter on the way out. You can't go wrong with a black/white cookie or a chocolate covered brownie.   If you want a homestyle place to eat, perfect for lunch, Weiss is your spot!

OseRURmW3uzk_yJ1ff8ryA.text: Matzoh ball soup is a whole meal by itself. The smoked whitefish salad is like mousse and so tasty if you like salmon/herring and the like. Home made pickles and killer cole slaw too.

45yG9Yta-FdViIKO-5TbWQ.text: We split a corned beef on rye and a pastrami on rye and took half of each home, they were that big. Rye bread was outstanding, meat was very good, not too fatty.  Potato salad side was excellent. Service was good.

azLSUddt5BGlPv6CFD92vQ.text: Awesome food, great tasting Their bakery goods are delicious  I am not a fan of the location, but the food is worth it!

01y-u0LAZVxF8NgdKzIDkw.text: This review is specifically for the service. We had some pretty terrible service from this mid-40s waitress whom seemed pretty annoyed to serve us (lady with blonde hair and highlights). There were 4 staff members on the floor: one bus boy, mean waitress, and 2 other girls (doing nothing, but chatting and writing things on boards).  My boyfriend and went went for a quick early dinner/snack prior to a basketball game later that evening. We arrived and it was empty except for one table which had already been served. Upon arrival, you are asked to seat yourself and grab your own menu. we sat at the booth closest to the entrance. We sat down and about 5 minutes later other guests arrive (about 3 other tables). We waited patiently as the waitress helped them out first (even though we arrived way earlier). A bus boy comes by and offers us drinks prior to our waitress arriving to us. He brings the drinks drops them and leaves. The waitress is literally taking orders from the tables right behind us from top to bottom and decides to skip us disappearing into the bar where you can't grab her attention or make eye contact. All this meanwhile we are obviously trying to catch someone's attention. In the meantime, these other two (waitresses? Idk) are just chit chatting their life away ignoring customers. We wait for another 10 minutes (a total of 15 now) The bus boy is thankfully making rounds and we call him over to let him know we had been ready to order for a while now. Bus boy tells us that he will let the waiter know , but he can't take orders.  Seriously..... what type of service is this. Anyway the waitress finally makes her way around to us 5 min after we had let the bus boy know. Takes our orders in the most (i don't want to be here type of manner) and leaves. Our food arrives and she serves me my chicken soup and later returns with my boyfriend's order. She throws the plate of food onto the table, drops a fry, and does not even apologize for dropping people's food then leaves. Later during our meal she does this walk-by asking "Is everything ok?" does not wait for our answer and leaves. Throughout our meal, we can hear her and the other 2 girls chit chatting the whole while. At the end of our meal we again have to attempt to hunt down some service staff because no one is in sight. There is no bus boy or waitress on the floor. We waited for what seems like 10 minutes and the bus boy arrives is making rounds again. We signal for the check, he brings it, and then leaves. We are in a hurry now because what seemed like plenty of time to grab some food is now-RUNNING LATE. in the meantime, the waitress is still not in sight. we have to signal the bus boy to take our check and payment. He brings back the receipt for signature without a pen. Still no waitress around. I hunt down a pen from the table the poster girls were using and use that to get done with my check.  We did not notice this type of service to the other customers.  I'm giving her the benefit of the doubt that this wasn't the case but we honestly felt racially descriminated against by the waitress.   Otherwise food is pretty good!   MESSAGE TO OWNER: service staff needs to be trained on what customer service is, unless this is the type of service your business is used to. We thought maybe people in Nevada are like this, but went around to other restaurants and did not experience this type of ratchetness.

hm2Mls40WDP09nz6QpXt8Q.text: This is our place to hang and eat. We are here pretty much every morning for breakfast. Incredible bagels, consistent service, and everything you would expect from a family owned and operated Jewish deli that makes most of its own stuff from scratch.

1fdsafV7wdtvw8bkOVo90Q.text: The food was good as always.  However, the service today was beyond terrible.   We were a party of 7 so we sat outside.  Big mistake!  We were clearly a huge inconvenience to our server.  Lucky for him Weiss must add gratuity automatically at 7 people so he didn't have to worry about ever returning to the table.  All I can say is if you go, sit inside and request anyone other than the skinny kid in the UNLV hat.  Makes me embarrassed to be a Rebel!

WjkQMWTpH9RTEPrNyHOKeg.text: Good for dining in. Do NOT try to order through a 3rd party delivery service. I ordered a pint of chicken noodle soup, not a single noodle in the pint. I ordered a whole sandwich with a side of potato salad, no potato salad. I ordered the potato pancakes (2) option though the Postmates app, I got one potato pancake. I called to inquire what happened to my order. I was met with accusatory tones, "you didn't get the potato salad?" "There's only 1 potato pancake per order." I tried to explain that on Postmates it said the order comes with 2, which I'd think any normal response would be that they would get that corrected with Postmates. Or at least for someone to offer a genuine apology for the bad experience. I did receive one, it was so thick with annoyance and sarcasm it poured out the receiver of my phone. HORRIBLE customer service skills here. I wasn't expecting someone to hop in their car and deliver me noodles and potato salad, but I was expecting someone at least pretend like they'd follow up with whoever put my order together and let them know to get their stuff together. Such a bummer because the chicken soup is so good, but it puts a terrible taste in my mouth for future dining in visits. I'll never understand why a restaurant can't appreciate their customers, like they don't need any to stay open.

ApV94C9r50fnf_sedJSsvw.text: Drove out here for lunch today based on the Yelp reviews. The food was pretty good but the service was horrible. The poor server was all by herself trying to wait on everyone and there was no way she could keep up. I won't be back.

axtATFy3w2WwhgfhxrSx_g.text: First time in since the remodel and was a little disappointed.  It didn't have that family atmosphere it used to have.  Staff was amazing as always but portions were way smaller.

uVratxO30laJRVh2giinLA.text: I have to say this place is falling off more and more. They used to be 5/5 but I bought some bagels the other day and they were already old. What happened to fresh every day? And the last time I went in the restaurant they said I could not order eggs but they could make me an Omelette for $16. OK, why not scrambled eggs then? Nope, Omelette or GTFO was basically our ultimatum based on our server's body language (hands on hips and all!). She never even went back to ask since it was barely after they stopped serving breakfast. I've had many Omelettes in my day, but I aint never had no $16 Omelette before.It was huge I'll give it that, but it did pay for the whole case of eggs so...........  Been going for years, tip really good too. But I guess they make too much money to keep people happy.

GqWXvMagpDrVF5dRMl5v5w.text: Holy MOTHER of Howard Beach! This is the ONE TRUE JEWISH DELI (I said JEWISH NOT KOSHER!) in LV, baby! GREAT food, fairly priced and more on your plate than you wil believe. Go here and expect a small wait - but it is worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Weiss Restaurant Deli Bakery - Henderson, NV, United States. Monster sandwiches, period
